### Device Settings

Guide for device settings and management.

#### Search and register slave device[‚Äã](#search-and-register-slave-device "Direct link to Search and register slave device")

You can easily expand the access control system's network by adding slave devices to CoreStation. CoreStation (master) and slave devices can be connected via RS-485, and additional devices such as Secure I/O can also be connected for use.

1. Click **CONFIGURE**.

2. Right-click on CoreStation in the Device List and click **Search Slave Device**. A list of slave devices connected to CoreStation will appear.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/config-search-slave-device1.png)

3. Select the device to register as a slave and click **Add**. Alternatively, you can select individual ports to add slave devices.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/config-search-slave-device2.png)

#### Restart device[‚Äã](#restart-device "Direct link to Restart device")

The user can restart the device.

1. Click **CONFIGURE**.

2. Right-click on CoreStation in the Device List and click **Reboot**.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/config-reboot.png)

#### Modify device settings and information[‚Äã](#modify-device-settings-and-information "Direct link to Modify device settings and information")

You can configure details for CoreStation.

1. Click **CONFIGURE**.

2. Edit the necessary fields.

3. To complete all settings and save changes, click **Apply**.

##### Information[‚Äã](#information "Direct link to Information")

![](/docs/en/img/device/config-information.png)

| Name                   | Feature description                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Name**               | You can check the device name.                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Device ID**          | You can check the device ID.                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Device Type**        | You can check the device type.                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Firmware Version**   | You can install a new version of the firmware by clicking **Firmware Upgrade** and selecting the firmware file to upgrade.                                                                                  |
| **Kernel Version**     | You can check the kernel version.                                                                                                                                                                           |
| **Hardware Version**   | You can check the hardware version.                                                                                                                                                                         |
| **Factory Default**    | You can delete all information stored on the device and reset the settings.                                                                                                                                 |
| **Restore to Default** | You can initialize the device settings.<br />- **ALL**: Initializes all settings.<br />- **without Network**: Initializes all settings except network settings.                                             |
| **Locked**             | When the device is locked due to operating conditions, you can use the **Unlock** button.                                                                                                                   |
| **Time Zone**          | You can set the device's time zone.                                                                                                                                                                         |
| **Display Date**       | You can manually set the date and time.<br />- **Get Time**: Click to retrieve the time set on the device.<br />- **Set Time**: Click to apply the time set in the CoreStation Setup Manager to the device. |

Info

The **Factory Default** menu can be used when a root certificate is stored on the device. Executing a factory reset will delete the administrator account.

##### Network[‚Äã](#network "Direct link to Network")

![](/docs/en/img/device/config-network.png)

| Name                            | Feature description                                                                                                               |
| ------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Use DHCP**                    | Select this option to set the device to use a dynamic IP address. If you select this item, a fixed IP address cannot be assigned. |
| **IP Address**                  | You can check the device's IP address.                                                                                            |
| **Gateway**                     | You can check the device's gateway.                                                                                               |
| **DNS Server Address**          | You can check the device's DNS server address.                                                                                    |
| **Subnet Mask**                 | You can check the device's subnet mask.                                                                                           |
| **Device Port**                 | Enter the port the device will use.                                                                                               |
| **Device to Server Connection** | Selecting this option allows you to enter BioStar X server information to connect the device to the server.                       |
| **Server Address**              | Enter the IP address or domain address of the BioStar X server.                                                                   |
| **Server Port**                 | Enter the port of the BioStar X server.                                                                                           |
| **RS485**                       | Only master mode is available.                                                                                                    |
| **Baud Rate**                   | You can set the transmission speed for each RS-485 port.                                                                          |

##### Authentication[‚Äã](#authentication "Direct link to Authentication")

![](/docs/en/img/device/config-auth.png)

| Name                                   | Feature description                                                                                                                                                                           |
| -------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **1<!-- -->:N<!-- --> Security Level** | You can set the security level used to authenticate fingerprints. As the security level increases, the false rejection rate (FRR) increases, while the false acceptance rate (FAR) decreases. |
| **1<!-- -->:N<!-- --> Fast Mode**      | You can set the speed of fingerprint authentication. Selecting **Auto** sets the authentication speed according to the total number of fingerprint templates enrolled on the device.          |
| **Template Format**                    | You can check the configured fingerprint template format.                                                                                                                                     |

Info

Biometric authentication is supported only on CoreStation.

##### Advanced Settings[‚Äã](#advanced-settings "Direct link to Advanced Settings")

![](/docs/en/img/device/config-advanced.png)

| Name              | Feature description                                                                                                                                                                              |
| ----------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **AC Fail**       | You can set an AUX port to monitor power input signals.                                                                                                                                          |
| **Tamper**        | You can set an AUX port for tamper notifications.                                                                                                                                                |
| **Fire**          | You can set an AUX port to monitor fire detection signals.                                                                                                                                       |
| **Configuration** | You can set CoreStation's Supervised Input port as an Input port and configure the resistor value to be used for Supervised Input. Resistor values can be set to 1 kŒ©, 2.2 kŒ©, 4.7 kŒ©, or 10 kŒ©. |
| **Secure Tamper** | In the event of tampering with the device, you can set it to delete all user information, logs, and security keys stored on the device.                                                          |


---

### Getting Started

CoreStation Setup Manager is a web server that manages the network settings of CoreStation or checks the connection status of slave devices, input and output ports, and Wiegand ports. With CoreStation Setup Manager, you can check the status of the network and wiring on-site without having to go to the BioStar X server location while configuring the access control system using CoreStation.

The following features are available in CoreStation Setup Manager.

* IP address setting

* Check CoreStation device information

* Admin settings

* Check the connection status of slave devices

* Monitor input and output, Wiegand port status

* Initialize device, excluding network settings

* Factory reset

#### Minimum requirements[‚Äã](#minimum-requirements "Direct link to Minimum requirements")

Check compatible devices and firmware versions.

* CoreStation firmware version 1.3.1 or higher

* CoreStation 20 firmware version 1.0.0 or higher

Info

* CoreStation Setup Manager is supported on CoreStation firmware version 1.3.1 or higher, and CoreStation 20 firmware version 1.0.0 or higher. If using a lower version of firmware, connect to BioStar X to upgrade the firmware to the latest version.

* For more details on how to connect and install each device, refer to the guide for the respective product.

  * [**CoreStation**](/docs/en/device/corestation_40)

  * [**CoreStation 20**](/docs/en/device/corestation_20)

* For more information on CoreStation and CoreStation Setup Manager, contact Suprema support team (<CS@suprema.co.kr>).


---

### Initial Setup of the Device

CoreStation Setup Manager provides a web-based service. Therefore, after completing the wiring to build a centralized access control system using CoreStation, you can access CoreStation Setup Manager from any location via a web browser and check the connection status of CoreStation.

If you are using CoreStation Setup Manager for the first time, connect CoreStation and proceed with the initial setup.

1. Complete the cable connection to CoreStation.

2. Please launch the web browser.

   Info

   Use a web browser version 75 or higher of Chrome.

3. Enter the default IP address `https://169.254.0.1:3001` in the address input field of the web browser.

4. Click **Download https certification** on the login screen. When accessing CoreStation Setup Manager for the first time, you need to install the certificate to use HTTPS correctly.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/initial-main.png)

5. Run the **cs\_client.crt** file.

6. When the **Open File** - **Security Warning** window appears, click **Open**.

7. In the **Certificate details** window, click **Install Certificate‚Ä¶**. The **Certificate Import Wizard** will be launched.

8. Click **Next** to continue.

9. Select the certificate store and then click **Next** ‚Üí **Finish** ‚Üí **OK**.

10. Enter your user ID and login password. The user ID and login password for the first access are both 'admin'.

11. To register the administrator account, configure each item and click **OK**.

    ![](/docs/en/img/device/initial-setup-new-user.png)

    | Name                 | Feature description                                                                                                                                      |
    | -------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
    | **ID**               | The ID is automatically set to **0** and cannot be changed.                                                                                              |
    | **Name**             | Enter the administrator's name.<br />- A name of up to 48 characters can be entered.                                                                     |
    | **Operator Level**   | The Operator Level is automatically set to **Administrator** and cannot be changed.                                                                      |
    | **Login ID**         | Enter the login ID.<br />- The login ID can be up to 32 characters long.                                                                                 |
    | **Password**         | Enter the login password.<br />- The login password should be a combination of alphanumeric characters and symbols, with a length of 7 to 32 characters. |
    | **Confirm Password** | Re-enter the login password for confirmation.                                                                                                            |

12. You will be redirected to the login screen. Log in with the registered administrator account.

Info

* The administrator account can only be set up when accessing CoreStation Setup Manager for the first time, and only one user can be designated. Once registration is complete, the default user ID and login password used during the first access can no longer be used. Additionally, the administrator account can review and edit all settings, including factory initialization.

* Starting from CoreStation Setup Manager version 1.01, the name of the **Level 1** administrator grade has been changed to **Administrator**, and **Level 2** to **Level 3** administrator accounts are no longer supported.


---

### Monitoring

You can check the real-time status of the input and output of the CoreStation after completing the wiring. You can also check the scanned card ID from the connected Wiegand reader.

Info

The number of ports that can be connected may vary depending on the CoreStation model.

#### Input port status[‚Äã](#input-port-status "Direct link to Input port status")

The connection status of the input and Aux input ports is displayed. You can check the connection status of the input port on-site right after completing the wiring.

![](/docs/en/img/device/monitoring-input.png)

#### Output port status[‚Äã](#output-port-status "Direct link to Output port status")

The connection status of the relay and output ports is displayed. Select the desired item and click the switch to control the relay and output ports.

![](/docs/en/img/device/monitoring-output.png)

#### Wiegand port status[‚Äã](#wiegand-port-status "Direct link to Wiegand port status")

When a card is scanned at the Wiegand reader connected to the Wiegand port, the corresponding card ID will appear in the **Status** column.

![](/docs/en/img/device/monitoring-wiegand.png)


---

### Settings

Guidance on how to set up the admin account and web server network settings.

#### Edit admin account[‚Äã](#edit-admin-account "Direct link to Edit admin account")

You can edit the admin account of the CoreStation Setup Manager.

1. Click **SETTINGS**.

2. Click **Admin Account** ‚Üí **Edit**.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/settings-admin-accounts.png)

3. Refer to [Initial Setup of the Device](/docs/en/device/corestation_setup_manager/initial-setup), edit each item, and then click **OK**.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/settings-edit-user.png)

4. Click **Apply** to save the settings.

#### Web server network[‚Äã](#web-server-network "Direct link to Web server network")

You can change the network information of the CoreStation Setup Manager.

1. Click **SETTINGS**.

2. Edit the necessary fields.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/settings-webserver-network.png)

   | Name            | Feature description                                                                                             |
   | --------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
   | **IP Address**  | Edit the IP address of the CoreStation Setup Manager.<br />- Only static IP can be used. DHCP is not supported. |
   | **Gateway**     | Edit the gateway of the CoreStation Setup Manager.                                                              |
   | **Subnet Mask** | Edit the subnet mask of the CoreStation Setup Manager.                                                          |

3. Click **Apply** to save the settings. The device will restart.

### Getting Started

Suprema Device Manager is a mobile application that allows configuration of Suprema's XPass D2, XPass 2, and BioEntry W3 using BLE communication.

![](/docs/en/img/device/device-manager-system-diagram1.svg)

Administrators can connect to the server from a PC or set the device's network, server, RS-485 communication, card format, keypad settings, PIN, LED, and buzzer from a mobile device without physically disconnecting it, and can also use functions such as device restart, firmware upgrade, and device setting initialization.

For XPass D2, values set once can be saved as a template for quick and easy application to multiple devices.

Info

Using Suprema Device Manager allows on-site modification of the settings of XPass D2 configured with third-party controllers.

![](/docs/en/img/device/device-manager-system-diagram2.svg)

#### Minimum requirements[‚Äã](#minimum-requirements "Direct link to Minimum requirements")

##### Mobile Device[‚Äã](#mobile-device "Direct link to Mobile Device")

Check if the mobile device supports BLE communication.

* Android 5.0 Lollipop or later

* iOS 9.0 or later

##### Device and Firmware[‚Äã](#device-and-firmware "Direct link to Device and Firmware")

Check compatible devices and firmware versions.

* [**XPass D2**](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2) firmware version 1.1.0 or later

* [**XPass 2**](/docs/en/device/xpass_2)

  * XP2-MDPB, XP2-GDPB, XP2-GKDPB: firmware version 1.0.0 or later

  * XP2-MAPB: firmware version 1.4.1 or later

  * XP2-MAPB-H: firmware version 1.4.3 or later

* [**BioEntry W3**](/docs/en/device/bioentry_w3) firmware version 1.0.1 or later

Info

* Compatible devices and firmware are subject to change.

* If the device firmware version is lower than the versions listed above, upgrade the device firmware in BioStar X. When using the device as a slave, the connected master's firmware must also be the latest version compatible with BioStar 2 2.7.0 or later.

* For more information about upgrading device firmware, please refer to [IP Device (Upgrade device firmware)](/docs/en/device/device_manager/ip-device-settings#device-firmware-upgrade), [XPass D2 (Upgrade device firmware)](/docs/en/device/device_manager/xpd2-settings#device-firmware-upgrade), or the [BioStar X Administrator Guide](/docs/en/platform/biostar_x/settings-device-upgrade-firmware).


---

### Initial Setup of the Device

Guidance on how to select a device and manage app settings.

#### Select device[‚Äã](#select-device "Direct link to Select device")

Select the device to configure using Suprema Device Manager.

You can select an IP device or XPass D2, and the options available for configuration will vary depending on the selected device.

1. Install the **Suprema Device Manager** application on the mobile device of the device manager. Suprema Device Manager is available for download from the **App Store** and **Play Store**.

2. Run the Suprema Device Manager on your mobile device.

3. Select the device to configure.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/device-manager-main.png)

#### Configuring app settings[‚Äã](#app-settings "Direct link to Configuring app settings")

You can configure the automatic device connection feature or check the app version information.

1. Run the Suprema Device Manager on your mobile device.

2. Select  on the main screen.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/device-manager-app-setting.png)

   * Auto Connect: You can enable or disable the automatic device connection feature.

   * App Version Info: You can check the current app version and license information.


---

### Set Up IP Device

You can change the settings of the IP device. You can change settings quickly and conveniently compared to changing settings via the management program on a PC or using command cards.

Info

Some settings may not apply if the device's firmware version is low. To apply all settings, refer to [Upgrade device firmware](#device-firmware-upgrade) to upgrade the firmware.

#### Change device settings[‚Äã](#change-device-settings "Direct link to Change device settings")

You can change the device's network, server, RS-485, LED and buzzer, and other settings.

Info

Biometric devices only support network and server settings.

1. Enable Bluetooth on your mobile device and run Suprema Device Manager.

2. Select the IP device from the main screen.

3. Check the device ID to select the device from the list of connectable devices, or bring the mobile device closer to the device to connect.

4. After setting the device password, press OK. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-password.svg) to display the entered password.

   Info

   * The device password can be set to a number of 6-32 characters.

   * Be careful not to lose the device password. If you lose the device password, you must initialize the device to connect to it.

5. After setting each item, press Apply Device to save.

##### Network settings[‚Äã](#network-settings "Direct link to Network settings")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-network.png)

* Port: Enter the port that the device will use.

* DHCP: Enable this to allow the device to use dynamic IP. If you enable this option, you cannot enter network information manually.

* IP Address, Gateway, Subnet: Enter the network information for the device.

* DNS: Enter the DNS server address.

##### Server[‚Äã](#server "Direct link to Server")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-server.png)

* Server Connection: You can set the server communication method. To search and connect the device from the server, select Server > Device. To set the server information to connect the device, select Device > Server.

* Server IP: Enter the server's IP address.

* Server URL: Enter the server's domain address.

* Server Port: Enter the server's port.

##### RS-485[‚Äã](#rs-485 "Direct link to RS-485")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-rs485.png)

* RS485 Mode: Set the RS-485 mode.

* Baudrate: Set the RS-485 transmission speed.

##### Others[‚Äã](#others "Direct link to Others")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-others.png)

* Memory: You can check the memory usage status.

* Secure Tamper: If a tamper event occurs on the device, it can be set to delete all stored user information, logs, and security keys. To use the security tamper feature, activate it.

##### LED / Buzzer[‚Äã](#led--buzzer "Direct link to LED / Buzzer")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/device-manager-led-buzzer.png)

* Normal: You can set the colors displayed on the device LED during normal operation.

* Scan Card: You can set the color displayed on the device LED and the number of times the buzzer sound plays when scanning a card.

* Auth Sucess: You can set the color displayed on the device LED and the number of times the buzzer sound plays upon successful authentication.

* Auth Fail: You can set the color displayed on the device LED and the number of times the buzzer sound plays upon failed authentication.

Info

* LED can be set to display a maximum of three colors in alternating patterns. Press the slot to choose a color.

* Selecting ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-cancel2.svg) skips the color sequence for that slot and displays the color set for the next slot.

#### Connect device[‚Äã](#connect-device "Direct link to Connect device")

You can search for and connect to installed IP devices nearby. When connected to Suprema Device Manager, you can upgrade the device's firmware, restart the device, initialize settings, initialize device settings excluding network settings, change the administrator password, and use various features.

1. Enable Bluetooth on your mobile device and run Suprema Device Manager.

2. Select the IP device from the main screen. A list of connectable devices will appear.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-connect.png)

3. Select a device by checking the device ID in the device list or bring your mobile device close to the device to connect.

4. Enter the connection password. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-password.svg) to display the entered password.

5. Press OK to complete the device connection.

Info

Device Filter: At the top of the device list screen, press  to set it to display only the desired devices in the list.

#### Upgrade device firmware[‚Äã](#device-firmware-upgrade "Direct link to Upgrade device firmware")

You can easily upgrade the device's firmware.

Info

* To upgrade the firmware, you need to download the firmware file to your mobile device. The latest firmware can be downloaded from the [Suprema Download Center](https://download.supremainc.com/).

* During the firmware upgrade, keep the distance between the device and mobile device within 1m.

1. Refer to [Connect device](#connect-device) to connect to the device for firmware upgrade.

2. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-option.svg) ‚Üí FW upgrade.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-fwupgrade.png)

3. Select the firmware from the path where the firmware file is saved. The firmware upgrade is in progress.

4. Press OK to complete the firmware upgrade.

#### Restart device[‚Äã](#restart-device "Direct link to Restart device")

You can restart the device.

1. Refer to [Connect device](#connect-device) to connect to the device to restart.

2. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-option.svg) ‚Üí Device Restart.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-restart.png)

3. When you restart the device, the BLE communication connection with the mobile device will be disconnected. To reconnect automatically, enable the Auto Connect feature. For detailed configuration instructions, refer to [Configuring app settings](/docs/en/device/device_manager/initial-setup#app-settings).

#### Initialize settings[‚Äã](#initialize-settings "Direct link to Initialize settings")

You can initialize device settings.

1. Refer to [Connect device](#connect-device) to connect to the device to initialize the settings.

2. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-option.svg) ‚Üí Restore to Default.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-restore-default.png)

3. If you initialize the device, all settings applied to the device will be restored to factory defaults. Press OK to continue.

#### Initialize device settings excluding network[‚Äã](#initialize-device-settings-excluding-network "Direct link to Initialize device settings excluding network")

You can initialize device settings excluding network settings.

1. Refer to [Connect device](#connect-device) to connect to the device to initialize device settings excluding network settings.

2. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-option.svg) ‚Üí Restore to Default without network settings.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-restore-default-network.png)

3. If you initialize device settings excluding network, the remaining settings excluding the network will be initialized. Press OK to continue.

#### Change device password[‚Äã](#change-device-password "Direct link to Change device password")

You can change the device's password.

1. Refer to [Connect device](#connect-device) to connect to the device to change password.

2. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-option.svg) ‚Üí Change Password.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/ip-device-change-password.png)

3. Enter the current password and the new password you will use.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/device-manager-change-password.png)

4. Press OK to complete the password change.

Info

* The device password can be set to a number of 6-32 characters.

* Be careful not to lose the device password. If you lose the device password, you must initialize the device to connect to it.


---

### Set Up XPass D2

You can configure settings to apply to XPass D2 as a template and then directly apply them to individual devices. You can apply settings much faster than by accessing the management program on a PC or using command cards.

Info

Some settings may not apply if the device's firmware version is low. To apply all settings, refer to [Upgrade device firmware](#device-firmware-upgrade) to upgrade the firmware.

#### Add template[‚Äã](#template-add "Direct link to Add template")

You can set RS-485 communication, card format, keypad settings, PIN, LED, and buzzer before adding them as a template. Adding a template allows you to quickly and easily apply settings without configuring each individual device every time.

1. Run the Suprema Device Manager on your mobile device.

2. Select XPass D2 on the main screen.

3. Tap Template Management ‚Üí ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add.svg).

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-add.png)

4. Select the device model for which you want to create the template.

5. After configuring each item, click Save to save the template.

Info

You can add up to 100 templates.

##### Set Template Name and Admin Password[‚Äã](#set-template-name-and-admin-password "Direct link to Set Template Name and Admin Password")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-name-pw.png)

* Template Name: Enter the desired template name.

* Admin Password: Enter the administrator password.

Info

* The administrator password can be set to 6-32 digits.

* Be careful not to lose the administrator password. If you lose the administrator password, you will need to initialize the device to connect to the device with the applied template.

* For more information on changing the administrator password, refer to [Change admin password](#admin-password-change).

##### Interface[‚Äã](#interface "Direct link to Interface")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-interface.png)

* OSDP: Set the OSDP address to be used in communication between the device and the master device. Can be set to numbers from 0~126.

* Baudrate: Set the RS-485 transmission speed.

##### Authentication[‚Äã](#authentication "Direct link to Authentication")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-auth-cardtype.png)

* Card Type: You can set the type of card to be used by the device.

  * CSN Card: You can select the CSN card type and set the byte order.

  * Suprema Smart Card Layout: You can select the types of smart cards issued by Suprema.

  * Custom Smart Card Layout: You can select the types of smart cards issued by third parties.

  * Mobile: You can set the mobile card type.

Info

When set to MSB, card data is processed in left-to-right order, sequentially processing from large byte to small byte order when saving the card's serial number (CSN). LSB processes the card's serial number (CSN) from small byte to large byte order when saving it.

##### Wiegand Card Format[‚Äã](#wiegand-card-format "Direct link to Wiegand Card Format")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-wiegand-card.png)

* Format: You can set the Wiegand card format to be specified for the device. The card data is processed according to the set format.

  * New Wiegand Format: If the desired format is not available, you can click  to add a new Wiegand format.

    ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-wiegand-card-new.png)

    * Name: Enter the name of the desired Wiegand format.

    * Total Bits: Enter the total number of bits.

    * ID field: Enter the start and end bits of the ID you wish to use. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add3.svg) Add to add an ID field.

    * Parity field: Enter the position of the parity field and the start and end bits you wish to use. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add3.svg) Add to add a parity field.

      Info

      To add a parity field, enter the total bits.

* Pulse width (Œºs): You can set the pulse width of the Wiegand signal.

* Pulse interval (Œºs): You can set the pulse interval of the Wiegand signal.

##### Suprema Smart Card Layout[‚Äã](#suprema-smart-card-layout "Direct link to Suprema Smart Card Layout")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-suprema-card.png)

* Secondary Key: You can set whether to use the auxiliary site key. By setting the auxiliary site key, you can use it for authentication when the card's main key does not match.

* MIFARE: You can set up MIFARE cards.

  * Encryption Type: You can set the encryption type to Crypto-1 or AES-128.

  * Primary Key: The key that encrypts communication between smart cards and the device.

  * Secondary Key: You can use it to authenticate when the card's main site key does not match. The auxiliary site key field is only displayed when Secondary Key from the previous depth is activated.

  * Start Block Index: Select the starting block where each template will be stored. This block is the index of the block where user information is stored; set it to a storable block if the user is already using the smart card. Can only be set for MIFARE.

* DESFire: You can set up DESFire cards.

  * DESFire Advanced: You can use DESFire cards issued by third parties. Only DESCire can be configured.

  * Primary Key: The key that encrypts communication between smart cards and the device.

  * Secondary Key: You can use it to authenticate when the card's main site key does not match. The auxiliary site key field is only displayed when Secondary Key from the previous depth is activated.

  * App ID: Set the application ID. Serves as a kind of directory that includes a file ID. Only DESCire can be configured.

  * File ID: Set the file ID. Only DESCire can be configured.

  * Encryption Type: You can set the encryption type to DES/3DES or AES.

* Output Byte Order: You can set the byte order for smart card output.

Info

* To use DESFire Advanced, please accurately enter the information for App Master Key, App Master Key Index, File Read Access Key, File Read Access Key Index, App ID, File ID, Encryption Type.

* App Master Key, File Read Access Key can only accept up to 32 bytes of hexadecimal.

* When set to MSB, card data is processed in left-to-right order, sequentially processing from large byte to small byte order when saving the card's serial number (CSN). LSB processes the card's serial number (CSN) from small byte to large byte order when saving it.

##### Custom Smart Card Layout[‚Äã](#custom-smart-card-layout "Direct link to Custom Smart Card Layout")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-custom-card.png)

* Secondary Key: You can set whether to use the auxiliary site key. By setting the auxiliary site key, you can use it for authentication when the card's main key does not match.

* MIFARE: You can set up MIFARE cards.

  * Encryption Type: You can set the encryption type to Crypto-1 or AES-128.

  * Primary Key: The key that encrypts communication between smart cards and the device.

  * Secondary Key: You can use it to authenticate when the card's main site key does not match. The auxiliary site key field is only displayed when Secondary Key from the previous depth is activated.

  * Block Index: Select the starting block where each template will be stored. This block is the index of the block where user information is stored; set it to a storable block if the user is already using the smart card. Can only be set for MIFARE.

  * Skip Bytes: You can set the starting point for reading the card number.

  * Data Size: (If the set values of Primary Key and Secondary Key are the same as the values of the card) You can set the size of the data to read from the card.

* DESFire: You can set up DESFire cards.

  * DESFire Advanced: You can use DESFire cards issued by third parties. Only DESCire can be configured.

  * Primary Key: The key that encrypts communication between smart cards and the device.

  * Secondary Key: You can use it to authenticate when the card's main site key does not match. The auxiliary site key field is only displayed when Secondary Key from the previous depth is activated.

  * App ID: Set the application ID. Serves as a kind of directory that includes a file ID. Only DESCire can be configured.

  * File ID: Set the file ID. Only DESCire can be configured.

  * Encryption Type: You can set the encryption type to DES/3DES or AES.

  * Skip Bytes: You can set the starting point for reading the card number.

  * Data Size: (If the set values of Primary Key and Secondary Key are the same as the values of the card) You can set the size of the data to read from the card.

* Byte Order: You can set the byte order for smart card output.

Info

* To use DESFire Advanced, please accurately enter the information for App Master Key, App Master Key Index, File Read Access Key, File Read Access Key Index, App ID, File ID, Encryption Type.

* App Master Key, File Read Access Key can only accept up to 32 bytes of hexadecimal.

* When set to MSB, card data is processed in left-to-right order, sequentially processing from large byte to small byte order when saving the card's serial number (CSN). LSB processes the card's serial number (CSN) from small byte to large byte order when saving it.

##### Keypad Setting[‚Äã](#keypad-setting "Direct link to Keypad Setting")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-keypad.png)

* Keypad: You can set whether to use the keypad. When the keypad is activated, you can authenticate by entering the card ID using the keypad.

* Single key input: Each time you press a key while entering the card ID on the keypad, the value will be sent.

* Buffered key input: When entering the card ID on the keypad, all keys need to be pressed, and then press the `#` key to send the entire value at once.

* Blink LED for PIN after tagging card: When the device's authentication mode is set to card + PIN, pressing the card will activate the LED to prompt the user to enter the PIN.

* Backlight: You can turn the keypad backlight on or off.

Info

* Keypad Setting is only displayed on the template setting screen of the XPD2-GKDB device.

* Backlight is only supported on XPD2-GKDB hardware V02M and firmware version v1.7.1 or higher.

* Values entered through the keypad are transmitted in 4-bit units by default. Card IDs entered through the keypad are sent in the same format as the Wiegand card format.

##### Others[‚Äã](#others "Direct link to Others")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-others.png)

* Secure Tamper: You can set it so that when a tamper event occurs in the device, the security key stored in the device will be deleted. To use the security tamper feature, activate it.

##### LED / Buzzer[‚Äã](#led--buzzer "Direct link to LED / Buzzer")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/device-manager-led-buzzer.png)

* Normal: You can set the colors displayed on the device LED during normal operation.

* Scan Card: You can set the color displayed on the device LED and the number of times the buzzer sound plays when scanning a card.

* Auth Sucess: You can set the color displayed on the device LED and the number of times the buzzer sound plays upon successful authentication.

* Auth Fail: You can set the color displayed on the device LED and the number of times the buzzer sound plays upon failed authentication.

Info

* LED can be set to display a maximum of three colors in alternating patterns. Press the slot to choose a color.

* Selecting ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-cancel2.svg) skips the color sequence for that slot and displays the color set for the next slot.

#### Apply template[‚Äã](#apply-template "Direct link to Apply template")

The added templates can be applied uniformly to multiple devices via BLE communication.

Info

Some settings may not apply if the device's firmware version is low. To apply all settings, refer to [Upgrade device firmware](#device-firmware-upgrade) to upgrade the firmware.

1. Enable Bluetooth on your mobile device and run Suprema Device Manager.

2. Select XPass D2 on the main screen.

3. Click Choose a template. A list of available templates will appear.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-choose-select.png)

4. Select the desired template from the list of templates.

5. Click Start to continue.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-choose-select-start.png)

6. Make sure the back of your mobile device touches the device to which you want to apply the template.

7. Once the template application is complete, click OK.

Info

* Settings changed using Suprema Device Manager are only applied to the device and will not be synchronized with the server.

* If the device is connected to the master device or if the Wiegand output settings have changed, it cannot be connected to Suprema Device Manager with the main key. To connect with Suprema Device Manager, you must initialize the device.

#### Manage templates[‚Äã](#manage-templates "Direct link to Manage templates")

##### Edit template[‚Äã](#edit-template "Direct link to Edit template")

1. Run the Suprema Device Manager on your mobile device.

2. Select XPass D2 on the main screen.

3. Click Template Management.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-select.png)

4. Select the template you want to edit from the list of templates.

5. Refer to [Add template](#template-add) to edit the template.

6. To save the changed settings, click Save; to save as a new template, click Save as new template.

##### Delete template[‚Äã](#delete-template "Direct link to Delete template")

1. Run the Suprema Device Manager on your mobile device.

2. Select XPass D2 on the main screen.

3. Click Template Management.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-select.png)

4. Select the template you wish to delete from the list of templates.

5. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-delete.svg) ‚Üí OK to delete a template.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-select-del.png)

##### Export template[‚Äã](#export-template "Direct link to Export template")

You can export templates for XPass D2 settings from the app.

1. Run the Suprema Device Manager on your mobile device.

2. Select XPass D2 on the main screen.

3. Click Template Management.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-export1.png)

4. At the top of the template list, tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu1.svg) and select Template Export.

5. After selecting the template to export, tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-check.svg).

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-export2.png)

Info

Templates will be saved in the *DeviceManager\_TemplateFiles* folder created in the same location as the Suprema Device Manager application installation file.

##### Import template[‚Äã](#import-template "Direct link to Import template")

You can import templates for XPass D2 settings into the app.

1. Run the Suprema Device Manager on your mobile device.

2. Select XPass D2 on the main screen.

3. Click Template Management.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-import.png)

4. At the top of the template list, tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu1.svg) and select Template Import.

5. Select the template you want to import from the folder where the templates are stored.

Info

Templates will be saved in the *DeviceManager\_TemplateFiles* folder created in the same location as the Suprema Device Manager application installation file.

#### Search and connect device[‚Äã](#device-search-connect "Direct link to Search and connect device")

You can search for and connect to XPass D2 installed nearby. By connecting to Suprema Device Manager, you can upgrade the firmware of the device or use features such as restarting the device or changing the template password.

1. Enable Bluetooth on your mobile device and run Suprema Device Manager.

2. Select XPass D2 on the main screen.

3. Click Search Device. A list of connectable devices will appear.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-search-device-select.png)

4. Select a device by checking the device ID in the device list or bring your mobile device close to the device to connect.

5. Enter the connection password. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-password.svg) to display the entered password.

6. Press OK to complete the device connection.

#### Upgrade device firmware[‚Äã](#device-firmware-upgrade "Direct link to Upgrade device firmware")

You can easily upgrade the device's firmware.

Info

* To upgrade the firmware, you need to download the firmware file to your mobile device. The latest firmware can be downloaded from the [Suprema Download Center](https://download.supremainc.com/).

* During the firmware upgrade, keep the distance between the device and mobile device within 1m.

1. Refer to [Search and connect device](#device-search-connect) to connect to the device you want to upgrade the firmware.

2. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-option.svg) ‚Üí FW upgrade.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-fwupgrade.png)

3. Select the firmware from the path where the firmware file is saved. The firmware upgrade is in progress.

4. Press OK to complete the firmware upgrade.

#### Restart device[‚Äã](#restart-device "Direct link to Restart device")

You can restart the device.

1. Refer to [Search and connect device](#device-search-connect) to connect to the device you want to restart.

2. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-option.svg) ‚Üí Device Restart.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-restart.png)

3. When you restart the device, the BLE communication connection with the mobile device will be disconnected. To reconnect automatically, enable the Auto Connect feature. For detailed configuration instructions, refer to [Configuring app settings](/docs/en/device/device_manager/initial-setup#app-settings).

#### Change admin password[‚Äã](#admin-password-change "Direct link to Change admin password")

You can change the admin password of the template.

1. Refer to [Search and connect device](#device-search-connect) to connect to the device with the template where you want to change the password.

2. Tap ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-option.svg) ‚Üí Change Password.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-template-management-password.png)

3. Enter the current password and the new password you will use.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/device-manager-change-password.png)

4. Press OK to complete the password change.

Info

* The administrator password can be set to 6-32 digits.

* Be careful not to lose the administrator password. If you lose the administrator password, you will need to initialize the device to connect to the device with the applied template.

### Door Interface

Door Interface is a robust 2-door, 4-reader interface designed for reliable access control. Easily integrates with the CoreStation series, allowing flexible door control via RS-485 communication with minimal wiring. Additionally, it provides reliable access control even in offline mode.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/di24-main.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doorinterface/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

#### [Getting Started‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doorinterface/getting-started)

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### [Installation‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doorinterface/installation)

Provides the complete process and connection examples required for product installation.

#### [Product Specifications‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doorinterface/product-specifications)

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

#### [Regulatory Information‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doorinterface/regulatory-information)

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

#### [Appendices‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doorinterface/appendices)

Includes legal notices contained in the product.

* You must not rely on the absence or characteristics of any features or instructions marked "reserved" or "undefined." Suprema reserves these for future definition and shall have no responsibility whatsoever for conflicts or incompatibilities arising from future changes to them.

* Contact your local Suprema sales office or your distributor to obtain the latest specifications and before placing your product order.

### Getting Started

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### Components[‚Äã](#components "Direct link to Components")

|                                                       |                                                    |
| ----------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-device-di24.svg)    | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-quick-guide.svg) |
|                                                       | Quick Guide                                        |
|                                                       | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-oss-guide.svg)   |
| Door Interface                                        | Open Source Software Guide                         |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-fixing-screws6.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-diode4.svg)      |
| Fixing Screw x6                                       | Diode x4                                           |

<!-- -->

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/device/product-part-di24.svg)

| No. | Name                                                     |
| --- | -------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1   | **AUX IN (0:2)** connection                              |
| 2   | **RS-485** connection                                    |
| 3   | **RS-485** termination resistor switch                   |
| 4   | **SUPERVISED INPUT (3:5)** or **Input (3:5)** connection |
| 5   | **RELAY 2 (Alarm)** connection                           |
| 6   | **OUTPUT (3:5)** connection                              |
| 7   | **RS-485 1** termination resistor switch                 |
| 8   | **WIEGAND 1** connection                                 |
| 9   | **RS-485 1** connection                                  |
| 10  | **RELAY 3 (Lock)** connection                            |
| 11  | Power connection for Door Interface (DC 12V / DC 24V IN) |
| 12  | **RESET** button                                         |
| 13  | **INIT** button                                          |
| 14  | **RELAY 1 (Lock)** connection                            |
| 15  | **WIEGAND 0** connection                                 |
| 16  | **RS-485 0** connection                                  |
| 17  | **RS-485 0** termination resistor switch                 |
| 18  | **OUTPUT (0:2)** connection                              |
| 19  | **RELAY 0 (Alarm)** connection                           |
| 20  | **SUPERVISED INPUT (0:2)** or **Input (0:2)** connection |

Info

* Press the **INIT** button for more than 2 seconds after initializing the product linked to the device to connect it to another device.

* Press the **RESET** button to reboot the product.

* You can use the product's reader power output (12 Vdc, up to 0.6 A / 24 Vdc, up to 0.3 A) as power for the reader when connecting the product to the reader. You can connect two readers consuming 0.3 A based on 12 Vdc power output.

##### Door Interface status LED[‚Äã](#door-interface-status-led "Direct link to Door Interface status LED")

The product's status can be checked at the STATUS located on the right side of the front of the product, displaying the status of Ethernet, RS-485, RS-485 0, RS-485 1, in order every second.

| Item     | LED                     | Status                                                                    |
| -------- | ----------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| RS-485   | Magenta/blue blinking   | Master device normal                                                      |
|          | Magenta/yellow blinking | Master device disconnected                                                |
| RS-485 0 | Yellow/blue blinking    | Slave device normal                                                       |
|          | Yellow/yellow blinking  | Slave device disconnected                                                 |
|          | Yellow/red blinking     | No slave device                                                           |
| RS-485 1 | Green/blue blinking     | Slave device normal                                                       |
|          | Green/yellow blinking   | Slave device disconnected                                                 |
|          | Green/red blinking      | No slave device                                                           |
| System   | White/white blinking    | System lock (BioStar X's operational conditions and behavior) + Tamper on |
|          | White/magenta blinking  | System lock (Device's operational conditions and behavior) + Tamper on    |
|          | White/blue blinking     | Tamper on                                                                 |
|          | White/cyan blinking     | BioStar X connection successful + Tamper on                               |
|          | White/green blinking    | BioStar X connection successful                                           |
|          | White/yellow blinking   | System lock (BioStar X's operational conditions and behavior)             |
|          | White/red blinking      | System lock (Device's operational conditions and behavior)                |

##### Installation example[‚Äã](#installation-example "Direct link to Installation example")

This product can easily configure up to 2 access doors as an extension module.

When integrated with BioStar X, both access control and attendance management can be utilized, providing various interfaces such as RS-485 (OSDP), Wiegand, supervised input, and AUX.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-example-di24.png)

##### System diagram[‚Äã](#system-diagram "Direct link to System diagram")

This product supports 3 RS-485 ports, and by daisy-chaining multiple Door Interfaces to the master device, you can configure up to 34 doors.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/system-configuration-di24.png)

Info

* Up to 2 devices can be connected per port for RS-485 0 and RS-485 1.

* If more than 3 devices are connected to a single RS-485 port, the desired device may not appear in the connectable list when searching for slave devices.

* When connecting the Door Interface as a slave to the host port of the master device, you can open access doors by identifying the facility code of the card through the Facility Code for Offline Mode, even if the connection with the master device is lost for the slave devices connected to the Door Interface.

##### Overall connection diagram[‚Äã](#overall-connection-diagram "Direct link to Overall connection diagram")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/system-di24.svg)


---

### Installation

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### Product Fixation[‚Äã](#product-fixation "Direct link to Product Fixation")

Secure the product tightly with a fixing screw at the location to be mounted.

![](/docs/en/img/device/device-fix-di24.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Power Supply Connection[‚Äã](#power-supply-connection "Direct link to Power Supply Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-power-connection-di24.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

* Make sure to use separate power for the reader and products.

- Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/doorinterface/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

Info

It is recommended to connect and use an Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) to prevent power failure.

##### Power-specific reader and lock power specifications[‚Äã](#power-specific-reader-and-lock-power-specifications "Direct link to Power-specific reader and lock power specifications")

| Power  | Reader (maximum current, number of devices) | Lock (maximum current, number of devices) |
| ------ | ------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------- |
| DC 12V | 600mA (300mA x 2)                           | 1.2A (600mA x 2)                          |
| DC 24V | 300mA (150mA x 2)                           | 600mA (300mA x 2)                         |

##### Maximum extension length by cable specification[‚Äã](#maximum-extension-length-by-cable-specification "Direct link to Maximum extension length by cable specification")

The distance that can be connected may vary depending on the cable specifications and installation environment used for power connection. If cable connections are made improperly it may cause the device to malfunction. This product supports both DC 12V and DC 24V power supplies, so check the maximum extension length according to each cable specification and connect the power correctly.

| Cable Specification | DC 12V         |              | DC 24V         |              |
| ------------------- | -------------- | ------------ | -------------- | ------------ |
|                     | Reader (300mA) | Lock (600mA) | Reader (150mA) | Lock (300mA) |
| 14 AWG              | 380 m          | 190 m        | 1540 m         | 770 m        |
| 16 AWG              | 240 m          | 120 m        | 960 m          | 480 m        |
| 18 AWG              | 150 m          | 75 m         | 600 m          | 300 m        |

#### RS-485 Connection[‚Äã](#rs-485-connection "Direct link to RS-485 Connection")

This product supports 3 RS-485 ports, and by daisy-chaining multiple Door Interfaces to the master device, you can configure up to 34 doors.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-rs485-connection-di24.svg)

Info

* The maximum number of slave devices that can be connected to the product's RS-485 port is 4.

* Up to 2 devices can be connected per port for RS-485 0 and RS-485 1.

* If more than 3 devices are connected to a single RS-485 port, the desired device may not appear in the connectable list when searching for slave devices.

* Use AWG26 or larger for RS-485 cables, and all wiring must comply with ANSI/NFPA 70 standards.

* Use an AWG24 twisted pair with a maximum length of 1.2 km for the RS-485 cable.

* It is recommended to use RS-485 cables with a characteristic impedance of 120 Œ©.

* Connect termination resistors (120 Œ©) at both ends of the RS-485 daisy chain connection. If connected to the middle line, the signal level becomes smaller and the communication performance will deteriorate. Make sure to connect it to both ends of the daisy chain connection. Set this product's termination resistor switch to ON.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Relay Connection[‚Äã](#relay-connection "Direct link to Relay Connection")

The product has two types of relay ports‚ÄîAlarm and Lock‚Äîeach of which can be used for specific purposes.

* **Alarm**: Can be connected to devices that generate warning sounds or intrusion alerts, such as warning lights, sirens, or buzzers.

* **Lock**: Can be connected to devices for door locking and unlocking, such as electric strike locks or magnetic locks.

Caution

When using a magnetic lock, connect the lock power directly.

<!-- -->

##### Fail Safe Lock[‚Äã](#fail-safe-lock "Direct link to Fail Safe Lock")

In order to use the Fail Safe Lock, connect the **NC** relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally a current flowing through the relay for the Fail Safe Lock. When the relay is activated, blocking the current flow, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will open.

Info

Install a diode near both sides of the door lock wiring as shown in the figure to protect the relay from the reverse current that occurs when the door lock operates. Make sure to connect the Cathode (direction to the stripe) to the + part of the power while paying attention to the direction of the diode.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-safe-lock-cs20.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

When using a magnetic lock, directly connect the lock power to the **GND** and \*VOUT\*\* of the Lock ports as shown in the figure below.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-safe-lock-magnetic-cs20.png)

Caution

Only magnetic locks can be used when connecting the lock power directly.

##### Fail Secure Lock[‚Äã](#fail-secure-lock "Direct link to Fail Secure Lock")

In order to use the Fail Secure Lock, connect **NO** relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally no current flowing through the relay for the Fail Secure Lock. When the current flow is activated by the relay, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will lock.

Info

Install a diode near both sides of the door lock wiring as shown in the figure to protect the relay from the reverse current that occurs when the door lock operates. Make sure to connect the Cathode (direction to the stripe) to the + part of the power while paying attention to the direction of the diode.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-secure-lock-cs20.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

When using a magnetic lock, directly connect the lock power to the **GND** and \*VOUT\*\* of the Lock ports as shown in the figure below.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-secure-lock-magnetic-cs20.png)

Caution

Only magnetic locks can be used when connecting the lock power directly.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Wiegand Connection[‚Äã](#wiegand-connection "Direct link to Wiegand Connection")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wiegand-in-connection-cs20.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Door sensor and exit button[‚Äã](#door-sensor-and-exit-button "Direct link to Door sensor and exit button")

SUPERVISED INPUT ports No. 0 - No. 5 can be set to be used for normal Input or Supervised Input.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-door-senser-rte-connection-cs20.png)

Info

The SUPERVISED INPUT **Alarm** port can be used by connecting 1 kŒ©, 2.2 kŒ©, 4.7 kŒ©, or 10 kŒ© resistors. After connecting the appropriate resistor to the input device, set the resistor value the same in BioStar X.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### AUX IN[‚Äã](#aux-in "Direct link to AUX IN")

<!-- -->

You can connect a power failure detector, tamper, or fire detector to the AUX IN port.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-aux-in-connection-cs20.png)

#### General[‚Äã](#specs.general)

Model Name

DI-24

CPU

1.2 GHz Single Core

Memory

4 GB Flash + 256 MB RAM

Crypto Chip

Supported

LED

* POWER: RED single-color
* STATUS: Multi-color

Operating Temperature

0 ¬∞C ~ 50 ¬∞C

Storage Temperature

-40 ¬∞C ~ 70 ¬∞C

Operating Humidity

0 % ~ 80 %, non-condensing

Storage Humidity

0 % ~ 95 %, non-condensing

Operational Ambient Conditions

0 ¬∞C ~ 49 ¬∞C

Certifications

CE, UKCA, KC, FCC, RCM, IC, RoHS, REACH, WEEE, EAC

#### Capacity[‚Äã](#specs.storage)

Max. Text logs

400

<!-- -->

#### Interfaces[‚Äã](#specs.interface)

RS-485

3 ch

RS-485 Communication Protocol

OSDP V2 compliant

Wiegand

2 ch

Relay

4 relays

Input

6 ch

[](#anno1)

Output

6 ch

Supervised Input

6 ch[](#anno1)

AUX Input

3 ch (AC POWER FAIL, Tamper, Fire)

#### Electrical[‚Äã](#specs.power)

Power

12 Vdc

Current: Max. 2.8 A

24 Vdc

Current: Max. 1.4 A

Power Output

12 Vdc

* Reader: Max. 0.6 A (0.3 A x 2)
* Lock: Max. 1.2 A (0.6 A x 2)

24 Vdc

* Reader: Max. 0.3 A (0.15 A x 2)
* Lock: Max. 0.6 A (0.3 A x 2)

Switch Input VIH

* Max.: 5 V
* Min.: 3 V

Switch Input VIL

Max.: 1 V

Relay

5 A @ 30 VDC Resistive load

#### FCC Compliance Information[‚Äã](#fcc-compliance-information "Direct link to FCC Compliance Information")

THIS DEVICE COMPLIES WITH PART 15 OF THE FCC RULES.

Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

1. This device may not cause harmful interference, and

2. This device must accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation.

Info

This equipment has been tested and found to comply with the limits for a <!-- -->Class A<!-- --> digital device, pursuant to part 15 of the FCC Rules. These limits are designed to provide reasonable protection against harmful interference when the equipment is operated in a commercial environment. This equipment generates, uses, and can radiate radio frequency energy and, if not installed and used in accordance with the instruction manual, may cause harmful interference to radio communications. Operation of this equipment in a residential area is likely to cause harmful interference in which case the user will be required to correct the interference at his own expense.

Any changes or modifications not expressly approved by the party responsible for compliance could void the user‚Äôs authority to operate this equipment.

This transmitter must not be co-located or operating in conjunction with any other antenna or transmitter.

This equipment complies with FCC radiation exposure limits set forth for an uncontrolled environment. This equipment should be installed and operated with minimum distance 20 cm between the radiator and your body. Do not install or operate this device and its antenna in conjunction with any other antenna or RF transmission device.

### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

<!-- -->

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

**Before connecting the power to the product, check the manual again to ensure that wiring is correct, then connect the power**.

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

**Do not leave power cables in passageways**.

* May cause bodily injury or product damage.

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Use a power adapter that has IEC/EN 62368-1 approval and is rated above the power consumption of the terminal device**. **It is recommended to use the power adapters sold by Suprema**.

* Using an unsuitable power supply may cause devices to malfunction.

* Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/doorinterface/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Ensure the power supply is not interrupted during firmware upgrades of the product**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not press the product's buttons (touchpad) forcefully or use sharp tools to press them**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Use the product within <!-- -->0 ¬∞C ~ 50 ¬∞C<!-- --> and store it at appropriate temperatures, not too low or too high**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.

### Door Module

The Door Module controls up to 2 access points through encrypted communication and provides 2 Wiegand reader interfaces for integration with third-party readers. The Door Module can be utilized in various system configurations through multiple I/O interfaces.

![](/docs/en/img/device/doormodule-main.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doormodule/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

#### [Getting Started‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doormodule/getting-started)

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### [Installation‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doormodule/installation)

Provides the complete process and connection examples required for product installation.

#### [Product Specifications‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doormodule/product-specifications)

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

#### [Regulatory Information‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doormodule/regulatory-information)

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

#### [Appendices‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/doormodule/appendices)

Includes legal notices contained in the product.

* Suprema products are not intended for use in medical, lifesaving, life-sustaining applications, or other applications in which the failure of the Suprema product could create a situation where personal injury or death may occur. Should you purchase or use Suprema products for any such unintended or unauthorized application, you shall indemnify and hold Suprema and its officers, employees, subsidiaries, affiliates, and distributors harmless against all claims, costs, damages, and expenses, and reasonable attorney fees arising out of, directly or indirectly, any claim of personal injury or death associated with such unintended or unauthorized use, even if such claim alleges that Suprema was negligent regarding the design or manufacture of the part.

* Personal information, in the form of authentication messages and other relative information, may be stored within Suprema products during usage. Suprema does not take responsibility for any information, including personal information, stored within Suprema‚Äôs products that are not within Suprema‚Äôs direct control or as stated by the relevant terms and conditions. When any stored information, including personal information, is used, it is the responsibility of the product users to comply with national legislation (such as GDPR) and to ensure proper handling and processing.

* You must not rely on the absence or characteristics of any features or instructions marked "reserved" or "undefined." Suprema reserves these for future definition and shall have no responsibility whatsoever for conflicts or incompatibilities arising from future changes to them.

* Except as expressly set forth herein, to the maximum extent permitted by law, the Suprema products are sold "as is".

* Contact your local Suprema sales office or your distributor to obtain the latest specifications and before placing your product order.
