### Getting Started

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### Components[‚Äã](#components "Direct link to Components")

|                                                    |                                                          |
| -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-device-dm20.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-wall-bracket-dm20.svg) |
|                                                    | Wall Bracket                                             |
|                                                    | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-resistor.svg)          |
| Door Module                                        | 120 Œ© Resistor                                           |

|                                                     |                                                       |                                                |                                               |
| --------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-pvc-anchors4.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-fixing-screws4.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-spacer4.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-diode4.svg) |
| PVC Anchor x4                                       | Fixing Screw x4                                       | Spacer x4                                      | Diode x4                                      |

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/name-function-each-part-dm20.svg)

Info

* Press the **INIT** button for more than 2 seconds after initializing the product linked to the device to connect it to another device.

* Press the **RESET** button to reboot the product.

* Refer to the LED status below when using Supervised Input.

  * Orange: Short Circuit

  * Red: Short

  * Green: On

  * Off: Off

##### Installation example[‚Äã](#installation-example "Direct link to Installation example")

This product supports various inputs and outputs as well as Wiegand connections, enhancing scalability with Suprema devices and third-party devices.

Supervised Input is also available, which can check for short circuit, short, On, and Off status.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-example-dm20.png)


---

### Installation

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### Use bracket[‚Äã](#use-bracket "Direct link to Use bracket")

1. Secure the bracket tightly using the fixing screws at the location where the product will be mounted.

   Info

   If installing the product on a concrete wall, drill a hole, insert a PVC anchor, and secure it with a fixing screw.

2. Mount the product on the fixed bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-mounting-bracket-fix-dm20.svg)

#### Use spacer[‚Äã](#use-spacer "Direct link to Use spacer")

Secure the product tightly using spacers and fixing screws at the position where the product will be mounted.

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-mounting-spacer-fix-dm20.svg)

Info

If installing the product on a concrete wall, drill a hole, insert a PVC anchor, and secure it with a fixing screw.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Power Supply Connection[‚Äã](#power-supply-connection "Direct link to Power Supply Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-power-connection-dm20.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

* Make sure to use separate power for the access control device and products.

- Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/doormodule/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

* Use a separate power supply for Secure I/O 2, the electric lock, and the product respectively. If connecting and using the power supply to these devices together, the devices may malfunction.

- DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

<!-- -->

#### RS-485 Connection[‚Äã](#rs-485-connection "Direct link to RS-485 Connection")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-rs485-connection-dm20.png)

Info

* Use an AWG24 twisted pair with a maximum length of 1.2 km for the RS-485 cable.

* It is recommended to use RS-485 cables with a characteristic impedance of 120 Œ©.

* If connecting with a RS-485 daisy chain, connect the termination resistor (120 Œ©) to both ends of the daisy chain connection. If connected to the middle line, the signal level becomes smaller and the communication performance will deteriorate. Make sure to connect it to both ends of the daisy chain connection.

* You can connect up to 31 card readers with the product, and up to 7 biometric devices can be connected in combination with 24 card readers.

* If XPass or XPass 2 is connected to the master device, only card authentication can be used.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Relay Connection[‚Äã](#relay-connection "Direct link to Relay Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

##### Fail Safe Lock[‚Äã](#fail-safe-lock "Direct link to Fail Safe Lock")

In order to use the Fail Safe Lock, connect the **NC** relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally a current flowing through the relay for the Fail Safe Lock. When the relay is activated, blocking the current flow, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will open.

Info

Connect a diode to both ends of the power input as shown in the figure below when installing a deadbolt or a door strike. Make sure to connect the Cathode (direction to the stripe) to the + part of the power while paying attention to the direction of the diode.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-safe-lock-dm20.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

##### Fail Secure Lock[‚Äã](#fail-secure-lock "Direct link to Fail Secure Lock")

In order to use the Fail Secure Lock, connect **NO** relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally no current flowing through the relay for the Fail Secure Lock. When the current flow is activated by the relay, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will lock.

Info

Connect a diode to both ends of the power input as shown in the figure below when installing a deadbolt or a door strike. Make sure to connect the Cathode (direction to the stripe) to the + part of the power while paying attention to the direction of the diode.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-secure-lock-dm20.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Wiegand Connection[‚Äã](#wiegand-connection "Direct link to Wiegand Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Connect the product to a 12 V, 3.1 A power supply when connecting a Wiegand device.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wiegand-in-connection-dm20.png)

Info

You can use a 12 V, up to 1.5 A power supply when connecting a Wiegand device to the product. When connecting a device requiring 1.0 A to **WIEGAND 0**, only 500 mA can be used on **WIEGAND 1**.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Exit button[‚Äã](#exit-button "Direct link to Exit button")

The IN0(SP), IN1(SP), IN4(SP), IN5(SP) ports support the Supervised Input feature and operate only as N/C. To avoid using Supervised Input, connect to the IN2, IN3, IN6, IN7 ports.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-door-button-connection-dm20.png)

#### Door sensor[‚Äã](#door-sensor "Direct link to Door sensor")

The IN0(SP), IN1(SP), IN4(SP), IN5(SP) ports support the Supervised Input feature and operate only as N/C. To avoid using Supervised Input, connect to the IN2, IN3, IN6, IN7 ports.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-door-button-connection-dm20.png)

<!-- -->


---

### Product Specifications

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### General[‚Äã](#specs.general)

Model Name

DM-20

CPU

Cortex M3 72 MHz

Memory

128 KB Flash + 20 KB SRAM

LED

Multi-color

* POWER: 1ea
* RELAY: 4ea
* INPUT: 4ea
* SUPERVISED INPUT: 4ea
* OUTPUT: 6ea
* RS-485: 2ea
* RUN: 1ea

Operating Temperature

-20 ¬∞C ~ 60 ¬∞C

Storage Temperature

-40 ¬∞C ~ 70 ¬∞C

Operating Humidity

0 % ~ 80 %, non-condensing

Storage Humidity

0 % ~ 90 %, non-condensing

Certifications

CE, UKCA, KC, FCC, RoHS, REACH, WEEE

<!-- -->

#### Interfaces[‚Äã](#specs.interface)

RS-485

1 ch

RS-485 Communication Protocol

OSDP V2 compliant

Input

4 ch

Output

6 ch

Supervised Input

4 ch

Relay

4 relays

Wiegand

2 ch Inputs (Voltage: 12 Vdc / Current: Max. 1.5 A)

<!-- -->

#### Electrical[‚Äã](#specs.power)

Power

12 Vdc

Current: Max. 3.1 A

Relay

* 2 A @ 30 VDC Resistive load
* 1 A @ 30 VDC Inductive load

#### Dimensions and Weight[‚Äã](#dimensions-and-weight "Direct link to Dimensions and Weight")

The dimensional tolerance is ¬±0.3 mm.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/dm20-dimension.svg)

***

Info

Product specifications are subject to change without notice for performance improvement.

### Regulatory Information

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### FCC Compliance Information[‚Äã](#fcc-compliance-information "Direct link to FCC Compliance Information")

THIS DEVICE COMPLIES WITH PART 15 OF THE FCC RULES.

Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

1. This device may not cause harmful interference, and

2. This device must accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation.

Info

This equipment has been tested and found to comply with the limits for a <!-- -->Class B<!-- --> digital device, pursuant to part 15 of the FCC Rules. These limits are designed to provide reasonable protection against harmful interference when the equipment is operated in a commercial environment. This equipment generates, uses, and can radiate radio frequency energy and, if not installed and used in accordance with the instruction manual, may cause harmful interference to radio communications. Operation of this equipment in a residential area is likely to cause harmful interference in which case the user will be required to correct the interference at his own expense.

Any changes or modifications not expressly approved by the party responsible for compliance could void the user‚Äôs authority to operate this equipment.

This transmitter must not be co-located or operating in conjunction with any other antenna or transmitter.

This equipment complies with FCC radiation exposure limits set forth for an uncontrolled environment. This equipment should be installed and operated with minimum distance 20 cm between the radiator and your body. Do not install or operate this device and its antenna in conjunction with any other antenna or RF transmission device.

<!-- -->

[Suprema Inc.](https://www.supremainc.com)

Tel: +82-31-783-4502 / Fax: +82-31-783-4503

### Firmware Version 1.0.0 (Build No.1.0.0_150130)

Release|2015-01-30

#### Initial firmware developed.[‚Äã](#initial-firmware-developed "Direct link to Initial firmware developed.")


---

### Firmware Version 1.0.13 (Build No. 1.0.13_150810)

Release|2015-08-10

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Output the NACK signal when SecuBlock error occurs.

2. Change Wiegand Input Interval Time

3. Reset the setting values of Suprevised Input when press INIT button

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Displays incorrect port number when Supervised Input port is grounded several times.


---

### Firmware Version 1.0.14 (Build No. 1.0.14_160111)

Release|2016-01-19

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. OSDP ID is changed to zero and communication is not possible if FW upgrade is performed when connecting to BioStation 2 or BioStation A2 as a slave device.


---

### Firmware Version 1.0.15 (Build No. 1.0.15_160429)

Release|2016-12-08

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Communication is not possible when encountered a packet size exceeding the maximum OSDP packet queue.


---

### Firmware Version 1.1.2 (Build No. 1.1.2_170103)

Release|2017-02-13

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. OSDP

   * Add two Manufacturer Specific Command (MFG\_RELAY\_ON and MFG\_RELAY\_OFF)

   * Support Release Alarm

   * Add ability to change Secure Key in Secure Session


---

### Firmware Version 1.1.3 (Build No. 1.1.3_171229)

Release|2018-04-13

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. When there is the response data with OSDP Secure Session, it responds with 0x16 for SEC\_BLK\_TYPE value and responds with 0x18 when there is no data.

2. Verified OSDP compatibility with the latest version of the master device.

   * FS2 AWB/D (V1.1.0)

   * BSA2-OEPW/OHPW/OIPW/OMPW (V1.5.0)

   * BS2-OEPW/OHPW/OIPW/OMPW (V1.6.0)

   * CS40 (V1.1.0)

   * BEW2-OAP/ODP/OHP/OAP(UL) (V1.2.0)

   * BSL2-OE/OM (V1.3.0)

   * BEP2-OA/OD/ODS (V1.1.0)


---

### Firmware Version 1.1.4 (Build No. 1.1.4_181031)

Release|2018-11-28

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. When there is the response data with OSDP Secure Session, it responds with 0x16 for SEC\_BLK\_TYPE value and responds with 0x18 when there is no data.


---

### Firmware Version 1.1.5 (Build No. 1.1.5_190306)

Release|2019-06-14

#### Bug Fix[‚Äã](#bug-fix "Direct link to Bug Fix")

***

1. An authentication failure error occurs if setting the Wiegand format to 256 bit when XPass D2 is connected as Wiegand reader.


---

### Firmware Version 1.2.0 (Build No. 1.2.0_200604)

Release|2020-06-05

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Added feature to change device ID.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Mac error occurs when RS-485 communication does not comply with OSDP standard.


---

### Firmware Version 1.2.1 (Build No. 1.2.1_210323)

Release|2021-03-29

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Improved that the Wiegand input signal is correctly transmitted regardless of the hardware version.

   * The inverted Wiegand input signal was made due to the Weigand circuit change.

### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

**When installing the product outdoors, make sure to install it in a shaded and well-ventilated area**.

**Do not use a completely sealed enclosure when installing the product outdoors**.

* The internal temperature of the enclosure may rise due to direct sunlight, causing fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

**Before connecting the power to the product, check the manual again to ensure that wiring is correct, then connect the power**.

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

**Do not leave power cables in passageways**.

* May cause bodily injury or product damage.

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Use a power adapter that has IEC/EN 62368-1 approval and is rated above the power consumption of the terminal device**. **It is recommended to use the power adapters sold by Suprema**.

* Using an unsuitable power supply may cause devices to malfunction.

* Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/doormodule/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Ensure the power supply is not interrupted during firmware upgrades of the product**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not press the product's buttons (touchpad) forcefully or use sharp tools to press them**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Use the product within <!-- -->-20 ¬∞C ~ 60 ¬∞C<!-- --> and store it at appropriate temperatures, not too low or too high**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.


---

### Enclosure

Enclosure is a housing dedicated to CoreStation. It provides backup battery, tamper switch, 8-channel power distribution board, and power status LED, ensuring excellent performance with CoreStation.

![Example banner](/docs/en/assets/images/enclosure-main-f7a3e3cc97040abf419840a752076753.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/enclosure/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### [Installation‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/enclosure/installation)

Provides the complete process and connection examples required for product installation.

#### [Product Specifications‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/enclosure/product-specifications)

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

#### [Appendices‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/enclosure/appendices)

Includes legal notices contained in the product.

* Suprema products are not intended for use in medical, lifesaving, life-sustaining applications, or other applications in which the failure of the Suprema product could create a situation where personal injury or death may occur. Should you purchase or use Suprema products for any such unintended or unauthorized application, you shall indemnify and hold Suprema and its officers, employees, subsidiaries, affiliates, and distributors harmless against all claims, costs, damages, and expenses, and reasonable attorney fees arising out of, directly or indirectly, any claim of personal injury or death associated with such unintended or unauthorized use, even if such claim alleges that Suprema was negligent regarding the design or manufacture of the part.

* Contact your local Suprema sales office or your distributor to obtain the latest specifications and before placing your product order.

### Getting Started

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### Components[‚Äã](#components "Direct link to Components")

|                                                       |                                                     |                                                          |
| ----------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-encr10.svg)         |                                                     | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-cable-tie6.svg)        |
|                                                       |                                                     | Cable Tie x6                                             |
|                                                       |                                                     | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-cable-earth.svg)       |
| Enclosure (ENCR-10)                                   |                                                     | Earth Cable                                              |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-fixing-screws4.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-pvc-anchors4.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-device-screws6.svg)    |
| Fixing Screw x4                                       | PVC Anchor x4                                       | Fixing screws for the device x6                          |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-ferrite-core.svg)   | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-terminal.svg)     | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-power-cable-screw.svg) |
| Ferrite Core                                          | Terminal                                            | Fixing screws for the power supply cable                 |

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

- The ENCR-10 components include screws for housing fixation, screws for product fixation, and screws for power device connection. Use each screw correctly according to its purpose.

  * Fixing screws for the enclosure (diameter: 4 mm, length: 25 mm) x4

  * Fixing screws for the device (diameter: 3 mm, length: 5 mm) x6

  * Fixing screws for the power supply cable (diameter: 3 mm, length: 8 mm) x1

* The backup battery is sold separately.

### Installation

Provides the entire process required for installation and examples of device connections. For more details on the wiring of each device, refer to the respective product guide.

* [**CoreStation**](/docs/en/device/corestation_40)

* [**Output Module**](/docs/en/device/outputmodule)

* [**Input Module**](/docs/en/device/inputmodule)

Info

For more detailed information on product installation, contact Suprema Technical Support Team (<CS@suprema.co.kr>).

#### CoreStation installation[‚Äã](#corestation-installation "Direct link to CoreStation installation")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

##### Backup battery fixing[‚Äã](#backup-battery-fixing "Direct link to Backup battery fixing")

Insert the battery Velcro strap into the case, then secure the battery.

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-battery.png)

Caution

Use a backup battery that is 12 VDC specification and 7 Ah or higher. This product has been tested with the 'ES7-12' product from 'ROCKET', and it is recommended to use products equivalent to 'ES7-12'.

Info

* The backup battery is sold separately.

* Be sure to check the size and shape of the backup battery terminals. If the size of the backup battery exceeds the recommended specifications, it may not fit in the case or the case may not close after installation. Additionally, if the shape and size of the terminals are different, you will not be able to connect the battery using the provided cable.

  ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-enclosure-battery-size.svg)

##### Product Fixation[‚Äã](#product-fixation "Direct link to Product Fixation")

1. Check the location to mount the product in the enclosure.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-fix1-1device.png)

2. Place the product in the enclosure according to the mounting location and secure it with screws.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-fix2-cs40.png)

Info

* The ENCR-10 is designed to be mounted on a wall for use. Install it at a safe and convenient height without restrictions on installation height.

- The ENCR-10 components include screws for housing fixation, screws for product fixation, and screws for power device connection. Use each screw correctly according to its purpose.

  * Fixing screws for the enclosure (diameter: 4 mm, length: 25 mm) x4

  * Fixing screws for the device (diameter: 3 mm, length: 5 mm) x6

  * Fixing screws for the power supply cable (diameter: 3 mm, length: 8 mm) x1

##### Power and AUX input, tamper connection[‚Äã](#power-and-aux-input-tamper-connection "Direct link to Power and AUX input, tamper connection")

To prevent power interruptions, you can connect an uninterruptible power supply (UPS), and contact outputs from power outage detectors or other devices can be connected to the AUX IN terminal.

You can also connect to the tamper to trigger an alarm or leave an event log if the housing opens due to external factors.

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-power-aux-input-connection-cs40.png)

Caution

* Make sure to use separate power for the access control device and products.

* Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the product specifications [Power](/docs/en/device/corestation_40/product-specifications#specs.power) for the maximum current specifications.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

* Use a backup battery that is 12 VDC specification and 7 Ah or higher. This product has been tested with the 'ES7-12' product from 'ROCKET', and it is recommended to use products equivalent to 'ES7-12'.

#### Installation of Output Module (OM-120)[‚Äã](#installation-of-output-module-om-120 "Direct link to Installation of Output Module (OM-120)")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-battery.png)

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-fix2-om120.png)

* The ENCR-10 is designed to be mounted on a wall for use. Install it at a safe and convenient height without restrictions on installation height.

- The ENCR-10 components include screws for housing fixation, screws for product fixation, and screws for power device connection. Use each screw correctly according to its purpose.

  * Fixing screws for the enclosure (diameter: 4 mm, length: 25 mm) x4

  * Fixing screws for the device (diameter: 3 mm, length: 5 mm) x6

  * Fixing screws for the power supply cable (diameter: 3 mm, length: 8 mm) x1

##### Power and AUX input connection[‚Äã](#power-and-aux-input-connection "Direct link to Power and AUX input connection")

To prevent power interruptions, you can connect an uninterruptible power supply (UPS), and contact outputs from power outage detectors or other devices can be connected to the AUX IN terminal.

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-power-aux-input-connection-om120.png)

Caution

* Make sure to use separate power for the access control device and products.

* Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [power](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/product-specifications#specs.power) section of the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

* Use a backup battery that is 12 VDC specification and 7 Ah or higher. This product has been tested with the 'ES7-12' product from 'ROCKET', and it is recommended to use products equivalent to 'ES7-12'.

### Product Specifications

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### General[‚Äã](#specs.general)

Model Name

ENCR-10

Supported products

* CoreStation (CS-40)
* Output Module (OM-120)
* Input Module (IM-120)

LED

* Battery status LED
* AC status LED

Material

ABS Plastic

Operating Temperature

0 ¬∞C ~ 50 ¬∞C

Storage Temperature

-40 ¬∞C ~ 70 ¬∞C

Operating Humidity

0 % ~ 80 %, non-condensing

Storage Humidity

0 % ~ 95 %, non-condensing

<!-- -->

#### Power Supply[‚Äã](#specs.power_supply)

Model Name

PSC-160A-C

Vendor

MEANWELL

Input

* Voltage range: 110 ~ 240 VAC
* Frequency range: 50/60 Hz

Output

13.8 Vdc

* Rated Current: 11.6 A
* Rated Power: 160 W

<!-- -->

#### Backup Battery[‚Äã](#specs.backup_battery)

Model Name

ES7-12

Vendor

ROCKET

Voltage

12 VDC

Capacity

7 Ah

#### Dimensions and Weight[‚Äã](#dimensions-and-weight "Direct link to Dimensions and Weight")

The dimensional tolerance is ¬±0.3 mm.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/encr-dimension.svg)

***

Info

* Product specifications are subject to change without notice for performance improvement.

* The backup battery is sold separately.

Caution

Use a backup battery that is 12 VDC specification and 7 Ah or higher. This product has been tested with the 'ES7-12' product from 'ROCKET', and it is recommended to use products equivalent to 'ES7-12'.

### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

**When installing the product outdoors, make sure to install it in a shaded and well-ventilated area**.

**Do not use a completely sealed enclosure when installing the product outdoors**.

* The internal temperature of the enclosure may rise due to direct sunlight, causing fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

**Before connecting the power to the product, check the manual again to ensure that wiring is correct, then connect the power**.

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

**Do not leave power cables in passageways**.

* May cause bodily injury or product damage.

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Use a power adapter that has IEC/EN 62368-1 approval and is rated above the power consumption of the terminal device**. **It is recommended to use the power adapters sold by Suprema**.

* Using an unsuitable power supply may cause devices to malfunction.

* Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/enclosure/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not press the product's buttons (touchpad) forcefully or use sharp tools to press them**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Use the product within <!-- -->0 ¬∞C ~ 50 ¬∞C<!-- --> and store it at appropriate temperatures, not too low or too high**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.

### Extended Module

Mounting the expansion module on the Suprema allows the use of additional RS-485, RS-232C ports, and SAM cards.

![Example banner](/docs/en/assets/images/extendedmodule-main-496c80d1adc6aeed78bd5eb95dd07754.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/extendedmodule/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

### Getting Started

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

Caution

Connection of the expansion module is not supported on standard firmware, so a separate custom firmware is required.

#### Components[‚Äã](#components "Direct link to Components")

|                                             |                                                    |                                                |
| ------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-extm.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-pinmap-extm.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-screws2.svg) |
| Expansion Module                            | Pin Map Label                                      | Fixing Screws x2                               |

|                                                    |                                                     |
| -------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-rs485-4pin.svg)      | ![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-rs485-4pin.svg)       |
| RS-232C Cable                                      | RS-485 Cable                                        |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-usb-4pin.svg)        | ![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-usb-4pin-short.svg)   |
| USB Expansion Port Connection Cable (BioStation 3) | USB Expansion Port Connection Cable (BioStation 2a) |

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/name-function-each-part-extm.png)

* **SAM Card Slot**: You can use SAM (Secure Access Module) cards.

* **USB Expansion Port (5-pin)**: Connects the device to the expansion module.

* **RS-485 (4-pin)**: Connect the RS-485 cable.

* **RS-232C (4-pin)**: Connect the RS-232C cable.

#### Cables and connectors[‚Äã](#cables-and-connectors "Direct link to Cables and connectors")

##### RS-232C[‚Äã](#rs-232c "Direct link to RS-232C")

![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-rs485-4pin.svg)

| Pin | Name    | Color  |
| --- | ------- | ------ |
| 1   | 232 TX  | Blue   |
| 2   | 232 RX  | Yellow |
| 3   | 232 GND | Black  |
| 4   | SH GND  | Gray   |

##### RS-485[‚Äã](#rs-485 "Direct link to RS-485")

![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-rs485-4pin.svg)

| Pin | Name     | Color  |
| --- | -------- | ------ |
| 1   | 485 TRXP | Blue   |
| 2   | 485 TRXN | Yellow |
| 3   | 485 GND  | Black  |
| 4   | SH GND   | Gray   |

##### USB Expansion Port Connection Cable[‚Äã](#usb-expansion-port-connection-cable "Direct link to USB Expansion Port Connection Cable")

![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-usb-4pin.svg)

| Pin | Name      | Color |
| --- | --------- | ----- |
| 1   | MAIN VBUS | Red   |
| 2   | MAIN DM   | White |
| 3   | MAIN DP   | Green |
| 4   | NC        | \*    |
| 5   | MAIN GND  | Black |

#### Installation example[‚Äã](#installation-example "Direct link to Installation example")

Caution

Connection of the expansion module is not supported on standard firmware, so a separate custom firmware is required.

Mounting the expansion module on the Suprema allows the use of additional RS-485, RS-232C ports, and SAM cards.

The Suprema devices that can accommodate the expansion module are as follows.

* [**BioStation 3**](/docs/en/device/biostation_3)

* [**BioStation 2a**](/docs/en/device/biostation_2a)

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-example-extm.png)


---

### Installation

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### Install on BioStation 3[‚Äã](#install-on-biostation-3 "Direct link to Install on BioStation 3")

Info

* To install the expansion module on the product, an expansion bracket (sold separately) is required.

* For purchasing the expansion bracket, please contact your Supremma product retailer.

1. Check the position on the expansion bracket for attaching the expansion module and secure the expansion module using fixing screws.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm1.svg)

2. Connect the cable you wish to use to the expansion module and place it into the bottom slot to organize the cable.

   As shown in the image, keep the MAIN USB cable inside and route the RS-232C and RS-485 cables out the back through the bottom slot.

   Insert the SAM card into the SAM card slot if you want to use the SAM card.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm2.svg)

   Info

   If necessary, you can bend the indicated parts with cutters or pliers to expand the wiring space.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm3.svg)

3. Install the silicone rubber cover to fit around the expansion module.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm4.svg)

   Info

   To meet the IP65 rating, you must install the silicone rubber cover after connecting the cables.

4. Attach the included double-sided tape to the back of the expansion bracket and secure it in place. Then, use fixing screws to firmly secure the expansion bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm5.svg)

   Info

   * The optimal height for installing device is 136 cm.

   * Do not install the device in a location directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet rays.

   * Adjust the installation position so that the face is not exposed to direct sunlight when a user tries to authenticate.

5. Secure the wall bracket using fixing screws on top of the expansion bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm6.svg)

6. Connect the product and the MAIN USB cable, and assemble the cable cover.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm7.svg)

   Info

   To meet the IP65 waterproof and dustproof ratings, it is essential to use the cable cover after connecting the product and cables.

7. Mount the product on the secured wall bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm8.svg)

8. Tighten the product fixing screws to assemble the product and the wall bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm9.svg)

   Info

   When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

#### Install on BioStation 2a[‚Äã](#install-on-biostation-2a "Direct link to Install on BioStation 2a")

1. Use the provided drilling template to determine the mounting position for the wall bracket. Secure the wall bracket tightly using fixing screws at the location where the product will be mounted.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device1-bs2a.svg)

2. Connect the MAIN USB cable to the product and check the position for installing the expansion module before securing it with fixing screws.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs2a-extm1.svg)

3. Connect the cable you wish to use to the expansion module and place it into the bottom slot to organize the cable.

   Insert the SAM card into the SAM card slot if you want to use the SAM card.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs2a-extm2.svg)

4. After assembling the cable cover, mount the product on the secured wall bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs2a-extm3.svg)

   Info

   To meet the IP65 waterproof and dustproof ratings, it is essential to use the cable cover after connecting the product and cables.

5. Tighten the product fixing screws to assemble the product and the wall bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device3-bs2a.svg)

   Info

   When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

**When installing the product outdoors, make sure to install it in a shaded and well-ventilated area**.

**Do not use a completely sealed enclosure when installing the product outdoors**.

* The internal temperature of the enclosure may rise due to direct sunlight, causing fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

<!-- -->

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.

### Getting Started

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

Caution

Connection of the expansion module is not supported on standard firmware, so a separate custom firmware is required.

#### Components[‚Äã](#components "Direct link to Components")

|                                                |                                                       |                                                |
| ---------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-extm-sc.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-pinmap-extm-sc.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-screws2.svg) |
| Expansion Module                               | Pin Map Label                                         | Fixing Screws x2                               |

|                                                    |                                                     |
| -------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-rs485-4pin.svg)      | ![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-rs485-4pin.svg)       |
| RS-232C Cable                                      | RS-485 Cable                                        |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-usb-4pin.svg)        | ![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-usb-4pin-short.svg)   |
| USB Expansion Port Connection Cable (BioStation 3) | USB Expansion Port Connection Cable (BioStation 2a) |

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/name-function-each-part-extm-sc.png)

* **USB Expansion Port (5-pin)**: Connects the device to the expansion module.

* **RS-485 (4-pin)**: Connect the RS-485 cable.

* **RS-232C (4-pin)**: Connect the RS-232C cable.

#### Cables and connectors[‚Äã](#cables-and-connectors "Direct link to Cables and connectors")

##### RS-232C[‚Äã](#rs-232c "Direct link to RS-232C")

![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-rs485-4pin.svg)

| Pin | Name    | Color  |
| --- | ------- | ------ |
| 1   | 232 TX  | Blue   |
| 2   | 232 RX  | Yellow |
| 3   | 232 GND | Black  |
| 4   | SH GND  | Gray   |

##### RS-485[‚Äã](#rs-485 "Direct link to RS-485")

![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-rs485-4pin.svg)

| Pin | Name     | Color  |
| --- | -------- | ------ |
| 1   | 485 TRXP | Blue   |
| 2   | 485 TRXN | Yellow |
| 3   | 485 GND  | Black  |
| 4   | SH GND   | Gray   |

##### USB Expansion Port Connection Cable[‚Äã](#usb-expansion-port-connection-cable "Direct link to USB Expansion Port Connection Cable")

![](/docs/en/img/device/cable-usb-4pin.svg)

| Pin | Name      | Color |
| --- | --------- | ----- |
| 1   | MAIN VBUS | Red   |
| 2   | MAIN DM   | White |
| 3   | MAIN DP   | Green |
| 4   | NC        | \*    |
| 5   | MAIN GND  | Black |

#### Installation example[‚Äã](#installation-example "Direct link to Installation example")

Caution

Connection of the expansion module is not supported on standard firmware, so a separate custom firmware is required.

By equipping the Suprema device with an expansion module, you can additionally use RS-485 and RS-232C ports.

The Suprema devices that can accommodate the expansion module are as follows.

* [**BioStation 3**](/docs/en/device/biostation_3)

* [**BioStation 2a**](/docs/en/device/biostation_2a)

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-example-extm-sc.png)


---

### Installation

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### Install on BioStation 3[‚Äã](#install-on-biostation-3 "Direct link to Install on BioStation 3")

Info

* To install the expansion module on the product, an expansion bracket (sold separately) is required.

* For purchasing the expansion bracket, please contact your Supremma product retailer.

1. Check the position on the expansion bracket for attaching the expansion module and secure the expansion module using fixing screws.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm-sc1.svg)

2. Connect the cable you wish to use to the expansion module and place it into the bottom slot to organize the cable.

   As shown in the image, keep the MAIN USB cable inside and route the RS-232C and RS-485 cables out the back through the bottom slot.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm-sc2.svg)

   Info

   If necessary, you can bend the indicated parts with cutters or pliers to expand the wiring space.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm3.svg)

3. Install the silicone rubber cover to fit around the expansion module.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm-sc4.svg)

   Info

   To meet the IP65 rating, you must install the silicone rubber cover after connecting the cables.

4. Attach the included double-sided tape to the back of the expansion bracket and secure it in place. Then, use fixing screws to firmly secure the expansion bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm5.svg)

   Info

   * The optimal height for installing device is 136 cm.

   * Do not install the device in a location directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet rays.

   * Adjust the installation position so that the face is not exposed to direct sunlight when a user tries to authenticate.

5. Secure the wall bracket using fixing screws on top of the expansion bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm6.svg)

6. Connect the product and the MAIN USB cable, and assemble the cable cover.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm-sc7.svg)

   Info

   To meet the IP65 waterproof and dustproof ratings, it is essential to use the cable cover after connecting the product and cables.

7. Mount the product on the secured wall bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm8.svg)

8. Tighten the product fixing screws to assemble the product and the wall bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs3-extm9.svg)

   Info

   When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

#### Install on BioStation 2a[‚Äã](#install-on-biostation-2a "Direct link to Install on BioStation 2a")

1. Use the provided drilling template to determine the mounting position for the wall bracket. Secure the wall bracket tightly using fixing screws at the location where the product will be mounted.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device1-bs2a.svg)

2. Connect the MAIN USB cable to the product and check the position for installing the expansion module before securing it with fixing screws.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs2a-extm-sc1.svg)

3. Connect the cable you wish to use to the expansion module and place it into the bottom slot to organize the cable.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs2a-extm-sc2.svg)

4. After assembling the cable cover, mount the product on the secured wall bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-bs2a-extm-sc3.svg)

   Info

   To meet the IP65 waterproof and dustproof ratings, it is essential to use the cable cover after connecting the product and cables.

5. Tighten the product fixing screws to assemble the product and the wall bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device3-bs2a.svg)

   Info

   When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

### FaceStation 2

FaceStation 2 is Suprema's next-generation facial authentication device equipped with the world's highest performance facial authentication algorithm. It provides ultra-fast authentication performance of matching up to 4,000 individuals per second using a powerful quad-core CPU.

![Example banner](/docs/en/assets/images/facestation2-main-aa5e444980b6b7d17da10dc39a45ad09.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/facestation_2/safety-instructions)

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

* [Admin Menu](/docs/en/device/facestation_2/admin-menu)
* [User](/docs/en/device/facestation_2/user)
* [Authentication](/docs/en/device/facestation_2/authentication)
  [ <!-- -->5 items](/docs/en/device/facestation_2/using-device)

Provides guidance on the main menus and features accessible with administrator privileges.

### Authentication

Describes the supported authentication methods and authentication procedures.

#### Authentication mode[‚Äã](#authentication-mode "Direct link to Authentication mode")

Set the authentication mode. You can use Face, PIN, Card, and ID in combination as authentication modes, and you can set schedules for each authentication mode.

##### Registering auth mode[‚Äã](#registering-auth-mode "Direct link to Registering auth mode")

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. Press AUTHENTICATION ‚Üí Auth Mode.

3. Select ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add2.svg).

4. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add3.svg) to see the credentials that can be added on the screen. Select the credentials to add. You can delete the added credentials by pressing ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-cancel1.svg) when credentials are added.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fs2-auth-mode.png)

5. After setting the desired authentication mode, set Schedule.

   | Category | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
   | -------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
   | Face     | - ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-fs2.png): This mode uses only facial authentication.<br />- ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-fs2.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-pin-bs2a.png): This mode authenticates with face and then enters the PIN.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
   | Card     | - ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-card-bs2a.png): This mode uses only card authentication.<br />- ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-card-bs2a.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-fs2.png): This mode authenticates with card and then with face.<br />- ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-card-bs2a.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-pin-bs2a.png): This mode authenticates with card and then enters the PIN.<br />- ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-card-bs2a.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-fs2.png) / ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-pin-bs2a.png): This mode authenticates with card and then with face or enters the PIN.<br />- ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-card-bs2a.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-fs2.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-pin-bs2a.png): This mode uses both face authentication and PIN entry after authenticating with the card. |
   | ID       | - ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-id-bs2a.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-fs2.png): This mode enters the ID and then authenticates with face.<br />- ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-id-bs2a.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-pin-bs2a.png): This mode enters the ID and then enters the PIN.<br />- ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-id-bs2a.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-fs2.png) / ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-pin-bs2a.png): This mode enters the ID and then either authenticates with face or enters the PIN.<br />- ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-id-bs2a.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-fs2.png) + ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-pin-bs2a.png): This mode uses both face authentication and PIN entry after entering the ID.                                                                                                                      |

   Info

   * Schedule can be set in BioStar X. If no schedule is set, only Always can be selected.

   * For more information about Schedule settings, refer to the [BioStar X Administrator Guide](/docs/en/platform/biostar_x/settings-schedule).

6. To save the settings, press OK.

##### Modifying auth mode[‚Äã](#modifying-auth-mode "Direct link to Modifying auth mode")

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. Press AUTHENTICATION ‚Üí Auth Mode.

3. Select the authentication mode to modify.

4. Modify the authentication mode by referring to [Registering auth mode](#registering-auth-mode) and press OK.

##### Delete auth mode[‚Äã](#delete-auth-mode "Direct link to Delete auth mode")

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. Press AUTHENTICATION ‚Üí Auth Mode.

3. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-delete.svg) and select the authentication mode to delete. You can select multiple options.

4. To delete the selected item, press OK.

#### Operation[‚Äã](#operation "Direct link to Operation")

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. After pressing AUTHENTICATION, change the desired item in Operation.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fs2-auth-option.png)

   * Ambient Brightness: Adjusts the intensity of the IR LED by detecting ambient brightness. Change settings according to the installation environment.

   * Motion Sensor: Set the sensitivity to detect motion around the device. When Motion Sensor is set to Off, touch the screen to authenticate your face.

   * Auth Timeout: If authentication is not completed within the set time, authentication fails.

   * Server Matching: When server matching is set, the device does not perform user authentication; BioStar X performs user authentication. It can be used when the device has too much user information or when the device is installed outside.

     Info

     * Server Matching can only use cards and IDs.

     * If you use Server Matching, you must enable server matching on both the device and BioStar X. For more information about BioStar X server matching settings, refer to the [BioStar X Administrator Guide](/docs/en/platform/biostar_x/settings-server-server#servermatching).

   * Face Pose Variation: Set the sensitivity for face position, angle, and distance when registering a face. Set high for precise face templates.

   * Enroll Timeout: If the face is not enrolled within the set time, the face registration will be canceled.

   * Duplicate Check: You can check for duplicate faces during face registration.

#### Facial recognition[‚Äã](#facial-recognition "Direct link to Facial recognition")

You can change the configuration for facial authentication.

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. After pressing AUTHENTICATION, change the desired item in Face Recognition.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fs2-auth.png)

   * Security Level: You can set the security level for 1<!-- -->:N<!-- --> authentication.

   * Group Matching: You can check whether group matching is used. Using group matching allows you to group multiple users' faces to increase authentication speed.

   * Backward Compatibility (Enrollment in v1.0.1): Enable this option if the firmware of the device that registers face templates is v1.0.1 or earlier.

   * Enhanced fake face enrollment block: This can prevent user registration using spoofed faces such as photos. You can set the intensity from Level 1 to Level 3, and as the level increases, the inspection intensity strengthens.

   * Quick Enroll: You can set whether to use fast face registration. When fast face registration is enabled, the face registration process is set to one step, and when disabled, it is set to three steps.

     Info

     * Group Matching can be set in BioStar X.

     * If Enhanced fake face enrollment block is set to a high level, the registration of real faces may be rejected. If the registration fails, try again or lower the inspection intensity.

     * To register high-quality face templates, disable Quick Enroll.

#### Attendance Mode[‚Äã](#attendance-mode "Direct link to Attendance Mode")

You can set how to register T\&A mode.

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. Click AUTHENTICATION, then change the desired item in T\&A Mode.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fs2-auth1.png)

   * T\&A Mode: Set how to use attendance mode.

   * T\&A Code: Add time and attendance events.

   * T\&A Required: Require users to select a time and attendance event during authentication. Available when T\&A Mode is set to By User.

   * Fixed T\&A Key: Allow users to use only time and attendance events selected by the administrator. Available when T\&A Mode is set to Fixed.

   * Job Code: Select whether to use job codes.


---

### Event Logs

Describes how to view event logs generated by the device.

#### Search event logs[‚Äã](#search-event-logs "Direct link to Search event logs")

Set conditions to search logs.

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. Select EVENT LOG. All event logs appear.

3. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-search.svg) to search a specific log and change the condition.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fs2-eventlog.png)

4. Set the search criteria and click OK to display logs that match the criteria.

#### View event log details[‚Äã](#view-event-log-details "Direct link to View event log details")

You can check the details of the logs.

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. Select EVENT LOG. All event logs appear.

3. Click the log to check the details.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fs2-eventlog1.png)

#### Delete all logs[‚Äã](#delete-all-logs "Direct link to Delete all logs")

You can delete all saved logs.

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. Select EVENT LOG. All event logs appear.

3. To delete all logs, select ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-delete.svg) and click OK. Press Cancel to return to the previous screen.

#### View log usage[‚Äã](#view-log-usage "Direct link to View log usage")

You can check the status of log usage.

1. Click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu2.svg) and authenticate with administrator privileges.

2. Click EVENT LOG ‚Üí ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-info2.svg). Check the device's event log and image log usage.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fs2-eventlog2.png)

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

| FaceStation 2                                     | Wall Bracket                                            | Drilling Template                                            |

|                                                              |                                                       |                                                    |                                                             |
| ------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------- |

<!-- -->

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

- When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/name-function-each-part-fs2.png)

* **Microphone**: Transmits the voice of the user when the interphone is connected.

  * Covering or blocking the microphone may interfere with voice transmission.

* **Display**: Provides a UI for operation.

* **Infrared Camera**: Capture the infrared face image.

* **Visual Camera**: Capture an actual face image.

* **RF card and mobile access card authentication unit**: Part to scan a RFID card or mobile access card for entrance.

* **Speaker**: Delivers sound.

* **USB Memory Slot**: Connect the USB memory.

  * The Suprema thermal camera (TCM10-FS2) cannot be used simultaneously with the USB memory.

* **Mini USB Cable Slot**: Support coming soon.

* **Input (4-pin)**: Connect the input cable.

* **RS-485 (4-pin)**: Connect the RS-485 cable.

* **Relay (3-pin)**: Connect the Relay cable.

* **Power Supply (2-pin)**: Connects the power supply cable.

* **Ethernet**: Connect the Ethernet cable.

* **Wiegand Input (4-pin)**: Connect the Wiegand Input cable.

* **Wiegand Output (4-pin)**: Connect the Wiegand Output cable.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->
