### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

**When installing the product outdoors, make sure to install it in a shaded and well-ventilated area**.

**Do not use a completely sealed enclosure when installing the product outdoors**.

* The internal temperature of the enclosure may rise due to direct sunlight, causing fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

**Before connecting the power to the product, check the manual again to ensure that wiring is correct, then connect the power**.

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

**Do not leave power cables in passageways**.

* May cause bodily injury or product damage.

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**When installing multiple devices, ensure the minimum spacing distance is observed**.

* May affect the RF and BLE performance of other devices, causing them to malfunction.

**Use a power adapter that has IEC/EN 62368-1 approval and is rated above the power consumption of the terminal device**. **It is recommended to use the power adapters sold by Suprema**.

* Using an unsuitable power supply may cause devices to malfunction.

* Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/facestation_f2/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

<!-- -->

**Ensure that the product and Secure I/O 2, electric lock (electronic locking device) use separate power supplies**.

* Devices may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**To meet IP65 standards, make sure to use a cable cover after connecting the product and cable**. **It is recommended to use an enclosure when installed outdoors with full exposure**.

* Decreased waterproof and dustproof performance may cause malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Ensure the power supply is not interrupted during firmware upgrades of the product**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Manage the password so others do not know it, and change it regularly**.

* This may lead to unauthorized access.

**Do not press the product's buttons (touchpad) forcefully or use sharp tools to press them**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Use the product within <!-- -->-20 ¬∞C to 50 ¬∞C<!-- --> and store it at appropriate temperatures, not too low or too high**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.

**RTC Battery**

Replacing with unauthorized or incorrect types of batteries may pose a risk of explosion. Dispose of batteries according to local or international waste regulations.


---

### Settings

Provides instructions on how to set system and device configurations.

#### Display & Sound[‚Äã](#display--sound "Direct link to Display & Sound")

You can change the display and sound settings of the device.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Click DISPLAY & SOUND.

3. Change the desired item.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-displaysound.png)

   * Home Screen: You can choose items to display in the background of the home screen.

   * Language: You can select the language that will be displayed on the screen.

   * Device Private Msg.: Set whether to use a Private Message, which will be displayed on the screen when the user authenticates. The Device Private Msg. can be set using the BioStar Device SDK. If not set, does not display a message when authentication is successful even if Device Private Msg. is enabled on the device.

   * Server Private Msg.: Set whether to use a Private Message, which will be displayed on the screen when the user authenticates. Server Private Msg. can be set using the BioStar X API. If not set, does not display a message when authentication is successful even if Server Private Msg. is enabled on the device.

   * Screen Saver: Set whether the screen saver is enabled or not. It reduces unnecessary energy consumption by lowering the brightness of the screen when the device is not in use.

   * Menu Timeout: Set the time (sec) for the menu screen to disappear automatically. If there is no button input during a set time, the screen will return to the home screen.

   * Message Timeout: Set the time (sec) for a setting complete message or notification message to disappear automatically.

   * Backlight Timeout: Set the time (sec) to turn off the lighting of the screen.

   * Voice Instruction: You can use voice guidance instead of notification tones.

   * Volume: Set the volume.

   Info

   For more information on the BioStar Device SDK, refer to the [BioStar Device SDK page](https://kb.supremainc.com/bs2sdk/doku.php) on the Suprema Knowledge Base.

#### Communication Settings[‚Äã](#communication-settings "Direct link to Communication Settings")

You can change the network settings of the device, such as Ethernet, server, OSDP, etc.

##### Ethernet[‚Äã](#ethernet "Direct link to Ethernet")

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select NETWORK ‚Üí Ethernet.

3. Change the desired item.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-network-ethernet.png)

   * DHCP: Set whether to use DHCP. By turning off DHCP settings, the user can modify Device Port, IP Address, Gateway, Subnet Mask, DNS.

   * Device Port: Set the device's port.

   * IP Address: You can check the device's IP address. To modify, disable DHCP setting.

   * Gateway: You can check the device's gateway. To modify, disable DHCP setting.

   * Subnet Mask: You can check the device's subnet mask. To modify, disable DHCP setting.

   * DNS: Set the DNS server address.

4. To save the settings, press OK.

##### Server[‚Äã](#server "Direct link to Server")

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select NETWORK ‚Üí Server.

3. Change the desired item.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-network-server.png)

   * Device ‚Üí Server: You can send a connection signal from the device to a server with the input information directly. When Device ‚Üí Server is enabled, the user can input Server IP, Server URL, and Server Port.

   * Server IP: Enter the IP address of the PC on which BioStar X is installed.

   * Server URL: You can enter Server URL instead of Server IP.

   * Server Port: Enter the port of the PC on which BioStar X is installed.

4. To save the settings, press OK.

##### OSDP settings[‚Äã](#osdp-settings "Direct link to OSDP settings")

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select NETWORK.

3. Set the desired item in OSDP Setting.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-network-osdp.png)

   * RS-485: Select the RS-485 mode.

   * Baud Rate: Select the desired baud rate.

   * Authentication Result: When using Intelligent Slave, select to display the authentication results of 3rd party controllers or devices on the screen. This option can be used when RS-485 mode is set to Default or Slave.

#### Device[‚Äã](#device "Direct link to Device")

##### Camera[‚Äã](#camera "Direct link to Camera")

You can set the frequency to prevent the video from flickering.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Press DEVICE ‚Üí Camera.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-device-camera.png)

   * Power Line Frequency: You can set the frequency to 50 Hz or 60 Hz to prevent the video from flickering depending on the ambient lighting conditions.

##### Relay[‚Äã](#relay "Direct link to Relay")

You can set the input ports of Open Time and Exit Button on the device.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Click DEVICE ‚Üí Relay.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-network-relay.png)

   * Relay: You can set whether relay is enabled or not. Enabling relay settings will allow you to configure Open Time and Exit Button.

   * Open Time: Set the duration for the door to remain open when standard user authentication has been carried out.

   * Exit Button: Select the input port connected to the exit button.

   * Switch: Select relay type (N/O or N/C).

##### Date & Time[‚Äã](#date-time "Direct link to Date & Time")

You can set date and time. Set the date and time accurately in order to collect accurate log data.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Click DEVICE ‚Üí Date & Time.

3. Change the desired item.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-datetime.png)

   * Date & Time: Check the current date and time. To modify it manually, disable Time Sync.

   * Time Zone: Set the time reference of the current location.

   * Time Sync: Synchronize the server and the time. If you wish to synchronize the server and the time, enable Time Sync.

   * Date Format: You can set the date format. You can select YYYY/MM/DD, MM/DD/YYYY, and DD/MM/YYYY.

   * Time Format: You can set the time format. You can select 24-Hour and AM/PM.

##### Daylight saving time[‚Äã](#daylight-saving-time "Direct link to Daylight saving time")

You can use the device by applying daylight saving time. Set the start and end time correctly.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Click DEVICE ‚Üí Daylight Saving Time, then press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add2.svg) to add daylight savings time.

3. Change the desired item.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-dst.png)

   * Name: Set the name of daylight-saving time.

   * Start Month / Start Week / Start Day / Start Time: Set details of when daylight-saving time begins.

   * End Month / End Week / End Day / End Time: Set details of when daylight-saving time ends.

4. To save the settings, press OK.

##### Device Information[‚Äã](#device-information "Direct link to Device Information")

You can view the model name, device ID, serial number, device and firmware version, kernel, and MAC address.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select DEVICE ‚Üí Device Info. You can check the information of Model Name, Device ID, Serial No., HW, FW, Kernel, MAC.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-info.png)

##### Memory information[‚Äã](#memory-information "Direct link to Memory information")

View the status of memory usage.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select DEVICE ‚Üí Memory Info. You can view the memory usage status of the device.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-memory.png)

##### USB memory[‚Äã](#usb-memory "Direct link to USB memory")

Connect USB Memory and import user information to the device or export log and user information from the device. You can also upgrade the firmware.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select DEVICE ‚Üí USB Memory.

3. Select the desired item and change the setting.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-usb.png)

   * Import: Import user information from the connected USB memory.

   * Export: Select information you wish to export to the connected USB memory.

   * FW Upgrade: Upgrade the firmware if the firmware files are saved in the connected USB memory.

Caution

* Do not disconnect the power supply while upgrading the firmware of the device. The device may malfunction.

* Use BioStar X or BioStar Device SDK to upgrade firmware from v1.x.x to v2.x.x.

* When upgrading firmware using a USB drive, first set DISPLAY & SOUND menu to Menu Timeout Always On and then proceed with the upgrade. Also, do not remove the USB drive even if a failure message appears during the upgrade process; wait until a success message is displayed. Once the upgrade is completed, the device will automatically restart.

Info

* When upgrading firmware from version 1.0.5 or lower to version 1.1.0 or higher, a migration will take place to extract the previously enrolled facial templates, and this process may take up to 10 hours depending on the number of registered users.

  ![](/docs/en/img/device/fsf2-device-migration.png)

* It is recommended to use a USB flash drive formatted in exFAT. USB flash drives in FAT32 format may malfunction when more than 50,000 face credentials are stored.

* Check the amount of free space on your USB flash drive. To save 100,000 face credentials, a minimum of 15 GB of free space is required.

##### Secure Tamper[‚Äã](#secure-tamper "Direct link to Secure Tamper")

You can set whether to use security tamper. When the tamper is turned on, you can set to delete the entire user, the entire log, and the security key.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select DEVICE.

3. Activate Secure Tamper to delete data of all registered users, all logs, and secure keys when a temper event occurs.

##### Restart device[‚Äã](#restart-device "Direct link to Restart device")

The user can restart the device.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select DEVICE ‚Üí Restart Device.

3. Press OK to restart the device. Press Cancel to return to the previous screen.

##### Restore default[‚Äã](#restore-default "Direct link to Restore default")

Device settings, network settings, and operator levels will be reset.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select DEVICE ‚Üí Restore Default.

   * All settings: Initializes all settings stored on the device. Press OK to initialize all device settings. Press Cancel to return to the previous screen.

   * Keep Network Settings: Initializes all settings except for network settings. Press OK to initialize all settings except for network settings. Press Cancel to return to the previous screen.

   * Factory Default: Deletes all information saved in the device and the root certificate, restoring settings to default.

   * Delete the Root Certificate: Deletes the root certificate saved in the device.

3. If you proceed with Restore Default, the device will restart.

Info

* When you reset, the operator level will be reset as well. After resetting, make sure to set the operator level again.

* Language setting will not change after resetting.

* The Factory Default menu can be used when the root certificate is saved in the device.

* The Delete the Root Certificate menu can be used only when the root certificate is saved in the device and an administrator has been designated.

##### User ID type[‚Äã](#user-id-type "Direct link to User ID type")

Select the type of user ID to register to the device.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select DEVICE ‚Üí User ID Type.

   * Number: You can enter a user ID with numbers only.

   * Alphanumeric: You can enter a user ID using alphanumeric characters and certain symbols `_` `-`.

3. After changing to the desired item, press OK.


---

### Troubleshooting

This document provides information to solve unexpected issues that you may encounter when using the device.

#### Check items before reporting a malfunction[‚Äã](#check-items-before-reporting-a-malfunction "Direct link to Check items before reporting a malfunction")

This document provides information to solve unexpected issues that you may encounter when using the device.

##### Power[‚Äã](#power)

Q.The power is being supplied but the device does not operate.

* If the terminal and the bracket are far away from each other, the device may not operate due to the temper switch.
* Check the adaptor or the power cable.

##### PIN[‚Äã](#pin)

Q.I lost my PIN.

* For a normal user PIN, request it from the administrator and enter it again.
* If you have lost the Admin PIN, contact the installation company.

Q.I entered my PIN and pressed the OK button, but I still cannot open the door.

* Check if you have entered the registered PIN correctly.
* Check if you have changed the PIN recently.
* If you cannot remember the PIN, request it from the administrator and enter it again.

##### Face[‚Äã](#face)

Q.The face has been registered but face authentication cannot be done smoothly, and errors occur frequently.

* Check [Cautions for enrolling a faces](getting-started#cautions-enrolling-faces) and enroll the face again.
* If there are a large number of enrolled faces, change Matching Timeout and try again.

Q.Face authentication has suddenly stopped working.

* Check [Cautions for authenticating a face](getting-started#cautions-authenticating-face) and try again.

Q.Mask Detection is set to Enabled, but face authentication cannot be done smoothly when wearing a mask.

* Authenticate your face twice with the mask pull down on the tip of your nose. Then, authenticate your face again wearing a mask that covers your nose completely. If the problem persists, contact the installation company.

Q.The thermal camera fails to measure temperature.

* Check if the thermal camera is properly connected to the terminal.
* Measure the temperature again without covering your forehead. If the problem persists, contact the installation company.

Q.The thermal camera measures lower temperature than actual temperature.

* If a user measures the temperature after being exposed to cold temperatures for a long time, the temperature may be measured lower than the actual temperature. Wait for 1 to 2 minutes indoors and try again. If the problem persists, contact the installation company.

##### Fingerprint[‚Äã](#fingerprint)

Q.The fingerprint has been enrolled but fingerprint authentication cannot be done smoothly and errors occur frequently.

* Check [How to enroll a fingerprint](getting-started#cautions-enrolling-fingers) and enroll the fingerprint again.
* If your fingerprint has a cut, the device may recognize your fingerprint as someone else's fingerprint.
* If there are a large number of enrolled fingerprints, change Matching Timeout and try again.
* The authentication rate may vary for each fingerprint due to different characteristics. Enroll the fingerprint of another finger.

##### Door lock[‚Äã](#doorlock)

Q.The door cannot be locked when I close the door.

* The electric lock may be malfunctioning. Have an inspection through the installation company.

##### Time[‚Äã](#time)

Q.Suddenly the time has become incorrect.

* The device is equipped with a built-in battery but if power is not supplied for a long time, the built-in battery may die, causing the time to become incorrect. You can correct the time by referring to [Date & Time](settings#date-time).

##### Admin access[‚Äã](#admin)

Q.I lost my Admin PIN, so I cannot access the Admin mode.

* The administrator grants an access permission in the device, so only the administrator can access the Admin menu.
* If you have lost the Admin PIN, contact the installation company.


---

### User

Describes how to register, edit, delete, and manage users.

#### Registering user information[‚Äã](#registering-user-information "Direct link to Registering user information")

You can register user information that includes biometric authentication data.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select USER ‚Üí ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add2.svg) and set the desired items. User usage information appears.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-user-add.png)

   * ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-photo1.svg): You can register a user photo.

   * **Name**: Enter the user name.

   * **ID**: Enter a number between 1 and 4294967295 to register a user ID. If User ID Type is set to Alphanumeric, you can use a combination of alphanumeric characters and symbols `_` `-` as the ID, with a maximum of 32 characters.

   * Face: You can register a face for user authentication. Press Face ‚Üí Next and follow the instructions on the screen to enroll your face. To enroll more faces, click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add2.svg). Please refer to [Enrolling user faces](#enrolling-user-faces) to learn more about face enrollment.

   * Fingerprint: FSF2-ODB You can enroll a fingerprint for user authentication. Press Fingerprint ‚Üí Next and follow the on-screen instructions to enroll a fingerprint. To enroll more fingerprints, press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add2.svg). For more information on fingerprint registration, refer to [User fingerprint enrollment](#enrolling-user-fingerprint).

   * Card: You can enroll a card for user authentication. Press Card ‚Üí Next and scan the card to assign to the user in the RF card authentication section. To enroll more cards, click ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add2.svg).

   * PIN: You can enter the PIN you want to use. Press PIN ‚Üí Next and enter the PIN you want to use. For confirmation, enter the PIN once more and then press OK. To prevent leaks, input a PIN of 4 to 16 digits.

   * Operator Level: You can select permissions to assign to the user.

     Info

     Available menus vary according to the set user level.

     * None: This is a general user level, and the menu is not available.

     * Administrator: You can use all menus.

     * Configuration: You can use the menus AUTHENTICATION, DISPLAY & SOUND, DEVICE, NETWORK, EVENT LOG.

     * User Management: You can use the menus USER, EVENT LOG.

   * Period: You can set the duration for using the user account.

   * Duress: FSF2-ODB Select to enroll a duress fingerprint. If you are coerced by someone or need to open the door forcefully, authenticating with this fingerprint can send an alarm signal to BioStar X.

   * Extended Private Auth Mode: You can set the extended personal authentication mode. Using the extended personal authentication mode, you can combine methods of authentication including face and fingerprint for each user. Otherwise, you can use the device‚Äôs basic authentication mode.

   Info

   Fingerprint registration is only available on the FSF2-ODB product.

3. Press Save to complete the registration of user information.

#### Enrolling user faces[‚Äã](#enrolling-user-faces "Direct link to Enrolling user faces")

<!-- -->

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select USER ‚Üí ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add2.svg).

3. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-face-bs3.png) Face ‚Üí Next.

4. Adjust a distance between the face and screen and look straight at the camera of the device.

5. After the shooting is complete, press OK ‚Üí Save. To retake your face picture, press Re-Shot.

Info

* Face information from FaceStation F2 is not compatible with face templates from FaceStation 2 and FaceLite.

* You can also batch enroll face information from FaceStation F2 by uploading photos from the device or importing from a CSV in BioStar X. You can also enroll visual face with your smartphone via a link sent from BioStar 2. For more information on each registration method, please refer to the [BioStar X Administrator Guide](/docs/en/platform/biostar_x/enroll-credential-face).

* To use a Visual Face feature correctly, take a picture by following instructions below.

  * Keep the distance between the device and your face at 60-100 cm when enrolling your face.

  <!-- -->

  * Do not change your face expression.

  * Do not wear masks, hats, or eye patches.

  * Do not enroll a face wearing a mask. It may increase the False Acceptance Rate (FAR) if both faces with and without a mask are enrolled.

  * Do not raise head up or lower head.

  * Do not wear thick makeup.

  * Do not close your eyes.

  * Make sure that both of your shoulders correctly appear on the screen.

  * Stand still and enroll your face by staring at the screen.

  * Be careful not to display two faces on the screen. Enroll one person at a time.

  * If you do not follow the instructions on the screen, the face enrollment may take longer or may fail.

#### User fingerprint registration FSF2-ODB[‚Äã](#enrolling-user-fingerprint "Direct link to enrolling-user-fingerprint")

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select USER ‚Üí ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-add2.svg).

3. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-authmode-fingerprint.png) Fingerprint ‚Üí Next.

4. After scanning the fingerprint of the finger to be enrolled, scan the same finger's fingerprint again.

Info

* Fingerprint registration is only available on the FSF2-ODB product.

* Place the finger deep enough to contact with the sensor completely.

* Place the center of the fingerprint in the center of the sensor.

* If a finger has a cut or the fingerprint is blurry, select another finger for the fingerprint.

* Enter accurately according to the on-screen instructions when authenticating fingerprints.

* If you make the finger upright so that the contact area with the sensor is decreased or the angle of finger is warped, fingerprint authentication may not be performed.

#### Modifying User Information[‚Äã](#modifying-user-information "Direct link to Modifying User Information")

User Management or Administrator can modify the registered user information. A card or face can be added, and PIN and level can be modified.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Click USER ‚Üí ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-search.svg).

3. Select your search terms. You can search for users using All, User ID, Name, Face, Fingerprint, Card.

4. Select the user to modify.

5. Modify the information by referring to [Registering user information](#registering-user-information) and press OK.

   * To delete a user, select ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-delete.svg) and then press OK.

Info

* Fingerprint searching is only available on the FSF2-ODB product.

* Access Group can be registered in BioStar X. For more information on registering access groups, refer to the [BioStar X Administrator Guide](/docs/en/platform/biostar_x/settings-access-control-manage-access-group#addAccessGroup).

#### Delete All Users[‚Äã](#delete-all-users "Direct link to Delete All Users")

You can delete all registered users at once.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Select USER ‚Üí ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-delete.svg).

3. Select Delete All to check, then press OK.

4. To delete all users, press OK.

#### View User Usage[‚Äã](#view-user-usage "Direct link to View User Usage")

View the number of enrolled users, faces, fingerprints, and cards at a glance.

1. Press ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-menu.svg) and authenticate with the Admin level credential.

2. Press USER ‚Üí ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-info1.svg). User usage information appears.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/fsf2-user-usage.png)

   Info

   The number of fingerprints can only be checked on the FSF2-ODB product.

### Input Module

The Input Module supports Supervised Input (12 channels), relay (2 channels), AUX input (2 channels), and tamper input (1 channel), and can be connected to a single master device in an RS-485 chain of up to 31 devices. Can be used in conjunction with detection sensors or access doors, and can be easily integrated with other systems using dry contact method.

![Example banner](/docs/en/assets/images/inputmodule-main-8727f23461f41f878accec8bfeeff4bb.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

#### [Getting Started‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/getting-started)

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### [Installation‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/installation)

Provides the complete process and connection examples required for product installation.

#### [Product Specifications‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/product-specifications)

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

#### [Regulatory Information‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/regulatory-information)

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

<!-- -->

#### Accessory[‚Äã](#accessory "Direct link to Accessory")

<!-- -->

This product can be purchased with the enclosure (ENCR-10) as an accessory, and you can install two products in one enclosure.

The enclosure includes a power status LED board, power distribution board, power supply, and tamper. Refer to [Enclosure Installation](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/installation#install-enclosure) for how to install the product in the enclosure.

|                                               |
| --------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-encr10.svg) |
| ENCR-10                                       |

Info

* The ENCR-10 is designed to be mounted on a wall for use. Install it at a safe and convenient height without restrictions on installation height.

- The ENCR-10 components include screws for housing fixation, screws for product fixation, and screws for power device connection. Use each screw correctly according to its purpose.

  * Fixing screws for the enclosure (diameter: 4 mm, length: 25 mm) x4

  * Fixing screws for the device (diameter: 3 mm, length: 5 mm) x6

  * Fixing screws for the power supply cable (diameter: 3 mm, length: 8 mm) x1

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/device/name-function-each-part-im120.svg)

| No. | Name                                      |
| --- | ----------------------------------------- |
| 1   | **RESET** button                          |
| 2   | **INIT** button                           |
| 3   | **SUPERVISED INPUT (9:11)** connection    |
| 4   | **SUPERVISED INPUT (6:8)** connection     |
| 5   | **RELAY 1** connection                    |
| 6   | **TAMPER** or **AUX IN (0:1)** connection |
| 7   | **RS-485** termination resistor switch    |
| 8   | **RS-485** connection                     |
| 9   | **POWER** connection (DC 12 or 24 V)      |
| 10  | **RELAY 0** connection                    |
| 11  | **SUPERVISED INPUT (3:5)** connection     |
| 12  | **SUPERVISED INPUT (0:2)** connection     |

Info

* Press the **INIT** button for more than 2 seconds after initializing the product linked to the device to connect it to another device.

* Press the **RESET** button to reboot the product.

##### LED Status Indicator[‚Äã](#led-status-indicator "Direct link to LED Status Indicator")

You can check the product operating status by the color of the LED status indicator.

| Item                         | LED             | Status                                                                         |
| ---------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **POWER**                    | Red Lit         | Power On                                                                       |
| **STATUS**                   | Green Lit       | Connected status via secure session                                            |
|                              | Blue Lit        | Not connected to the master device                                             |
|                              | Pink Lit        | In the process of upgrading firmware                                           |
|                              | Yellow Lit      | Communication error due to different key or packet loss in OSDP causing RS-485 |
|                              | Sky Blue Lit    | Connected status without secure session                                        |
|                              | Green blinking  | Final input waiting status during configuration initialization                 |
|                              | Green Lit       | Configuration initialization completed                                         |
| **SUPERVISED INPUT (0~11)** | Red Lit         | Receiving input signal status                                                  |
| **RELAY (0, 1)**             | Red Lit         | Relay Operation                                                                |
| **RS-485 TX**                | Orange blinking | In the process of transmitting RS-485 data                                     |
| **RS-485 RX**                | Green blinking  | In the process of receiving RS-485 data                                        |
| **AUX IN (0, 1)**            | Orange Lit      | In the process of receiving AUX signal                                         |
| **TAMPER**                   | Orange Lit      | Tamper action                                                                  |

##### Installation example[‚Äã](#installation-example "Direct link to Installation example")

This product supports immediate relay actions for input detected in real-time in conjunction with BioStar X, and can also perform relay actions or log data for inputs detected when disconnected from the master device.

Supports 1-channel RS-485 for network with the master device, 12 channels of Supervised Input for detecting short circuits, on, off states, and 2-channel relay, 2-channel AUX input, and 1-channel tamper input.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-example-im120.png)


---

### Installation

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### Product Fixation[‚Äã](#product-fixation "Direct link to Product Fixation")

1. Secure the spacer with fixing screws at the location where the product will be mounted.

2. Tighten the product onto the secured spacer using fixing screws.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device-im120.svg)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Power Supply Connection[‚Äã](#power-supply-connection "Direct link to Power Supply Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-power-connection-im120.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

* Make sure to use separate power for the access control device and products.

- Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

Info

It is recommended to connect and use an Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) to prevent power failure.

#### RS-485 Connection[‚Äã](#rs-485-connection "Direct link to RS-485 Connection")

You can connect the product to the master device.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-rs485-connection-im120.png)

Info

* Use AWG26 or larger for RS-485 cables, and all wiring must comply with ANSI/NFPA 70 standards.

* Use an AWG24 twisted pair with a maximum length of 1.2 km for the RS-485 cable.

* It is recommended to use RS-485 cables with a characteristic impedance of 120 Œ©.

* Connect termination resistors (120 Œ©) at both ends of the RS-485 daisy chain connection. If connected to the middle line, the signal level becomes smaller and the communication performance will deteriorate. Make sure to connect it to both ends of the daisy chain connection. Set this product's termination resistor switch to ON.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Relay Connection[‚Äã](#relay-connection "Direct link to Relay Connection")

<!-- -->

You can control the entrance door locking mechanism or alarm system with the relay of this product. Refer to the guide of the device to be connected and connect the relay as NC or NO.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-im120.png)

##### Fail Safe Lock[‚Äã](#fail-safe-lock "Direct link to Fail Safe Lock")

In order to use the Fail Safe Lock, connect the **NC** relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally a current flowing through the relay for the Fail Safe Lock. When the relay is activated, blocking the current flow, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will open.

Info

Connect a diode to both ends of the power input as shown in the figure below when installing a deadbolt or a door strike. Make sure to connect the Cathode (direction to the stripe) to the + part of the power while paying attention to the direction of the diode.

Do not connect the relay of this product in duplicate to the device connected to the relay port of the master device.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-safe-lock-im120.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

##### Fail Secure Lock[‚Äã](#fail-secure-lock "Direct link to Fail Secure Lock")

In order to use the Fail Secure Lock, connect **NO** relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally no current flowing through the relay for the Fail Secure Lock. When the current flow is activated by the relay, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will lock.

Info

Connect a diode to both ends of the power input as shown in the figure below when installing a deadbolt or a door strike. Make sure to connect the Cathode (direction to the stripe) to the + part of the power while paying attention to the direction of the diode.

Do not connect the relay of this product in duplicate to the device connected to the relay port of the master device.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-secure-lock-im120.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Supervised Input Connection[‚Äã](#supervised-input-connection "Direct link to Supervised Input Connection")

You can connect fire detection sensors, heat detection sensors, burglar sensors, door sensors, exit buttons, etc. **SUPERVISED INPUT** Terminals 0~11 can detect voltage flowing through the circuit to monitor the device's short circuit, open circuit, on, and off states, and can also be used as general input.

Set the actions based on the product's status in BioStar X and monitor the input status.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-supervised-input-connection-im120.png)

Info

* Do not connect the product's inputs in duplicate to the devices connected to the master device's input ports.

* This product can connect resistors of 1kŒ©, 2.2kŒ©, 4.7kŒ©, and 10kŒ©. After connecting the appropriate resistor to the input device, set the resistor value the same in BioStar X.

#### Tamper Connection[‚Äã](#tamper-connection "Direct link to Tamper Connection")

It can trigger an alarm or leave an event log if the product is detached from its installation due to external factors.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-tamper-connection-im120.png)

#### Enclosure installation[‚Äã](#install-enclosure "Direct link to Enclosure installation")

For physical and electrical protection, the product can be installed inside the enclosure (ENCR-10). The enclosure includes a power status LED board, power distribution board, power supply, and tamper. The enclosure is sold separately.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

##### Backup battery fixing[‚Äã](#backup-battery-fixing "Direct link to Backup battery fixing")

Insert the battery Velcro strap into the case, then secure the battery.

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-battery.png)

Caution

Use a backup battery that is 12 VDC specification and 7 Ah or higher. This product has been tested with the 'ES7-12' product from 'ROCKET', and it is recommended to use products equivalent to 'ES7-12'.

Info

* The backup battery is sold separately.

* Be sure to check the size and shape of the backup battery terminals. If the size of the backup battery exceeds the recommended specifications, it may not fit in the case or the case may not close after installation. Additionally, if the shape and size of the terminals are different, you will not be able to connect the battery using the provided cable.

  ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-enclosure-battery-size.svg)

##### Product Fixation[‚Äã](#product-fixation "Direct link to Product Fixation")

1. Check the location to mount the product in the enclosure. You can install 2 products in 1 enclosure.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-fix1-2device.png)

2. Place the product in the enclosure according to the mounting location and secure it with screws.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-fix2-im120.png)

Info

* The ENCR-10 is designed to be mounted on a wall for use. Install it at a safe and convenient height without restrictions on installation height.

- The ENCR-10 components include screws for housing fixation, screws for product fixation, and screws for power device connection. Use each screw correctly according to its purpose.

  * Fixing screws for the enclosure (diameter: 4 mm, length: 25 mm) x4

  * Fixing screws for the device (diameter: 3 mm, length: 5 mm) x6

  * Fixing screws for the power supply cable (diameter: 3 mm, length: 8 mm) x1

##### Power and AUX input connection[‚Äã](#power-and-aux-input-connection "Direct link to Power and AUX input connection")

To prevent power interruptions, you can connect an uninterruptible power supply (UPS), and contact outputs from power outage detectors or other devices can be connected to the AUX IN terminal.

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-power-aux-input-connection-im120.png)

Caution

* Make sure to use separate power for the access control device and products.

* Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/product-specifications#specs.power) section of the product specifications for the maximum current consumption rating.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

* Use a backup battery that is 12 VDC specification and 7 Ah or higher. This product has been tested with the 'ES7-12' product from 'ROCKET', and it is recommended to use products equivalent to 'ES7-12'.

##### Tamper Connection[‚Äã](#tamper-connection "Direct link to Tamper Connection")

If the enclosure is opened due to external factors, it can trigger an alarm or leave an event log.

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-connection-im120.png)

Info

For more detailed information on product installation, contact Suprema Technical Support Team (<CS@suprema.co.kr>).


---

### Product Specifications

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### General[‚Äã](#specs.general)

Model Name

IM-120

CPU

Cortex M3 72 MHz

Memory

512 KB Flash + 64 KB SRAM

LED

Multi-color

* POWER: 1ea
* STATUS: 1ea
* RS-485 TX: 1ea
* RS-485 RX: 1ea
* SUPERVISED INPUT: 12ea
* RELAY: 2ea
* AUX IN: 2ea
* TAMPER: 1ea

Operating Temperature

-20 ¬∞C ~ 60 ¬∞C

Storage Temperature

-40 ¬∞C ~ 70 ¬∞C

Operating Humidity

0 % ~ 95 %, non-condensing

Storage Humidity

0 % ~ 95 %, non-condensing

Certifications

CE, UKCA, KC, FCC, RCM, RoHS, REACH, WEEE

<!-- -->

#### Capacity[‚Äã](#specs.storage)

Max. Text logs

10 ea per port

[](#anno1)

<!-- -->

#### Interfaces[‚Äã](#specs.interface)

Input

12 ch

[](#anno2)

Supervised Input

12 ch[](#anno2)

RS-485

1 ch

RS-485 Communication Protocol

OSDP V2 compliant

Relay

2 relays

AUX Input

2 ch (AC POWER FAIL)

Tamper

1 ch

<!-- -->

#### Electrical[‚Äã](#specs.power)

Power

12 Vdc

Current: Max. 0.2 A

24 Vdc

Current: Max. 0.1 A

Switch Input VIH

Max.: 5 V (Dry Contact)

Relay

5 A @ 30 VDC Resistive load

#### Dimensions and Weight[‚Äã](#dimensions-and-weight "Direct link to Dimensions and Weight")

The dimensional tolerance is ¬±0.3 mm.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/im120-dimension.svg)

***

[1)](#anno1_dest) Up to 10 events that occurred when the network connection was lost will be saved per port, and when there are more than 10 events, the events will be deleted in the order they occurred from the log.

[2)](#anno2_dest) You can choose to use either Input or Supervised input.

Info

Product specifications are subject to change without notice for performance improvement.

### Regulatory Information

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

<!-- -->

#### FCC Compliance Information[‚Äã](#fcc-compliance-information "Direct link to FCC Compliance Information")

THIS DEVICE COMPLIES WITH PART 15 OF THE FCC RULES.

Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

1. This device may not cause harmful interference, and

2. This device must accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation.

Info

This equipment has been tested and found to comply with the limits for a <!-- -->Class A<!-- --> digital device, pursuant to part 15 of the FCC Rules. These limits are designed to provide reasonable protection against harmful interference when the equipment is operated in a commercial environment. This equipment generates, uses, and can radiate radio frequency energy and, if not installed and used in accordance with the instruction manual, may cause harmful interference to radio communications. Operation of this equipment in a residential area is likely to cause harmful interference in which case the user will be required to correct the interference at his own expense.

Any changes or modifications not expressly approved by the party responsible for compliance could void the user‚Äôs authority to operate this equipment.

This transmitter must not be co-located or operating in conjunction with any other antenna or transmitter.

This equipment complies with FCC radiation exposure limits set forth for an uncontrolled environment. This equipment should be installed and operated with minimum distance 20 cm between the radiator and your body. Do not install or operate this device and its antenna in conjunction with any other antenna or RF transmission device.

<!-- -->

[Suprema Inc.](https://www.supremainc.com)

Tel: +82-31-783-4502 / Fax: +82-31-783-4503

### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

**When installing the product outdoors, make sure to install it in a shaded and well-ventilated area**.

**Do not use a completely sealed enclosure when installing the product outdoors**.

* The internal temperature of the enclosure may rise due to direct sunlight, causing fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

**Before connecting the power to the product, check the manual again to ensure that wiring is correct, then connect the power**.

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

**Do not leave power cables in passageways**.

* May cause bodily injury or product damage.

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Use a power adapter that has IEC/EN 62368-1 approval and is rated above the power consumption of the terminal device**. **It is recommended to use the power adapters sold by Suprema**.

* Using an unsuitable power supply may cause devices to malfunction.

* Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/inputmodule/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Ensure the power supply is not interrupted during firmware upgrades of the product**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not press the product's buttons (touchpad) forcefully or use sharp tools to press them**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Use the product within <!-- -->-20 ¬∞C ~ 60 ¬∞C<!-- --> and store it at appropriate temperatures, not too low or too high**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.


---

### Output Module

The Output Module is a multi-output control module that can use 12 relay outputs. When configured with BioStar X, it can be used for floor access control. A maximum of 31 devices can be connected to a single master device via RS-485 chain, and AUX inputs can also be used. Additionally, it can be utilized in various ways in conjunction with anti-passback areas or fire alarm zones.

![Example banner](/docs/en/assets/images/outputmodule-main-3c789506b4665dfcd5f8b83f6433c5e1.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

#### [Getting Started‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/getting-started)

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### [Installation‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/installation)

Provides the complete process and connection examples required for product installation.

#### [Product Specifications‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/product-specifications)

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

#### [Regulatory Information‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/regulatory-information)

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

#### [Appendices‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/appendices)

Includes legal notices contained in the product.

#### Accessory[‚Äã](#accessory "Direct link to Accessory")

<!-- -->

This product can be purchased with the enclosure (ENCR-10) as an accessory, and you can install two products in one enclosure.

The enclosure includes a power status LED board, power distribution board, power supply, and tamper. Refer to [Enclosure Installation](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/installation#install-enclosure) for how to install the product in the enclosure.

|                                               |
| --------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-encr10.svg) |
| ENCR-10                                       |

Info

* The ENCR-10 is designed to be mounted on a wall for use. Install it at a safe and convenient height without restrictions on installation height.

- The ENCR-10 components include screws for housing fixation, screws for product fixation, and screws for power device connection. Use each screw correctly according to its purpose.

  * Fixing screws for the enclosure (diameter: 4 mm, length: 25 mm) x4

  * Fixing screws for the device (diameter: 3 mm, length: 5 mm) x6

  * Fixing screws for the power supply cable (diameter: 3 mm, length: 8 mm) x1

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/name-function-each-part-om120.svg)

Info

* Press the **INIT** button for more than 2 seconds after initializing the product linked to the device to connect it to another device.

* Press the **RESET** button to reboot the product.

##### LED Status Indicator[‚Äã](#led-status-indicator "Direct link to LED Status Indicator")

You can check the product operating status by the color of the LED status indicator.

| Item              | LED             | Status                                                                         |
| ----------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **POWER**         | Red Lit         | Power On                                                                       |
| **STATUS**        | Green Lit       | Connected status via secure session                                            |
|                   | Blue Lit        | Not connected to the master device                                             |
|                   | Pink Lit        | In the process of upgrading firmware                                           |
|                   | Yellow Lit      | Communication error due to different key or packet loss in OSDP causing RS-485 |
|                   | Sky Blue Lit    | Connected status without secure session                                        |
| **RELAY (0~11)** | Red Lit         | Relay Operation                                                                |
| **RS-485 TX**     | Orange blinking | In the process of transmitting RS-485 data                                     |
| **RS-485 RX**     | Green blinking  | In the process of receiving RS-485 data                                        |
| **AUX IN (0, 1)** | Orange Lit      | In the process of receiving AUX signal                                         |

##### Installation example[‚Äã](#installation-example "Direct link to Installation example")

This product is an extension module that controls access to building floors. By connecting to Suprema devices and BioStar X, one module can control 12 floors.

When connected in an RS-485 daisy chain, up to 192 floors can be controlled per elevator.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-example-om120.png)

### Installation

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### Product Fixation[‚Äã](#product-fixation "Direct link to Product Fixation")

1. Secure the spacer with fixing screws at the location where the product will be mounted.

2. Tighten the product onto the secured spacer using fixing screws.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device-om120.svg)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Power Supply Connection[‚Äã](#power-supply-connection "Direct link to Power Supply Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-power-connection-om120.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

* Make sure to use separate power for the access control device and products.

- Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

Info

It is recommended to connect and use an Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) to prevent power failure.

#### RS-485 Connection[‚Äã](#rs-485-connection "Direct link to RS-485 Connection")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-rs485-connection-om120.png)

Info

* Use an AWG24 twisted pair with a maximum length of 1.2 km for the RS-485 cable.

* It is recommended to use RS-485 cables with a characteristic impedance of 120 Œ©.

* Connect termination resistors (120 Œ©) at both ends of the RS-485 daisy chain connection. If connected to the middle line, the signal level becomes smaller and the communication performance will deteriorate. Make sure to connect it to both ends of the daisy chain connection. Set this product's termination resistor switch to ON.

* This product can connect up to 31 devices to a single master device.

#### Relay Connection[‚Äã](#relay-connection "Direct link to Relay Connection")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-om120.png)

Info

* The method for connecting the relay may vary depending on the type of elevator. For more details, contact the elevator construction company.

* Each relay output must be correctly connected to the control panel and floor buttons.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### AUX IN[‚Äã](#aux-in "Direct link to AUX IN")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

You can connect the contact output (dry contact output) of another device or tamper to the AUX port.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-aux-connection-om120.png)

#### Enclosure installation[‚Äã](#install-enclosure "Direct link to Enclosure installation")

For physical and electrical protection, the product can be installed inside the enclosure (ENCR-10). The enclosure includes a power status LED board, power distribution board, power supply, and tamper. The enclosure is sold separately.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

  ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-enclosure-battery-size.svg)

##### Power and AUX input connection[‚Äã](#power-and-aux-input-connection "Direct link to Power and AUX input connection")

![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-enclosure-power-aux-input-connection-om120.png)

If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [power](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/product-specifications#specs.power) section of the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

Info

### Product Specifications

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### General[‚Äã](#specs.general)

Model Name

OM-120

CPU

Cortex M3 72 MHz

Memory

128 KB Flash + 20 KB SRAM

LED

Multi-color

* POWER: 1ea
* STATUS: 1ea
* RELAY: 12ea
* RS-485 TX: 1ea
* RS-485 RX: 1ea
* AUX IN: 2ea

Operating Temperature

-20 ¬∞C ~ 60 ¬∞C

Storage Temperature

-40 ¬∞C ~ 70 ¬∞C

Operating Humidity

0 % ~ 95 %, non-condensing

Storage Humidity

0 % ~ 95 %, non-condensing

Certifications

CE, UKCA, KC, FCC, RoHS, REACH, WEEE

<!-- -->

#### Interfaces[‚Äã](#specs.interface)

RS-485

1 ch

RS-485 Communication Protocol

OSDP V2 compliant

AUX Input

2 ch Dry Contact Input

Relay

12 relays

<!-- -->

#### Electrical[‚Äã](#specs.power)

Power

12 Vdc

Current: Max. 0.6 A

Switch Input VIH

Max.: 5 V (Dry Contact)

Relay

5 A @ 30 VDC Resistive load

#### Dimensions and Weight[‚Äã](#dimensions-and-weight "Direct link to Dimensions and Weight")

The dimensional tolerance is ¬±0.3 mm.

### Regulatory Information

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### FCC Compliance Information[‚Äã](#fcc-compliance-information "Direct link to FCC Compliance Information")

THIS DEVICE COMPLIES WITH PART 15 OF THE FCC RULES.

Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

1. This device may not cause harmful interference, and

2. This device must accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation.

Info

This equipment has been tested and found to comply with the limits for a <!-- -->Class A<!-- --> digital device, pursuant to part 15 of the FCC Rules. These limits are designed to provide reasonable protection against harmful interference when the equipment is operated in a commercial environment. This equipment generates, uses, and can radiate radio frequency energy and, if not installed and used in accordance with the instruction manual, may cause harmful interference to radio communications. Operation of this equipment in a residential area is likely to cause harmful interference in which case the user will be required to correct the interference at his own expense.

Any changes or modifications not expressly approved by the party responsible for compliance could void the user‚Äôs authority to operate this equipment.

This transmitter must not be co-located or operating in conjunction with any other antenna or transmitter.

This equipment complies with FCC radiation exposure limits set forth for an uncontrolled environment. This equipment should be installed and operated with minimum distance 20 cm between the radiator and your body. Do not install or operate this device and its antenna in conjunction with any other antenna or RF transmission device.

### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

**When installing the product outdoors, make sure to install it in a shaded and well-ventilated area**.

**Do not use a completely sealed enclosure when installing the product outdoors**.

* The internal temperature of the enclosure may rise due to direct sunlight, causing fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

**Before connecting the power to the product, check the manual again to ensure that wiring is correct, then connect the power**.

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

**Do not leave power cables in passageways**.

* May cause bodily injury or product damage.

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Use a power adapter that has IEC/EN 62368-1 approval and is rated above the power consumption of the terminal device**. **It is recommended to use the power adapters sold by Suprema**.

* Using an unsuitable power supply may cause devices to malfunction.

* Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/outputmodule/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Ensure the power supply is not interrupted during firmware upgrades of the product**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not press the product's buttons (touchpad) forcefully or use sharp tools to press them**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Use the product within <!-- -->-20 ¬∞C ~ 60 ¬∞C<!-- --> and store it at appropriate temperatures, not too low or too high**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.


---

### Secure Module

Secure Module is a separate controller for controlling one external door relay and expanding input/output. It can be used with Suprema IP access control devices for encrypted communication, enhancing security and providing a solution optimized for the usage environment.

![](/docs/en/img/device/securemodule-main.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/securemodule/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

#### [Getting Started‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/securemodule/getting-started)

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### [Connect‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/securemodule/installation)

You can check examples of connecting the product.

#### [Product Specifications‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/securemodule/product-specifications)

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

#### [Regulatory Information‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/securemodule/regulatory-information)

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

#### [Appendices‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/securemodule/appendices)

Includes legal notices contained in the product.
