### Getting Started

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### Components[‚Äã](#components "Direct link to Components")

|                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-device-sio2.svg) |
| Secure I/O 2                                       |

|                                                |                                                          |                                                 |                                               |
| ---------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------- |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-screws2.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-wall-bracket-sio2.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-resistor.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-diode1.svg) |
| Fixing Screws x2                               | Wall Bracket x2                                          | 120 Œ© Resistor                                  | Diode                                         |

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/name-function-each-part-sio2.png)

Info

* Press the **INIT** button for more than 2 seconds after initializing the product linked to the device to connect it to another device.

* Press the **RESET** button to reboot the product.

##### Installation example[‚Äã](#installation-example "Direct link to Installation example")

This product connects via RS-485 and can be installed in various locations due to its compact size.

It can be installed in conjunction with a junction box or mounted onto an existing wall control box. It can also be installed behind the exit button.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-example-sio2.png)


---

### Connect

You can check examples of connecting the product.

Info

* Use AWG22 to AWG16 cables for connection with the product.

* To connect the cable to the product's cable connector, strip the end of the cable about 5 to 6 mm.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Power Supply Connection[‚Äã](#power-supply-connection "Direct link to Power Supply Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-power-connection-sio2.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

* Make sure to use separate power for the access control device and products.

- Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/securemodule/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

<!-- -->

#### RS-485 Connection[‚Äã](#rs-485-connection "Direct link to RS-485 Connection")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-rs485-connection-sio2.png)

Info

* Use an AWG24 twisted pair with a maximum length of 1.2 km for the RS-485 cable.

* It is recommended to use RS-485 cables with a characteristic impedance of 120 Œ©.

* If connecting with a RS-485 daisy chain, connect the termination resistor (120 Œ©) to both ends of the daisy chain connection. If connected to the middle line, the signal level becomes smaller and the communication performance will deteriorate. Make sure to connect it to both ends of the daisy chain connection.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Relay Connection[‚Äã](#relay-connection "Direct link to Relay Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

##### Fail Safe Lock[‚Äã](#fail-safe-lock "Direct link to Fail Safe Lock")

In order to use the Fail Safe Lock, connect the **NC** relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally a current flowing through the relay for the Fail Safe Lock. When the relay is activated, blocking the current flow, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will open.

Info

Connect a diode to both ends of the power input as shown in the figure below when installing a deadbolt or a door strike. Make sure to connect the Cathode (direction to the stripe) to the + part of the power while paying attention to the direction of the diode.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-safe-lock-sio2.png)

<!-- -->

##### Fail Secure Lock[‚Äã](#fail-secure-lock "Direct link to Fail Secure Lock")

In order to use the Fail Secure Lock, connect **NO** relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally no current flowing through the relay for the Fail Secure Lock. When the current flow is activated by the relay, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will lock.

Info

Connect a diode to both ends of the power input as shown in the figure below when installing a deadbolt or a door strike. Make sure to connect the Cathode (direction to the stripe) to the + part of the power while paying attention to the direction of the diode.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-secure-lock-sio2.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Exit button[‚Äã](#exit-button-1 "Direct link to Exit button")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-door-button-connection-sio2.png)

#### Door sensor[‚Äã](#door-sensor-1 "Direct link to Door sensor")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-door-sensor-connection-sio2.png)

### Firmware Version 1.1.2 (Build No. 1.1.2_150129)

Release|2015-01-29

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. When receiving OSDP Output Command, does not respond immediately. It will respond after receiving Poll Command.

2. Changes MSB/LSB order for Serial Number

3. Changes OSDP PDID

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. FIB and BSN values are read incorrectly.

2. OSDP SecuBlock Key is changed incorrectly.

   * Add two Manufacturer Specific Command (MFG\_RELAY\_ON and MFG\_RELAY\_OFF)

   * Add ability to change Secure Key in Secure Session

### Firmware Version 1.2.3 (Build No. 1.2.3_171229)

Release|2018-04-13

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. When there is the response data with OSDP Secure Session, it responds with 0x16 for SEC\_BLK\_TYPE value and responds with 0x18 when there is no data.

2. Verified OSDP compatibility with the latest version of the master device.

   * FS2-AWB/D(V1.1.0)

   * BSA2-OEPW/OHPW/OIPW/OMPW(V1.5.0)

   * BS2-OEPW/OHPW/OIPW/OMPW(V1.6.0)

   * CS40(V1.1.0)

   * BEW2-OAP/ODP/OHP/OAP(UL)(V1.2.0)

   * BSL2-OE/OM(V1.3.0)

   * BEP2-OA/OD/ODS(V1.1.0)

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Problems with data communication when changing RS485 baud rate to 9600 bps with osdp\_COMSET command


---

### Firmware Version 1.2.4 (Build No. 1.2.4_181031)

Release|2018-11-29

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. If the data transmission fails when communicating with OSDP, it is transmitted again.

2. When there is the response data with OSDP Secure Session, it responds with 0x16 for SEC\_BLK\_TYPE value and responds with 0x18 when there is no data.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Problems with data communication when changing RS485 baud rate to 9600 bps with osdp\_COMSET command.

### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

**When installing the product outdoors, make sure to install it in a shaded and well-ventilated area**.

**Do not use a completely sealed enclosure when installing the product outdoors**.

* The internal temperature of the enclosure may rise due to direct sunlight, causing fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

**Before connecting the power to the product, check the manual again to ensure that wiring is correct, then connect the power**.

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

**Do not leave power cables in passageways**.

* May cause bodily injury or product damage.

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Use a power adapter that has IEC/EN 62368-1 approval and is rated above the power consumption of the terminal device**. **It is recommended to use the power adapters sold by Suprema**.

* Using an unsuitable power supply may cause devices to malfunction.

* Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/securemodule/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Ensure that Secure I/O 2, electric lock (electronic locking device), and access control devices use separate power supplies**.

* Devices may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Ensure the power supply is not interrupted during firmware upgrades of the product**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not press the product's buttons (touchpad) forcefully or use sharp tools to press them**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Use the product within <!-- -->-20 ¬∞C to 50 ¬∞C<!-- --> and store it at appropriate temperatures, not too low or too high**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.


---

### XPass 2

XPass 2 is a compact outdoor RFID device based on Suprema's latest RFID technology and multi-hardware platform. It supports mullion type that can be installed on door frames, gangbox type that can be installed on switch boxes, and keypad type, enabling perfect adaptation to various installation environments.

Additionally, it applies Dual-Frequency (125kHz / 13.56MHz) RFID technology, supporting various standards of cards including EM, MIFARE, DESFire EV1, as well as mobile cards using NFC and BLE, optimized for outdoor installation with IP67 rated waterproof and dustproof performance and IK08 rated vandal-proof structure, allowing installation anywhere users need.

![Example banner](/docs/en/assets/images/xpass2-main-f3c49f144445d2b659f2e35269e3ebd6.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

#### [Getting Started‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/getting-started)

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### [Installation‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/installation)

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### [Product Specifications‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/product-specifications)

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

#### [Regulatory Information‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/regulatory-information)

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

#### [Appendices‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/appendices)

Includes legal notices contained in the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

- When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/name-function-each-part-xp2.png)

* **LED Indicator**: Indicates the operational status of the device with the color of the LED.

  * Green: Authentication success.

  * Red: Authentication failure.

  * Blue/Cyan blinking: Normal operation.

  * Blue/Green blinking: During network settings initialization

  * Green blinking: Waiting for input.

  * Green/White blinking: Connecting to the Suprema AirFob Pass (BLE) application

  * White blinking: Connecting to the Device Manager application

* **RF card and mobile access card authentication unit**: Part to scan a RFID card or mobile access card for entrance.

* **Mobile Access Card Recognition Area**: This is the part that recognizes mobile access cards for entry.

* **Reset Button**

  * Initializes network settings. For more information on initializing network settings, refer to [the following](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/installation#reset-network-settings).

  * Deletes all information and certificates stored on the device and initializes the settings. For more information on factory initialization, refer to [the following](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/installation#factory-reset).

* **Cable**

  Power / RS-485 / Ethernet / Wiegand I/O / Input / Relay

* **Keypad**: XP2-GKDPB Used to authenticate by directly entering the Card ID. To authenticate using direct input mode, change the authentication method settings in BioStar X.

  * **0-9**: Used when entering numbers.

  * ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-star.svg): Used to distinguish between FC code and ID when entering Wiegand Card ID.

  * ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-pound.svg): Used to terminate input.

##### Cable[‚Äã](#cable "Direct link to Cable")

![](/docs/en/img/device/cables-layout-xp2.png)

| Pin | Name      | Color                 |
| --- | --------- | --------------------- |
| 1   | 485 TRXP  | Blue (White Stripe)   |
| 2   | 485 TRXN  | Yellow (Black Stripe) |
| 3   | 485 GND   | White (Black Stripe)  |
| 4   | ENET RXN  | Yellow                |
| 5   | ENET RXP  | Black                 |
| 6   | ENET TXN  | Orange                |
| 7   | ENET TXP  | White                 |
| 8   | ENET VB1  | Red                   |
| 9   | ENET VB1  | Green                 |
| 10  | ENET VB2  | Blue                  |
| 11  | ENET VB2  | Brown                 |
| 12  | WG GND    | Black                 |
| 13  | WG D1     | White                 |
| 14  | WG D0     | Green                 |
| 15  | INPUT0    | Purple                |
| 16  | INPUT1    | Brown                 |
| 17  | INPUT GND | Gray                  |
| 18  | RLY NO    | Gray (White Stripe)   |
| 19  | RLY COM   | Green (White Stripe)  |
| 20  | RLY NC    | Orange (White Stripe) |
| 21  | PWR +VDC  | Red                   |
| 22  | PWR GND   | Black (White Stripe)  |

### Installation

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### Fixing the bracket and the product[‚Äã](#fixing-the-bracket-and-the-product "Direct link to Fixing the bracket and the product")

Info

This document explains the installation method based on the million type. Install the gang box type and keypad type in the same way.

1. Secure the bracket tightly using the fixing screws at the location where the product will be mounted.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device1-xpd2.svg)

   Info

   * If installing the product on a concrete wall, drill a hole, insert a PVC anchor, and secure it with a fixing screw.

   * To avoid RF interference, a minimum separation distance must be maintained.

   XP2-MDPB, XP2-MAPB, XP2-MAPB-H

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wall1-xpd2-mdb.png)

   | Wall thickness | Distance |
   | -------------- | -------- |
   | 100 mm         | 360 mm   |
   | 120 mm         | 360 mm   |
   | 150 mm         | 300 mm   |

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wall2-xpd2-mdb.png)

   XP2-GDPB, XP2-GKDPB

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wall1-xpd2-gdb.png)

   | Wall thickness | Distance |
   | -------------- | -------- |
   | 100 mm         | 400 mm   |
   | 120 mm         | 380 mm   |
   | 150 mm         | 380 mm   |

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wall2-xpd2-gdb.png)

   * When using a mobile access card, install devices maintaining a minimum distance of 1 m between devices to avoid BLE interference.

2. Mount the product on the fixed bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device2-xpd2.svg)

3. Rotate the fixing screws to assemble the product with the bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device3-xpd2.svg)

   Info

   When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

<!-- -->

Caution

* Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

- Use a separate power supply for Secure I/O 2, the electric lock, and the product respectively. If connecting and using the power supply to these devices together, the devices may malfunction.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

#### Relay Connection[‚Äã](#relay-connection "Direct link to Relay Connection")

##### Fail Safe Lock[‚Äã](#fail-safe-lock "Direct link to Fail Safe Lock")

In order to use the Fail Safe Lock, connect N/C relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally a current flowing through the relay for the Fail Safe Lock. When the relay is activated, blocking the current flow, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will open.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-safe-lock-xp2.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

* Install a diode at both sides of the door lock wire as shown in the figure to protect the relay from the reverse current, which occurs when the door lock operates.

* Use a separate power supply for the product and the door lock.

* Suprema‚Äôs standalone intelligent readers contain internal relays that can directly lock/unlock doors without external controllers for added convenience. For access control applications in need of security, however, it is NOT recommended to use the internal relay of a reader to prevent any tampering attacks which can potentially trigger the door unlock. For such applications, it is highly recommended to use a separate relay unit for a lock control such as Suprema‚Äôs Secure I/O 2, DM-20 or CoreStation installed at a secure side of a door.

Info

Take caution of the installation direction of the diode. Install the diode close to the door lock.

##### Fail Secure Lock[‚Äã](#fail-secure-lock "Direct link to Fail Secure Lock")

In order to use the Fail Secure Lock, connect N/O relay as shown in the figure below. There is normally no current flowing through the relay for the Fail Secure Lock. When the current flow is activated by the relay, the door will open. If the power supply to the product is cut off due to a power failure or an external factor, the door will lock.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-relay-fail-secure-lock-xp2.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

* Install a diode at both sides of the door lock wire as shown in the figure to protect the relay from the reverse current, which occurs when the door lock operates.

* Use a separate power supply for the product and the door lock.

* Suprema‚Äôs standalone intelligent readers contain internal relays that can directly lock/unlock doors without external controllers for added convenience. For access control applications in need of security, however, it is NOT recommended to use the internal relay of a reader to prevent any tampering attacks which can potentially trigger the door unlock. For such applications, it is highly recommended to use a separate relay unit for a lock control such as Suprema‚Äôs Secure I/O 2, DM-20 or CoreStation installed at a secure side of a door.

Info

Take caution of the installation direction of the diode. Install the diode close to the door lock.

##### Automatic door connection[‚Äã](#automatic-door-connection "Direct link to Automatic door connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-automatic-door-xp2.png)

#### Connecting as a Standalone[‚Äã](#connecting-as-a-standalone "Direct link to Connecting as a Standalone")

The product can be connected to the door lock, door button, and door sensor directly without connecting a separate I/O device.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-standalone-connection-xp2.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Caution

Suprema‚Äôs standalone intelligent readers contain internal relays that can directly lock/unlock doors without external controllers for added convenience. For access control applications in need of security, however, it is NOT recommended to use the internal relay of a reader to prevent any tampering attacks which can potentially trigger the door unlock. For such applications, it is highly recommended to use a separate relay unit for a lock control such as Suprema‚Äôs Secure I/O 2, DM-20 or CoreStation installed at a secure side of a door.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Info

* The device can be used as a multi-door controller with the slave devices with the RS-485 cable. The slave devices are used as dummy readers and authentication is performed in the master device.

- If you use this product as the master device, the slave device can only use card authentication.

* Connect up to 31 slave devices to a master device.

- For more information, contact the [Suprema Technical Support Team](https://support.supremainc.com).

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Connecting to Secure I/O 2[‚Äã](#connecting-to-secure-io-2 "Direct link to Connecting to Secure I/O 2")

Secure I/O 2 is an I/O device, can be connected to the product with the RS-485 cable. Security can be maintained even if the connection between the product and Secure I/O 2 has been lost or the power supply to the product has been shut off due to external factors.

* Use an AWG24 twisted pair with a maximum length of 1.2 km for the RS-485 cable.

* It is recommended to use RS-485 cables with a characteristic impedance of 120 Œ©.

* If connecting with a RS-485 daisy chain, connect the termination resistor (120 Œ©) to both ends of the daisy chain connection. If connected to the middle line, the signal level becomes smaller and the communication performance will deteriorate. Make sure to connect it to both ends of the daisy chain connection.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-sio2-connection-xp2.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Info

* The device can be used as a multi-door controller with the slave devices with the RS-485 cable. The slave devices are used as dummy readers and authentication is performed in the master device.

- If you use this product as the master device, the slave device can only use card authentication.

* Connect up to 31 slave devices to a master device.

- For more information, contact the [Suprema Technical Support Team](https://support.supremainc.com).

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Wiegand Connection[‚Äã](#wiegand-connection "Direct link to Wiegand Connection")

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Use as a Wiegand input or output device

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wiegand-inout-connection-xp2.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Initialize Network Settings[‚Äã](#reset-network-settings "Direct link to Initialize Network Settings")

Initialize the device's network settings.

1. Power on.

2. Press the reset button until the device automatically reboots.

3. Connect the device using the initialized network information.

   * **TCP/IP Address**: DHCP address assignment (if DHCP address assignment fails, will be set to 169.254.x.x).

   * **Server Mode**: Disable

   * **RS-485**: Default, 115200 bps

4. Change the TCP/IP or RS-485 information.

5. Check if the network information is correctly set after turning the power off and on.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Factory default[‚Äã](#factory-reset "Direct link to Factory default")

Delete all information stored on the device and initialize the settings.

1. Power on.

2. Quickly press the reset button three times.

3. Press the reset button once more when the device's LED blinks <!-- -->green<!-- -->.

Info

You can only use Factory Default when the root certificate is stored on the device.

### Regulatory Information

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### FCC Compliance Information[‚Äã](#fcc-compliance-information "Direct link to FCC Compliance Information")

THIS DEVICE COMPLIES WITH PART 15 OF THE FCC RULES.

Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

1. This device may not cause harmful interference, and

2. This device must accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation.

Info

This equipment has been tested and found to comply with the limits for a <!-- -->Class A<!-- --> digital device, pursuant to part 15 of the FCC Rules. These limits are designed to provide reasonable protection against harmful interference when the equipment is operated in a commercial environment. This equipment generates, uses, and can radiate radio frequency energy and, if not installed and used in accordance with the instruction manual, may cause harmful interference to radio communications. Operation of this equipment in a residential area is likely to cause harmful interference in which case the user will be required to correct the interference at his own expense.

Any changes or modifications not expressly approved by the party responsible for compliance could void the user‚Äôs authority to operate this equipment.

This transmitter must not be co-located or operating in conjunction with any other antenna or transmitter.

This equipment complies with FCC radiation exposure limits set forth for an uncontrolled environment. This equipment should be installed and operated with minimum distance 20 cm between the radiator and your body. Do not install or operate this device and its antenna in conjunction with any other antenna or RF transmission device.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### IC information[‚Äã](#ic-information "Direct link to IC information")

This device complies with Industry Canada‚Äôs licence-exempt RSSs.

Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

1. This device may not cause interference; and

2. This device must accept any interference, including interference that may cause undesired operation of the device.

### Firmware Version 1.0.0 (Build No. 1.0.0_190530)

Release|2019-05-30

#### Initial firmware developed.[‚Äã](#initial-firmware-developed "Direct link to Initial firmware developed.")


---

### Firmware Version 1.1.0 (Build No. 1.1.0_190911)

Release|2019-09-18

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Support to the Mobile Credential (NFC, BLE).

2. Added CSN mask for the unknown card type.

   * Before: Cards other than MIFARE, iCLASS, DESFire, iCLASS Seos, FeliCa, ISO-15693 was recognized as CSN.

   * After: User can select whether to recognize cards other than MIFARE, iCLASS, DESFire, iCLASS Seos, FeliCa, and ISO-15693.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. The device recognizes the DESFire(Adv) card as a CSN if the device is restarted when the smart card layout set as DESFire (Adv).

2. The LED indicator operates abnormally when the Device Manager app is disconnected.

3. Changed the color of some of the status lights that previously worked in yellow to green.

4. When using firmware V1.0.1 the connection to the I/O device that using the firmware version below is lost.

   * DM-20 FW V1.1.2

   * OM-120 FW V1.0.0

   * Secure I/O 2 FW V1.2.1

5. The master device intermittently reboots when upgrading the firmware of the slave device.


---

### Firmware Version 1.2.0 (Build No. 1.2.0_200409)

Release|2020-04-13

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Support to the Change Deivce ID.

2. Enhancement in the security of the device.

   * Restrict unencrypted connections.

   * Support for Secure Tamper on slave devices.

   * Enhancement in the security of encryption keys.

   * Encrypt user information.

   * Restrict access through communications such as TCP/IP, RS-232, and USB.

3. Support for connecting new devices.

   * XPass D2 (Rev 2)

4. Improved Anti-passback zone to operate based on the door status.

5. Support to the BioStar 2 Mobile Access.

6. Support to the Mobile Access V1.1.

7. Support to the scheduled unlock function for each floor when controlling elevator.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Problem that the password set in the Device Manager app is not initialized even if the factory default is performed.

2. The device does not recognize LF (Low Frequency) cards well.

3. OSDP Communication does not work normally if the value sent to the slave device is greater than the defined value.

4. The Secure Tamper occurs again if a user reboots the device after setting the smart card layout while the Secure Tamper has already occurred.

5. The event log of the device is not sent in the order in which it occurred.


---

### Firmware Version 1.2.1 (Build No. 1.2.1_200612)

Release|2020-06-26

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Support encryption for the blacklist and user ID set as an administrator when migrating user information.

2. Improved not to initialize the network and SSL settings when the device ID is changed.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Issue that the value is not sent to the server since corrupted logs occur.

2. Issue that the connection of the slave device is disconnected when the slave device is connected.

3. Issue that the option for card types is deactivated when the device is connected as a slave after the factory reset.

4. Issue that logs of devices are not sent to the server after the factory reset.


---

### Firmware Version 1.2.2 (Build No. 1.2.2_201006)

Release|2020-10-15

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Separated event logs of Mobile Access cards and RFID cards.

2. Support to mobile key deletion when deleting a device data from the Airfob application.


---

### Firmware Version 1.2.3 (Build No. 1.2.3_210518)

Release|2021-05-24

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Upgraded to the 1.1.1i version of OpenSSL.

2. Intelligent Slave Support

   * Intelligent Slave: A function that enables 1:1 or 1
     <!-- -->
     :N
     <!-- -->
     matching directly from the Suprema device and transmits the authentication result as OSDP card data to the third-party controller.

3. The transmission power level for Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) has been adjusted.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. If 31 slave devices were connected and one of the devices got disconnected, the master device rebooted. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

2. Incorrect BitCount was sent if a user authenticated with AoC when the device was connected to a 3rd-party system via OSDP. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

3. When using a static IP while the DNS server address was configured, a reboot on the device caused communication problems between the server and the device. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

4. It failed to reconnect to the slave device after downgrading its firmware version to 1.1.0. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

5. Device responded that it supported transparent mode by OSDP\_PDCAP when connecting as a slave while it did not support it. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

6. When calling the BS2\_ResetConfigExceptNetInfo API from the BioStar Device SDK, a 'Timeout' error occurred. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

7. The OSDP LED Temporary command did not work properly. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

8. The network reset on the first use was needed to use OSDP default keys to communicate. (for devices released with the firmware version 1.2.0 or later) Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.2.0

9. It was able to communicate using default keys after changing the key settings when the device was connected to a 3rd-party device via OSDP. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

10. Secure communication was not available by using the default key after downgrading firmware to version 1.1.0 or below which does not support encryption. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.2.0

### Firmware Version 1.2.4 (Build No. 1.2.4_211112)

Release|2021-11-17

Caution

Devices with the new BLE chip cannot downgrade to a lower version after upgrading the firmware to v1.2.4. Devices with existing BLE chips can be downgraded to a lower version.

For more information, check the serial number of the device and contact the [Suprema](https://supremainc.com).

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Supports a new BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) chip.

   * The BLE chip parts of the hardware have been changed, and the firmware has been upgraded to be compatible with both the existing and new BLE chips.

### Firmware Version 1.3.1 (Build No. 1.3.1_220607)

Release|2022-06-13

Caution

For more information, check the serial number of the device and contact the [Suprema](https://supremainc.com).

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

1. Supports setting the byte order for smart cards.

   * Supports setting the byte order of data to be output to Wiegand or OSDP.

2. Supports a new BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) chip.

   * The BLE chip parts of the hardware have been changed, and the firmware has been upgraded to be compatible with both the existing and new BLE chips.

3. Improved the Arm/Disarm status is maintained if the device loses power.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. The card ID was always output as MSB through OSDP when the card ID is input while the device was connected by an intelligent slave. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.2.3

2. The user ID was abnormally displayed in the event log if the user authenticated with AoC set as the blacklist card when the User ID Type was set to Alphanumeric. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

3. When the device is connected as an intelligent slave and the first card registered to the user is a Wiegand card of a format other than 26-bit, the CSN value is output through OSDP when authenticated with the user's fingerprint. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.2.3

4. Mobile card authentication suddenly does not work. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.1.0

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

   * Door open request by exit button

   * Door open request by operator

4. Improved the structure to prevent authentication fail caused by broken database or cache memory. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

### Firmware Version 1.4.1 (Build No. 1.4.1_240319)

Release|2024-07-25

Caution

Devices with the new BLE chip cannot downgrade to a lower version after upgrading the firmware to v1.3.1 or higher. Devices with existing BLE chips can be downgraded to a lower version.

For more information, check the serial number of the device and contact the [Suprema](https://supremainc.com).

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Added new model.

   * XP2-MAPB

2. Improved to select and update only the desired information when updating user information. (Compatible with BioStar v2.9.0 or higher)

3. Supports **Custom Smart Card Layout**.

4. Supports a XPass D2 new BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) chip firmware.

   * The BLE chip parts of the hardware have been changed, and the firmware has been upgraded to be compatible with both the existing and new BLE chips.

5. Improved synchronization to complete if user enrollment fails when synchronizing multiple users to the device in BioStar 2.

6. Improved smartcard output byte order setting.

   * When using Wiegand or OSDP output, it is improved to be affected by the smartcard output byte order when the Wiegand output information is set to send user ID.

7. Improved when authenticating with a BLE mobile card running on iOS, authentication fails and the device restarts intermittently.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Device does not recognize some MIFARE Classic cards. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

2. When running the Device Manager application v1.1.8 on iOS, certain devices do not connect. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.3.1

3. Device abnormally restarts when changing the device's Network settings in BioStar 2. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

4. Authentication fails when authenticating with a DESFire AoC while the device is connected as a slave. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

5. Improved the structure to fix cache management errors caused by database storage, modification, or deletion errors. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

### Firmware Version 1.4.2 (Build No. 1.4.2_241025)

Release|2024-10-28

Caution

Devices with the new BLE chip cannot downgrade to a lower version after upgrading the firmware to v1.3.1 or higher. Devices with existing BLE chips can be downgraded to a lower version.

For more information, check the serial number of the device and contact the [Suprema](https://supremainc.com).

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Supports for device firmware upgrade via the Device Manager application.

2. Added feature to set the baud rate of slave devices.

3. Improved to get user update succeeded event log using the GetLogWithFilter function in the SDK.

4. Improved RS-485 communication quality.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. When the device log is full and a new event occurs, unintended logs are retrieved with the newly generated event. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.3.1

2. When running the Device Manager application v1.1.8 on certain iOS, the device does not connect. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

3. When the **Input card ID from keypad** option is enabled, there is an issue where the card ID value recorded in the event log differs from the entered value when an unassigned card ID is input using the keypad. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

4. When a user with a 32-character user ID authenticates to the device while the device is not connected to the server, the authentication event log is not updated in BioStar 2 even after the device is reconnected to the server. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

5. The user ID stored as a 32-character string is truncated to only 31 characters in a specific event log. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

6. After a firmware upgrade, authentication failure occurs with the previously used cards. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1

7. When the **Time Synchronization with Server** option is disabled and the device time is changed, the device restarts abnormally. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1

8. When the **RS-485** mode is set to **Slave**, the **Custom Smart Card Layout** and **Byte Order** of the device are not saved as set. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1

9. When the device is restarted with the **Primary Key** set only in the **Suprema Smart Card Layout** and the **Secondary Key** set only in the **Custom Smart Card Layout**, the device recognizes the Custom Smart Card as a CSN card. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1

10. Some smart cards fail to be recognized in environments using the new SE chip firmware. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1

11. DESFire smart cards with the **Custom Smart Card Layout** set to **Secondary Key** are recognized as CSN cards. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1

12. Custom smart cards with the **DESFire Advanced** option enabled fail to be recognized. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1


---

### Firmware Version 1.4.3 (Build No. 1.4.3_250602)

Release|2025-06-04

Caution

* The XP2-MAPB-H model cannot downgrade to firmware version v1.4.3 or lower.

* The XP2-GKDPB model with hardware v1.2.0 or higher cannot downgrade firmware to lower than v1.4.3. The hardware version can be checked in the **DEVICE** menu of BioStar 2.

* Devices with the new BLE chip cannot downgrade to a lower version after upgrading the firmware to v1.3.1 or higher. Devices with existing BLE chips can be downgraded to a lower version.

For more information, check the serial number of the device and contact the [Suprema](https://supremainc.com).

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Added new model.

   * XP2-MAPB-H

2. Supports **Keypad Backlight** configuration.

   * XPass 2 (XP2-GKDPB) hardware v1.2.0 or higher, firmware v1.4.3 or higher.

3. Added identification code to support recognition of the latest cards.

   * DESFire EV3

4. Supports SL1, SL3, and SL1/SL3 Mix Mode for security level compatibility with MIFARE Plus EV1 cards.

   * SL1: Compatible mode with MIFARE Classic

   * SL3: Advanced security mode based on AES

5. Supports the **Ignore Repeated Signals Duration** feature, which ignores repetitive authentication signals from the controller when the device is connected to a 3rd party controller via Wiegand.

6. Supports not logging events when the **Ignore Repeated Signals Duration** feature is activated.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. When a user with more than two cards enrolled attempts card authentication to the Wiegand output device, the ID of a card other than the authenticated card is output. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1

2. When using the BS2\_GetDeviceCapabilities function in the SDK to get information supported by the device, the CustomClassicPlus and CustomDesFireEV1 are displayed as False though the device supports custom smart cards. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.1

3. When authentication is successful using the \**Secondary Key*\*, and the **Secondary Key** is then set to **Not Use**, authentication fails even if the **Primary Key** is valid. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

4. Authentication fails with a 'period expired' message when using a smart card issued with a visual face included. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0


---

### Firmware Version 1.5.0 (Build No. 1.5.0_250811)

Release|2025-08-14

Caution

* After upgrading the firmware to v1.5.0, it is not able to downgrade to an earlier version of the firmware.

* The XP2-MAPB-H model cannot downgrade to firmware version v1.4.3 or lower.

* The XP2-GKDPB model with hardware v1.2.0 or higher cannot downgrade firmware to lower than v1.4.3. The hardware version can be checked in the **DEVICE** menu of BioStar 2.

* Devices with the new BLE chip cannot downgrade to a lower version after upgrading the firmware to v1.3.1 or higher. Devices with existing BLE chips can be downgraded to a lower version.

For more information, check the serial number of the device and contact the [Suprema](https://supremainc.com).

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Reflects global cybersecurity standards and the latest security requirements.

### Safety Instructions

Please read this safety instructions before you use the product to prevent injury to yourself and others and to prevent property damage.

The term ‚Äòproduct‚Äô in this manual refers to the product and any items provided with the product.

#### Compliance Information[‚Äã](#compliance-information "Direct link to Compliance Information")

Warning

Used to indicate warning information that could lead to serious injury or death if violated while using the product.

Caution

Used to indicate caution information that may result in minor injury or product damage if violated while using the product.

Info

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

**Note**

Used to provide notes or additional information while using the product.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-caution.svg) Warning[‚Äã](#-warning "Direct link to -warning")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install "Direct link to Install")

**Be especially careful of miswiring when using high-capacity power supplies**.

* Serious fires, electric shocks, or product damage may occur due to miswiring.

**Do not allow users to install or repair the product arbitrarily**.

* Causes fire, electric shock, or injury.

* No free repair service will be provided if the product is damaged due to arbitrary installation or repair by the user.

**Do not install the product in places exposed to direct sunlight, moisture, dust, or soot, or where gas may leak**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

**When installing the product outdoors, make sure to install it in a shaded and well-ventilated area**.

**Do not use a completely sealed enclosure when installing the product outdoors**.

* The internal temperature of the enclosure may rise due to direct sunlight, causing fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not install the product in places where heat is generated, such as near heaters**.

* May cause fire or electric shock due to overheating.

**Do not install in damp places**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage due to moisture.

**Do not install in places with electromagnetic interference**.

* May cause electric shock or product damage.

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not allow liquids such as water, beverages, or chemicals to enter the product**.

* May cause fire, electric shock, or product damage.

**Do not use damaged power adapters or plugs, or loose outlets**.

* If connections are unstable, may cause fire or electric shock.

**Do not bend or break the power cord excessively**.

* May cause fire or electric shock.

#### ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-warning.svg) Caution[‚Äã](#-caution "Direct link to -caution")

***

##### Install[‚Äã](#install-1 "Direct link to Install")

**Read this manual carefully before installing the product to ensure safe and correct installation**.

**When wiring power cables and connectors, make sure to turn off the power to all devices you are connecting before wiring and connecting**.

* Devices may malfunction.

**Before connecting the power to the product, check the manual again to ensure that wiring is correct, then connect the power**.

**Do not install the product in places directly exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light**.

* May cause product damage, malfunction, discoloration, or deformation.

**Do not leave power cables in passageways**.

* May cause bodily injury or product damage.

**Do not install near strong magnetic objects such as magnets, TVs, CRT monitors, or speakers**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**When installing the product on a wall, do not seal around the product with silicone or similar materials**.

* The device may malfunction.

**When installing multiple devices, ensure the minimum spacing distance is observed**.

* May affect the RF and BLE performance of other devices, causing them to malfunction.

**Use a power adapter that has IEC/EN 62368-1 approval and is rated above the power consumption of the terminal device**. **It is recommended to use the power adapters sold by Suprema**.

* Using an unsuitable power supply may cause devices to malfunction.

* Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/xpass_2/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

<!-- -->

**Ensure that the product and Secure I/O 2, electric lock (electronic locking device) use separate power supplies**.

* Devices may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not connect the power supply and PoE power together**.

* Devices may malfunction.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**It is recommended to use an enclosure when installed outdoors with full exposure**.

* Decreased waterproof and dustproof performance may cause malfunction.

<!-- -->

***

##### Usage[‚Äã](#usage-1 "Direct link to Usage")

**Do not drop or subject the product to shock**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Ensure the power supply is not interrupted during firmware upgrades of the product**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Manage the password so others do not know it, and change it regularly**.

* This may lead to unauthorized access.

**Do not press the product's buttons (touchpad) forcefully or use sharp tools to press them**.

* The device may malfunction.

**Use the product within <!-- -->-35 ¬∞C ~ 65 ¬∞C<!-- --> and store it at appropriate temperatures, not too low or too high**.

* The device may malfunction.

<!-- -->

**Be careful when cleaning the product**.

* Gently wipe the product surface with a clean, dry cloth.

* If disinfecting the product, dampen a clean cloth with a suitable amount of disinfectant alcohol and gently wipe the product surface. Use disinfectant alcohol that contains 70-75% isopropyl alcohol and a clean, lint-free soft cloth.

* Do not spray disinfectant directly onto the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

**Do not use the product for purposes other than its intended use**.

* The device may malfunction.

**RTC Battery**

Replacing with unauthorized or incorrect types of batteries may pose a risk of explosion. Dispose of batteries according to local or international waste regulations.


---

### XPass D2

XPass D2 is an outdoor compact RFID reader optimized for centralized access control systems with Suprema's CoreStation. It supports a variety of RFID cards and mobile cards using Suprema's multi-RFID technology and patented latest mobile card technology utilizing NFC and BLE. It features an IP67 waterproof and dustproof design as well as an IK08 impact-resistant design, providing robust durability, and offers various options depending on the installation environment, such as door frames or switch boxes.

![Example banner](/docs/en/assets/images/xpassd2-main-ad2342f69d41d60dcada0e11fc454816.png)

#### [Safety Instructions‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2/safety-instructions)

This section provides essential safety guidelines that must be read and followed before installing and using the device.

#### [Getting Started‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2/getting-started)

Provides initial procedures for getting started with the device.

#### [Installation‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2/installation)

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### [Product Specifications‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2/product-specifications)

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

#### [Regulatory Information‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2/regulatory-information)

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

#### [Appendices‚Üí <!-- -->Read more](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2/appendices)

Includes legal notices contained in the product.

| XPass D2 Mullion Type (XPD2-MDB)                        | Wall Bracket (XPD2-MDB)                                       | XPass D2 Gang Box Type (XPD2-GDB)                      | Wall Bracket (XPD2-GDB)                                      |
| ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-device-xpd2-gkdb.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-wall-bracket-xpd2-gkdb.svg) | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-fixing-screws2.svg)  | ![](/docs/en/img/device/component-bracket-fixing-screw.svg)  |

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

Info

* Components may vary according to the installation environment.

- When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

#### Name and function of each part[‚Äã](#name-and-function-of-each-part "Direct link to Name and function of each part")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/name-function-each-part-xpd2.png)

* **LED Indicator**: Indicates the operational status of the device with the color of the LED.

  * Green: Authentication success.

  * Red: Authentication failure.

  * Blue/Cyan blinking: Normal operation.

  * Blue/Green blinking: During network settings initialization

  * Green blinking: Waiting for input.

  * Green/White blinking: Connecting to the Suprema AirFob Pass (BLE) application

  * White blinking: Connecting to the Device Manager application

* **RF card and mobile access card authentication unit**: Part to scan a RFID card or mobile access card for entrance.

* **Mobile Access Card Recognition Area**: This is the part that recognizes mobile access cards for entry.

* **Reset Button**: Deletes all stored information and certificates and initializes the settings. For more information on factory initialization, refer to [the following](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2/installation#factory-reset).

* **Cable**

  Power / RS-485 / Wiegand Output / LED Input / Beep Input / Tamper

* **Keypad**: XPD2-GKDB Used to authenticate by directly entering the Card ID. To authenticate using direct input mode, change the authentication method settings in BioStar X.

  * **0-9**: Used when entering numbers.

  * ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-star.svg): Used to distinguish between FC code and ID when entering Wiegand Card ID.

  * ![](/docs/en/img/common/ico-pound.svg): Used to terminate input.

##### Cable[‚Äã](#cable "Direct link to Cable")

![](/docs/en/img/device/cables-layout-xpd2.png)

| Pin | Name     | Color                 |
| --- | -------- | --------------------- |
| 1   | PWR +VDC | Red                   |
| 2   | GND      | Black (White Stripe)  |
| 3   | 485 TRXN | Yellow (Black Stripe) |
| 4   | 485 TRXP | Blue (White Stripe)   |
| 5   | WG D0    | Green                 |
| 6   | WG D1    | White                 |
| 7   | LED RED  | Orange                |
| 8   | LED GRN  | Brown                 |
| 9   | BEEP     | Purple                |
| 10  | TMPR     | Gray                  |

### Installation

Provides the complete installation procedures and connection examples required for the device.

#### Fixing the bracket and the product[‚Äã](#fixing-the-bracket-and-the-product "Direct link to Fixing the bracket and the product")

Info

This document explains the installation method based on the million type. Install the gang box type and keypad type in the same way.

1. Secure the bracket tightly using the fixing screws at the location where the product will be mounted.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device1-xpd2.svg)

   Info

   * If installing the product on a concrete wall, drill a hole, insert a PVC anchor, and secure it with a fixing screw.

   * To avoid RF interference, a minimum separation distance must be maintained.

   XPD2-MDB

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wall1-xpd2-mdb.png)

   | Wall thickness | Distance |
   | -------------- | -------- |
   | 100 mm         | 360 mm   |
   | 120 mm         | 360 mm   |
   | 150 mm         | 300 mm   |

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wall2-xpd2-mdb.png)

   XPD2-GDB, XPD2-GKDB

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wall1-xpd2-gdb.png)

   | Wall thickness | Distance |
   | -------------- | -------- |
   | 100 mm         | 400 mm   |
   | 120 mm         | 380 mm   |
   | 150 mm         | 380 mm   |

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wall2-xpd2-gdb.png)

   * When using a mobile access card, install devices maintaining a minimum distance of 1 m between devices to avoid BLE interference.

2. Mount the product on the fixed bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device2-xpd2.svg)

3. Rotate the fixing screws to assemble the product with the bracket.

   ![](/docs/en/img/device/installation-device3-xpd2.svg)

   Info

   When assembling the product with the bracket, you can use the included bracket fixing screw (Star Shaped) instead of the product fixing screw for enhanced security.

#### Power supply connection[‚Äã](#power-supply-connection "Direct link to Power supply connection")

This product can be used as an RFID card or mobile card reader by connecting to a master device or CoreStation.

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-power-connection-xpd2.png)

Caution

* Use the IEC/EN 62368-1 approved power adapter that supports higher power consumption than the product. If you wish to connect and use another device to the power supply adapter, you should use an adapter with a current capacity which is the same or larger than the total power consumption required for the terminal and another device.

  * Refer to the [Power](/docs/en/device/xpass_d2/product-specifications#specs.power) in the product specifications for maximum current consumption specifications.

* DO NOT extend the length of power cable when using the power adapter.

#### RS-485 Connection[‚Äã](#rs-485-connection "Direct link to RS-485 Connection")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-rs485-connection-xpd2.png)

Info

* Use an AWG24 twisted pair with a maximum length of 1.2 km for the RS-485 cable.

* It is recommended to use RS-485 cables with a characteristic impedance of 120 Œ©.

* If connecting with a RS-485 daisy chain, connect the termination resistor (120 Œ©) to both ends of the daisy chain connection. If connected to the middle line, the signal level becomes smaller and the communication performance will deteriorate. Make sure to connect it to both ends of the daisy chain connection.

#### Wiegand and other cable connections[‚Äã](#wiegand-and-other-cable-connections "Direct link to Wiegand and other cable connections")

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/installation-wiegand-other-connection-xpd2.png)

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Factory default[‚Äã](#factory-reset "Direct link to Factory default")

Delete all information stored on the device and initialize the settings.

1. Power on.

2. Quickly press the reset button three times.

3. Press the reset button once more when the device's LED blinks <!-- -->green<!-- -->.

Info

You can only use Factory Default when the root certificate is stored on the device.

#### Reset RS-485 transmission performance[‚Äã](#reset-rs-485-transmission-performance "Direct link to Reset RS-485 transmission performance")

You can choose and set the desired communication performance.

1. Power on.

2. Press the reset button for more than 2 seconds. When you enter setting mode, the LED flashes green.

3. When the device's LED flashes green, press the reset button as many times as desired. The transmission performance is set according to the number of presses, and you can check the set performance by the LED color.

   | Number of presses | Transmission performance | LED color |
   | ----------------- | ------------------------ | --------- |
   | 1                 | 9600                     | Sky blue  |
   | 2                 | 19200                    | Blue      |
   | 3                 | 38400                    | Purple    |
   | 4                 | 57600                    | White     |
   | 5                 | 115200                   | Red       |

4. The LED color of the set transmission performance flashes for 5 seconds. When you hear a beep, the transmission performance setting is complete.

Info

If you do not press the reset button after entering setting mode, the transmission performance will automatically be set to 115200.

### Product Specifications

Provides key specifications of the product, including size, features, and performance.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### Credentials[‚Äã](#specs.credentials)

RF Card

125kHz EM & 13.56MHz MIFARE, MIFARE Plus, DESFire, DESFire EV1/EV2/EV3[](#anno1), FeliCa

RF Read Range[](#anno2)

EM/MIFARE/DESFire: 50 mm, FeliCa: 30 mm

Mobile

NFC, BLE

<!-- -->

#### General[‚Äã](#specs.general)

CPU

80 MHz

Memory

512 KB Flash + 160 KB RAM

Crypto Chip

Supported

LED

Multi-color

Sound

Multi-tone Buzzer

Operating Temperature

-35 ¬∞C ~ 65 ¬∞C

Storage Temperature

-40 ¬∞C ~ 70 ¬∞C

Operating Humidity

0 % ~ 95 %, non-condensing

Storage Humidity

0 % ~ 95 %, non-condensing

[IP Rating](/docs/en/reference/glossary#ip_rating)

[An international rating system that defines the degree of product protection against solids and liquids.](/docs/en/reference/glossary#ip_rating)

IP65, IP67

[IK Rating](/docs/en/reference/glossary#ik_rating)

[An international rating system that defines the degree of product protection against physical impacts.](/docs/en/reference/glossary#ik_rating)

IK08

Certifications

CE, UKCA, KC, FCC, IC, RCM, BIS, SIG, RoHS, REACH, WEEE

<!-- -->

#### Interfaces[‚Äã](#specs.interface)

RS-485

1 ch

RS-485 Communication Protocol

OSDP V2 compliant

Wiegand

1 ch

LED

2 ch

Beep

1 ch

Tamper

Supported

<!-- -->

#### Electrical[‚Äã](#specs.power)

Power

12 Vdc

Current: Max. 0.3 A

LED, Beep Input VIH

* Min.: 3 V
* Max.: 5 V

LED, Beep Input VIL

Max.: 1 V

LED, Beep Pull-up Resistance

4.7 kŒ© (The input ports are pulled up with 4.7 kŒ©.)

Wiegand Output VOH

More than 4.8 V

Wiegand Output VOL

Less than 0.2 V

Wiegand Output Pull-up Resistance

Internally pulled up with 1 kŒ©

![](/docs/en/img/en/device/xpd2-gkdb-dimension.svg)

[1)](#anno1_dest) DESFire EV2/EV3 cards are backward compatible with DESFire EV1 cards, supporting CSN and smart card features, including those of the DESFire EV1 card.

[2)](#anno2_dest) RF read range will vary depending on installation environment.

### Regulatory Information

Provides information on regulations and certifications complied with by the product.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### FCC Compliance Information[‚Äã](#fcc-compliance-information "Direct link to FCC Compliance Information")

THIS DEVICE COMPLIES WITH PART 15 OF THE FCC RULES.

Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

1. This device may not cause harmful interference, and

2. This device must accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation.

Info

This equipment has been tested and found to comply with the limits for a <!-- -->Class B<!-- --> digital device, pursuant to part 15 of the FCC Rules. These limits are designed to provide reasonable protection against harmful interference when the equipment is operated in a commercial environment. This equipment generates, uses, and can radiate radio frequency energy and, if not installed and used in accordance with the instruction manual, may cause harmful interference to radio communications. Operation of this equipment in a residential area is likely to cause harmful interference in which case the user will be required to correct the interference at his own expense.

Any changes or modifications not expressly approved by the party responsible for compliance could void the user‚Äôs authority to operate this equipment.

This transmitter must not be co-located or operating in conjunction with any other antenna or transmitter.

This equipment complies with FCC radiation exposure limits set forth for an uncontrolled environment. This equipment should be installed and operated with minimum distance 20 cm between the radiator and your body. Do not install or operate this device and its antenna in conjunction with any other antenna or RF transmission device.

<!-- -->

<!-- -->

#### IC information[‚Äã](#ic-information "Direct link to IC information")

This device complies with Industry Canada‚Äôs licence-exempt RSSs.

Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

1. This device may not cause interference; and

2. This device must accept any interference, including interference that may cause undesired operation of the device.

***

Le pr√©sent appareil est conforme aux CNR d‚ÄôIndustrie Canada applicables aux appareils radio exempts de licence.

L‚Äôexploitation est autoris√©e aux deux conditions suivantes :

1. l‚Äôappareil ne doit pas produire de brouillage ;

2. l‚Äôappareil doit accepter tout brouillage radio√©lectrique subi, m√™me si le brouillage est susceptible d‚Äôen compromettre le fonctionnement.

#### EU Declaration of Conformity (CE)[‚Äã](#eu-declaration-of-conformity-ce "Direct link to EU Declaration of Conformity (CE)")

This product is CE marked according to the provisions of the Radio Equipment Directive (RED) 2014/53/EU.

Hereby, Suprema Inc. declares that this product is in compliance with the essential requirements and other relevant provisions of Radio Equipment Directive (RED) 2014/53/EU and is marked with the CE mark. This device is a Class 1 radio device according to the instructions.

### Firmware Version 1.4.2 (Build No. 1.4.2_201012)

Release|2020-10-15

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Support to mobile key deletion when deleting device data from the Airfob application.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Improved the function to operate according to Timer Count when setting the Temporary LED Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

2. Device responded that it supports transparent mode by OSDP\_PDCAP when connecting as slave while it does not support it. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

3. Values that did not comply with the OSDP specification were sent when pressing the keypad. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.2


---

### Firmware Version 1.5.0 (Build No. 1.5.0_210408)

Release|2021-04-12

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. The transmission power level for Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) has been adjusted.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. Card data were output with the wrong BitCount while the device was communicating with a 3rd party controller via OSDP. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.0

2. Modified to output 4 bits for each key input on the keypad while the device was set as a Wiegand reader. (XPD2-GKDPB) Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.0

3. The OSDP LED Temporary command did not work properly. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.0

4. Delay occurred when reading a smart card that contained credentials which the device did not support while the device was set as a Wiegand reader. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0


---

### Firmware Version 1.6.0 (Build No. 1.6.0_220223)

Release|2022-03-02

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Supports setting the byte order of CSN card output data when using the device as a Wiegand reader or OSDP reader by connecting with a 3rd-party controller.

2. Supports setting the byte order for smart cards.

   * Supports setting the byte order of data to be output to Wiegand or OSDP.

3. Supports new features and improvements of the Device Manager app (v1.1.4 or later).

   * Supports Byte order setting for CSN card and smart card.

   * Added LED operation of the device according to auth mode operation.

4. Supports a new BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) chip.

   * The BLE chip part of the hardware have been changed, and the firmware has been upgraded to be compatible with both the existing and new BLE chips.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. The Wiegand value displayed on the card scan of the Device Manager app was different from the value output from BioStar 2 Affects version
   <!-- -->
   :¬†
   <!-- -->
   1.4.0.

For more information, check the serial number of the device and contact the [Suprema](https://supremainc.com).

#### New Features and Improvements[‚Äã](#new-features-and-improvements "Direct link to New Features and Improvements")

***

1. Supports a new BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) chip.

   * The BLE chip parts of the hardware have been changed, and the firmware has been upgraded to be compatible with both the existing and new BLE chips.

2. Improved setting of the byte order for smart cards.

   * Improved to display valid values through Wiegand or OSDP when the AoC (Access on Card) ID issued by BioStar 2 is set to Alphanumeric.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

1. Intermittent Mobile Card not authenticating Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.0.

   * Improved BLE Micom Firmware and BLE Recovery RFCore.

2. When FaceStation F2 and Xpass D2 are connected as master-slave, Xpass D2 cannot authenticate with Mobile Card Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.4.0.

#### Bug Fixes[‚Äã](#bug-fixes "Direct link to Bug Fixes")

***

1. When using the BS2\_GetDeviceCapabilities function in the SDK to get information supported by the device, the CustomClassicPlus and CustomDesFireEV1 are displayed as False though the device supports custom smart cards Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.7.1

2. When authenticating an HID Prox card continuously, intermittently outputs an incorrect value. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

3. When the **Input card ID from keypad** option is enabled, there is an issue where the card ID value recorded in the event log differs from the entered value when an unassigned card ID is input using the keypad. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

4. After a firmware upgrade, authentication failure occurs with the previously used cards. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.7.1

5. When running the Device Manager application v1.1.8 on certain iOS, the device does not connect. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

6. When the device is connected to a 3rd party control panel via OSDP, the device does not receive a response from the 3rd party control panel. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.0.0

7. When the Micom firmware of the device is upgraded first in BioStar 2, followed by the upgrade of the new BLE firmware, the device cannot reconnect to the Device Manager application. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.7.0

8. When changing the baud rate of a device connected as a slave using the SDK, the changes are not properly reflected. Affects version<!-- -->:¬†<!-- -->1.7.1
