* **PIN**: Set a 4‚Äì16 digit PIN for use as part of two-factor authentication (2FA).

#### Setting Access Levels and Validity[‚Äã](#setting-access-levels-and-validity "Direct link to Setting Access Levels and Validity")

After selecting a credential, configure the user‚Äôs access permissions:

1. Choose an **Access Level** (full access or a predefined level).

2. Select the **Floor Levels** assigned to the user.

3. Set the **Credential Validity Period**:

   * Set a start date (required) and optional end date.

   * After setting a start date, use shortcut buttons for common end dates: **+1D**, **+3D**, **+1W**, **+1Y**, **Manual**, or **Infinite**.

Info

Access levels can be assigned permanently (expire with the credential) or temporarily (expire earlier than the credential).

Tip

The **Device Manager** option is only available for X-Station 2 users, allowing access to the Admin menu.

#### Selecting a Card Template[‚Äã](#selecting-a-card-template "Direct link to Selecting a Card Template")

To assign a card template:

Click on the dropdown menu to select a **Card Template**.

#### Saving or Activating the User[‚Äã](#saving-or-activating-the-user "Direct link to Saving or Activating the User")

Once all settings are configured, you can either:

* **Save** the user to activate them later.

* Click **Activate Card** to issue the credential immediately.

#### Modifying User Details[‚Äã](#modifying-user-details "Direct link to Modifying User Details")

After adding a user:

1. Find the user in the list.

2. Click on their name to access detailed information.

3. Modify any required details.

###### Next step

[Now that you know how to add individual users, the next guide will cover bulk user registration.](/docs/en/platform/biostar_air/adding-users-in-bulk)


---

### Adding Users in Bulk

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

BioStar Air allows administrators to add multiple users at once using a CSV file. This is useful for onboarding employees, upgrading a site, or handling temporary access needs efficiently.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to Bulk User Upload[‚Äã](#navigating-to-bulk-user-upload "Direct link to Navigating to Bulk User Upload")

To add multiple users in bulk:

1. Go to **User Management** in the BioStar Air Portal.

2. Click on **Users** to open the user list interface.

3. Click on the **Download CSV Template** button.

#### Preparing the CSV File[‚Äã](#preparing-the-csv-file "Direct link to Preparing the CSV File")

After downloading the CSV template, fill in the required details for each user. Key fields include:

* **User Group ID**: Retrieve this from the **User Group** screen in BioStar Air Portal.

* **Access Level ID**: Retrieve this from the **Access Levels** screen. *Full access* is always set as **1**.

* **Email Address**: Required if issuing invitations via email (must be unique).

* **Mobile Phone Number**: Required if issuing invitations via mobile (must be unique).

Info

Email addresses and mobile phone numbers must not be duplicated. Duplicate values may result in upload errors.

##### Custom Wiegand Format Support[‚Äã](#custom-wiegand-format-support "Direct link to Custom Wiegand Format Support")

* **Fully configurable Wiegand formats**, including facility codes, segments, and parity bits.

* Supports HID Corporate 1000, iClass SE, and SEOS formats.

* **CSV Upload Template**:

  * Each defined format (custom or default) appears as a separate column.

  * **Examples**:

    * With facility code: *1234567-100-'Main Office Card'* (CardID-FacilityCode-'CardName')

    * With multiple segments: *12-3456-78-'Lab Entry Card'*

  * Use `/` to separate multiple entries in a single field.

  * Single quotes `'` are allowed around the card name. Double quotes `"` will cause an error and should be avoided.

    > ‚úÖ 'CardName' | ‚ùå "CardName"

##### Multiple Card Support[‚Äã](#multiple-card-support "Direct link to Multiple Card Support")

* Assign up to 8 cards per user (CSN or Wiegand).

* CSV Upload Format:

  * Single card: Enter CSN.

  * Multiple cards: Separate CSNs with `/`.

  * Card naming format: *CSN-'Card Name'*

    > Example: *1234567-'Main Entry'* / *7654321-'Back Door'*

#### Uploading the CSV File[‚Äã](#uploading-the-csv-file "Direct link to Uploading the CSV File")

Once the CSV file is ready:

1. Drag and drop the file into the **Upload CSV** window.

2. Review the column data in the preview window to ensure accuracy.

3. Proceed with the upload if the data is correct.

##### CSV Import Validation[‚Äã](#csv-import-validation "Direct link to CSV Import Validation")

Improved CSV upload process with **line-by-line error feedback** for easier troubleshooting.

#### Uploading User Profile Images[‚Äã](#uploading-user-profile-images "Direct link to Uploading User Profile Images")

Profile images can be uploaded automatically along with the CSV file. Follow these guidelines:

1. Ensure that each image file name matches the user ID in the CSV file (e.g., *601.jpg* corresponds to user ID **601**).

2. Select all images and drag them into the **Bulk User Images** upload area.

3. If images are not ready at the time of CSV upload, they can be added later using the **Image Upload** button.

**File Format Requirements:**

* Supported formats: *.jpg*, *.png*

* File size limit: **1MB per image**

#### Finalizing the Bulk Upload[‚Äã](#finalizing-the-bulk-upload "Direct link to Finalizing the Bulk Upload")

Once all user data and images are uploaded, the system will process the entries, and the new users will appear in the user list with their assigned credentials.

#### Troubleshooting[‚Äã](#troubleshooting "Direct link to Troubleshooting")

If you run into any issues with your CSV upload, we've written a more detailed guide to help you work through common problems. It also includes Excel formulas to help you validate and de-duplicate your data. [Troubleshooting Adding Users in Bulk](/docs/en/platform/biostar_air/troubleshooting-adding-users-in-bulk)


---

### Biometric Readers and Credentials

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

BioStar Air now supports biometric readers and biometric credentials for secure access control. Compatible biometric readers, such as BioStation 3 (BS3) and BioEntry W3 (W3), can be registered and configured to authenticate users using facial recognition. The feature supports both single-factor and two-factor authentication, offering enhanced flexibility and security.

#### Navigating to the Feature[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-feature "Direct link to Navigating to the Feature")

* **Register readers**: Use the **BioStar Air app** on your phone, following the same process as you do to register non-biometric readers.

* **Device settings**: Admin Portal ‚Üí **Device Management** ‚Üí **Registered Devices** ‚Üí Click device to edit.

* **User face credential setup**: Admin Portal ‚Üí **User Management** ‚Üí **Users** ‚Üí Add or Edit User ‚Üí Scroll to **Credential Detail**.

#### Step-by-Step Instructions[‚Äã](#step-by-step-instructions "Direct link to Step-by-Step Instructions")

##### Register a Biometric Reader[‚Äã](#register-a-biometric-reader "Direct link to Register a Biometric Reader")

1. Ensure the reader (W3 or BS3) has BioStar Air-compatible firmware. If you ordered a device with -AIR at the end of the model name directly from Suprema or an authorized dealer, it will already have the correct firmware.

2. Open the BioStar Air app on your phone and log in using your administrator ID and password.

3. Register the device as you would for any other reader.

Info

For more information about registering devices, refer to [the following](/docs/en/platform/biostar_air/managing-registered-devices#registering-a-new-device).

##### Configure Reader Settings[‚Äã](#configure-reader-settings "Direct link to Configure Reader Settings")

1. Go to **Device Management** in the Admin Portal.

2. Select **Registered Devices** and click on the device to edit.

3. Scroll down to the **Authentication** section.

4. Set the **Authentication Mode**:

   * **Single-factor**: RF card or face (default).

   * **Two-factor**: Delete one method, then re-register using both RF card and face to enable combined authentication.

5. Set **Authentication Timeout** (in seconds).

6. In the **Face**¬†section, adjust:

   * **Security level** (1<!-- -->:N<!-- --> Security Level)

   * **Motion sensor sensitivity**

   * **Maximum head pose angle**

   * **Detection distance**

7. Choose **Operation Mode**:

   * **Fast Matching**: Uses visual face template only.

   * **Fusion Matching**: Combines visual and IR face templates for higher security.

8. Configure additional options:

   * Storage format for face templates (Store Visual Template)

   * Duplicate checking

   * Set enrollment timeout

   * Enable or disable mask detection

##### Add or Edit User and Enroll Face[‚Äã](#add-or-edit-user-and-enroll-face "Direct link to Add or Edit User and Enroll Face")

1. Navigate to **User Management** ‚Üí **Users**.

2. Add a new user or edit an existing one.

3. Scroll to the **Credential Detail** section and enable **Face**.

4. Click the plus(+) sign on one of the placeholders to add a face template.

   Options:

   * Select a file from your computer

   * Use a connected biometric device (W3 or BS3)

   * Click **Register on Mobile** to scan the QR code with your phone

   Only two face photos can be uploaded per user. One photo is typically sufficient.

5. Click **Save** to complete the user setup.

#### Common Issues & Considerations[‚Äã](#common-issues-considerations "Direct link to Common Issues & Considerations")

* Readers must have BioStar Air-compatible firmware loaded to function correctly.

* Face templates are limited to two per user.

* For advanced configuration (e.g., security levels, matching modes), refer to the W3 or BS3 manual.

* For two-factor authentication, credentials must be registered in combination (e.g., RF card + face).


---

### BioStar Air Login - Using the Site Selector

#### Overview[‚Äã](#overview "Direct link to Overview")

Managing multiple sites on BioStar Air portal used to require a separate email address and password for each site, making the process cumbersome and time-consuming. With the new **Site Selector** feature, you can now use a single email address to manage multiple sites, simplifying the process and reducing the need for multiple logins.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### What is the Site Selector?[‚Äã](#what-is-the-site-selector "Direct link to What is the Site Selector?")

The **Site Selector** feature allows you to log in to the BioStar Air portal using one consolidated email address, even if you‚Äôre managing multiple sites. This eliminates the need for different login credentials for each site. Once logged in, you can easily switch between the sites you‚Äôre an admin for via the Site Selector menu.

#### How to Use the Site Selector[‚Äã](#how-to-use-the-site-selector "Direct link to How to Use the Site Selector")

##### For New Sites[‚Äã](#for-new-sites "Direct link to For New Sites")

When creating a new site through the Partner Portal, you can now use an existing email address that you‚Äôve already registered as an admin for another site. The system will automatically link the new site to your existing email, allowing you to manage multiple sites under one account.

**Steps for New Sites**:

* Create a new site through the Partner Portal as you normally would.

* When prompted for an admin email, use an email address that is already associated with another site.

* The new site will automatically be linked to your existing account.

##### For Existing Sites[‚Äã](#for-existing-sites "Direct link to For Existing Sites")

If you already manage multiple sites but have separate login credentials for each, you will need to request a manual migration from **Suprema**. This process consolidates your email addresses so that you can manage all sites under a single login.

**Steps for Existing Sites**:

* Contact MOCA support and request a manual migration for your sites.

* If you are using alias addresses like <bob+site1@example.com> and <bob+site2@example.com>, provide the root email address (<bob@example.com>).

* If you are using completely unique addresses for each site, provide a full list of those addresses.

* Once the migration is complete, you will be able to access all your sites with a single email address via the Site Selector.

#### How to Log In and Use the Site Selector[‚Äã](#how-to-log-in-and-use-the-site-selector "Direct link to How to Log In and Use the Site Selector")

Once you have a consolidated email address, logging in and switching between sites becomes straightforward:

**Steps to Log In**:

1. **Log in**: Enter your consolidated email address and password as usual.

2. **Select the Site**: Upon logging in, the Site Selector menu will automatically appear, displaying a list of all sites associated with your email address.

3. **Search and Navigate**: If you manage many sites, use the search bar to quickly find the one you‚Äôre looking for. Select the site, and you‚Äôll be directed to its dashboard.

#### Additional Notes[‚Äã](#additional-notes "Direct link to Additional Notes")

* **Security**: Even though you are using a consolidated email, each site‚Äôs permissions and settings remain independent. Admin roles and access rights are unique to each site.

* **Troubleshooting**: If you don‚Äôt see the Site Selector or if the wrong sites appear, ensure that your migration request has been completed or contact MOCA support for further assistance.

By simplifying the login process and consolidating your sites under one account, the Site Selector feature saves time and effort while managing multiple sites on BioStar Air.


---

### BioStar Air Migration

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

BioStar Air is the rebranded version of Airfob Space, designed to reflect Suprema‚Äôs unified cloud access control strategy. Both platforms share the same backend infrastructure and core features. However, new features and improvements will be rolled out under the BioStar Air brand moving forward.

#### New vs Existing Customers[‚Äã](#new-vs-existing-customers "Direct link to New vs Existing Customers")

**PLEASE READ CAREFULLY**

* **New customers** in supported regions should start with **BioStar Air** using the new URLs and apps.

* **Existing customers** can continue using **BioStar Air**. No immediate changes are required.

* The **backend engine is identical** for both platforms, ensuring data compatibility and service continuity.

**Important**

Some future features will only be available in **BioStar Air**.

#### Platform Comparison Table[‚Äã](#platform-comparison-table "Direct link to Platform Comparison Table")

| Category             | **BioStar Air**(Rebranded)                                                                        | **BioStar Air**(Retained for Korea)                     |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Service**          | BioStar Air                                                                                       | BioStar Air                                             |
| **Web Portal**       | [BioStar Air](https://admin.biostarair.com)                                                       | [BioStar Air](https://app.airfobspace.com)              |
| **Admin App**        | BioStar Air                                                                                       | BioStar Air                                             |
| **User App**         | Suprema Pass*Supports BioStar Air credentials only (Airfob support coming)*                       | BioStar Air                                             |
| **Partner Portal**   | [BioStar Air Partners](https://partner.biostarair.com)                                            | [Airfob Partners](https://partner.airfobspace.com)      |
| **Developer Portal** | [BioStar Air Developers](https://developers.biostarair.com) *API base URLs will remain unchanged* | [Airfob Developers](https://developers.airfobspace.com) |

#### Frequently Asked Questions[‚Äã](#frequently-asked-questions "Direct link to Frequently Asked Questions")

<!-- -->

Q.Do I need to switch from Airfob Space to BioStar Air?

No. If you are an existing Airfob Space customer, you can continue using the platform as-is. There is no forced migration at this time.

Q.Will my devices or data be affected?

No. Both platforms share the same backend. Devices, user data, and configurations remain fully compatible across both services.

Q.Should I start using Suprema Pass instead of the Airfob Space app?

There is no need to migrate existing mobile credential users over to BioStar Air. If you use the [app.airfobspace.com](app.airfobspace.com) URL or Airfob Pro app to manage users and issue mobile credentials, those users will receive an invitation that points to the Airfob Space app. If you use [admin.biostarair.com](admin.biostarair.com) or the BioStar Air app to manage users and issue mobile credentials, those users will receive an invitation that points to the Suprema Pass app.

Q.Will support or billing change?

No immediate changes will occur in your support or billing processes. Over time, however, BioStar Air will become the primary brand used for documentation, support, and feature announcements.

Q.Can I switch to BioStar Air if I want to?

Yes. Since the backend is shared, transitioning is simple, but some branding and feature availability differences may apply. Simply start using [admin.biostarair.com](admin.biostarair.com) and the BioStar Air app to manage your site. Existing administrator login credentials from [app.airfobspace.com](app.airfobspace.com) will work seamlessly.

Q.What are the benefits of BioStar Air?

BioStar Air is the future-facing brand. It will receive ongoing enhancements, such as improved integrations, UI/UX updates, and new features that may not be backported to Airfob Space.

Q.Will future features work with Airfob Space?

Some will, but not all. New features may be exclusive to BioStar Air going forward. For the best experience and support, new deployments should use BioStar Air.


---

### BioStar Air Partner Portal Detailed Use

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The BioStar Air Partner Portal is an exclusive tool for value-added resellers (VARs) that allows them to manage customer sites, distribute credits, and oversee administrative functions efficiently.

#### Navigating to the Partner Portal[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-partner-portal "Direct link to Navigating to the Partner Portal")

The Partner Portal is a web-based platform accessible at: <https://partner.biostarair.com/>

#### Step-by-Step Instructions[‚Äã](#step-by-step-instructions "Direct link to Step-by-Step Instructions")

##### Signing Up for the Partner Portal[‚Äã](#signing-up-for-the-partner-portal "Direct link to Signing Up for the Partner Portal")

1. After signing a distribution agreement, you will receive an email invitation to join the Partner Portal.

2. Click the **Sign Up** button in the email.

3. You will be redirected to the Partner Portal sign-up page.

4. Review and agree to the **Privacy Policy** and **Terms of Usage**.

5. Enter your name and create a password.

6. Click **Sign Up** to complete the process.

##### Managing Sites[‚Äã](#managing-sites "Direct link to Managing Sites")

Once signed in, you will see a list of sites associated with your account.

* View site details, including site name, country, and assigned credits.

* Monitor the monthly cost of each site to determine when additional credits are needed.

* Track the number of users and registered devices.

* Add notes for internal tracking.

##### Editing Site Details[‚Äã](#editing-site-details "Direct link to Editing Site Details")

1. Click on a site to open the site edit pop-up.

2. Update the site's information, including time zone and country.

3. Add or modify notes related to the site.

4. Adjust the number of allocated credits.

5. Invite additional administrators to the site.

6. Delete a site if necessary.

##### Tracking Credit History[‚Äã](#tracking-credit-history "Direct link to Tracking Credit History")

The **Credit History** section allows you to view all credit transactions:

* Set a time frame to review credit changes over a specific period.

* Monitor recent credit additions to customer sites.

##### Managing Administrators[‚Äã](#managing-administrators "Direct link to Managing Administrators")

In the **Admin** section, you can invite employees to access the Partner Portal:

1. Choose the administrator level.

2. Enter the employee‚Äôs email address.

3. Click **OK** to send an invitation.

End customers should not be added to the Partner Portal. Only VARs should manage site creation and credit distribution.

##### Understanding Ami Roles and Permissions[‚Äã](#understanding-ami-roles-and-permissions "Direct link to Understanding Ami Roles and Permissions")

The Partner Portal has four levels of permissions:

* **Observer**: Can view site information but cannot make any changes.

* **Operator**: Can set up new sites and assign credits but cannot modify administrator privileges or invite new administrators.

* **Administrator**: Can invite and manage other administrators but cannot remove Master-level users.

* **Master**: Has full control over the portal, including user management, site creation, and credit distribution. Only a Master can activate a Partner Portal account initially.

A Master account must be set up and activated before other users (Administrators, Operators, or Observers) can access the portal.

#### Common Issues & Considerations[‚Äã](#common-issues-considerations "Direct link to Common Issues & Considerations")

* The Partner Portal is for VARs only and not for site administrators or end users.

* If you do not receive the email invitation, check your spam folder or contact your Partner Portal administrator.

* Ensure the email used for registration is correct, as it cannot be changed later.


---

### Configuring User and Log Reports

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

Reports in BioStar Air can be configured from different screens depending on the type of report you need. This guide covers how to generate and schedule reports for users, event logs, and audit logs.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Accessing Report Configuration[‚Äã](#accessing-report-configuration "Direct link to Accessing Report Configuration")

To configure a report, navigate to the appropriate section:

* For user reports: Go to **User Management** ‚Üí **Users**.

* For event log or admin action reports: Go to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Event Logs** or **Audit Logs**.

In these screens, locate the report icon in the toolbar at the top (a document icon). Hover over it to see the label **Report**, then click it to open the report settings.

#### Configuring User Reports[‚Äã](#configuring-user-reports "Direct link to Configuring User Reports")

1. Enter a report name.

2. Click **Filters** and select criteria:

   * User Type

   * Card Type

   * User Status

   * User Group

   * Access Level

   * Floor Level

3. Click **Add Report** to save it.

4. At the bottom of the screen, the **Report List** displays all created reports.

5. Click the **Download** icon to export the report as a **PDF** or **CSV**. You will receive a download links via email as soon as the reports are ready.

6. Click the **Delete** button to remove a report.

![](/docs/en/img/air/air-sitemanagement-configuring-user-reports.png)

#### Configuring Event Log Reports[‚Äã](#configuring-event-log-reports "Direct link to Configuring Event Log Reports")

1. Go to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Event Logs**.

2. Click the **Report** button.

3. Choose from the following filters:

   * Events

   * User Type

   * Device Group

   * Device Nickname

   * User Group

   * Access Level

   * Device ID

   * Door

![](/docs/en/img/air/air-sitemanagement-configuring-log-reports.png)

#### Configuring Audit Log Reports[‚Äã](#configuring-audit-log-reports "Direct link to Configuring Audit Log Reports")

1. Go to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Audit Logs**.

2. Click the **Report** button.

3. Choose from the following filters:

   * **Account**: Select a user or group of users.

   * **Action**: Choose specific actions.

   * **Admin**: Select the admin level.

   * **Type**: Filter by action type.

#### Scheduling Reports[‚Äã](#scheduling-reports "Direct link to Scheduling Reports")

1. Go to **Site Settings** ‚Üí **Alerts**.

2. Click **Add Alert** (blue button in the upper-right corner).

3. Select **Report** as the alert type.

4. Choose the report name.

5. Set the report schedule:

   * Weekly or monthly.

   * Select the specific day for delivery.

   * All reports will be sent at midnight on the selected day.

6. Select the target recipients:

   * All admins at a certain admin level.

   * Individual admins.

7. Choose the delivery method:

   * Reports **can only be sent via email**.

   * They cannot be sent via SMS or push notifications.


---

### Configuring Time & Attendance (T&A)

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

BioStar Air provides basic Time & Attendance (T\&A) tracking by recording shift and break times, which can be exported or integrated with an external T\&A system. While BioStar Air does not offer a full T\&A management system, it supports event logging and API integrations with payroll and attendance systems. It also allows for export of a basic "hours worked" report.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### How T\&A Works in BioStar Air[‚Äã](#how-t-and-a-works "Direct link to How T\&A Works in BioStar Air")

Users can log T\&A events such as:

* **Start Shift**

* **End Shift**

* **Start Break**

* **End Break**

These events are recorded in the event logs and can be exported as a CSV file or retrieved via API.

#### Setting Up Mobile T\&A[‚Äã](#setting-up-mobile-t-and-a "Direct link to Setting Up Mobile T\&A")

To enable Mobile T\&A:

1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Site** ‚Üí **Settings**.

2. Ensure you are logged in as a **master administrator**.

3. Find **T\&A on Mobile** and activate it.

4. Set labels for T\&A keys (e.g., Start Shift, End Shift, Start Break, End Break).

5. Specify whether each event is a **Clock-In** or **Clock-Out** event.

6. Click **Save** to confirm.

#### Assigning T\&A to Devices[‚Äã](#assigning-tanda-to-devices "Direct link to Assigning T\&A to Devices")

Once Mobile T\&A is activated, specify which devices should use it:

1. Go to **Device Management** and select a registered device.

2. Scroll down to **T\&A Settings** and select **Mobile**.

3. Choose whether T\&A selection is **required** or **optional**.

4. Click **Save** to apply settings.

T\&A event labels are managed at the site level and cannot be changed per device.

#### Viewing and Exporting T\&A Logs[‚Äã](#viewing-and-exporting-t-and-a-logs "Direct link to Viewing and Exporting T\&A Logs")

T\&A events are recorded in the event logs.

1. Go to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Event Logs**.

2. Locate the **T\&A Column** in the log table.

3. Customize the log table to move the T\&A column for better visibility.

4. Click **Export** to download the data as a CSV file.

#### Alternative T\&A Options[‚Äã](#alternative-tanda-options "Direct link to Alternative T\&A Options")

Devices can record T\&A events in different ways:

##### Disabled[‚Äã](#disabled "Direct link to Disabled")

The device does not record any T\&A data.

##### By Schedule[‚Äã](#by-schedule "Direct link to By Schedule")

* Defines clock-in and clock-out times based on a set schedule.

* For example, events logged between 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM are recorded as **Clock-In**, and events between 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM are recorded as **Clock-Out**.

##### Fixed[‚Äã](#fixed "Direct link to Fixed")

* Assigns a fixed T\&A code (e.g., Start Shift) to a reader.

* Every authentication at this reader logs the same T\&A event.

* Useful for dedicated T\&A readers (e.g., one reader for clock-in, another for clock-out).

##### Mobile[‚Äã](#mobile "Direct link to Mobile")

* Users must select a T\&A code before authenticating.

* The selected T\&A event is recorded along with access logs.

#### Finalizing T\&A Configuration[‚Äã](#finalizing-t-and-a-configuration "Direct link to Finalizing T\&A Configuration")

Once T\&A settings are configured, ensure all changes are saved:

* Click **Save** to apply changes.

* Click **Cancel** to discard modifications.


---

### Configuring the Airfob Patch and Tag

#### Device Overview[‚Äã](#device-overview "Direct link to Device Overview")

The Airfob Patch and Tag devices upgrade existing access control readers or door locks to be compatible with BioStar Air mobile credentials.

* **Airfob Patch**: Ideal for wired readers and intercoms, this energy-harvesting device attaches without the need for wiring.

* **Airfob Tag**: Equipped with a coin cell battery, making it suitable for battery-powered devices like door locks.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Compatibility[‚Äã](#compatibility "Direct link to Compatibility")

Both devices work with MIFARE 1K technology but are not compatible with 125 KHz "low frequency" readers or locks.

#### Functionality[‚Äã](#functionality "Direct link to Functionality")

These devices operate by reading the encrypted Bluetooth BioStar Air credential from a mobile phone and emulating a MIFARE RFID signal. They attach to readers and locks using tape, requiring no wiring.

#### Configuration Steps[‚Äã](#configuration-steps "Direct link to Configuration Steps")

After installing your Tag or Patch and registering it with the BioStar Air app, follow these steps to configure your device:

##### Access the App[‚Äã](#access-the-app "Direct link to Access the App")

* Open the **BioStar Air** app.

* Log into the site where your Tag or Patch is registered.

##### Navigate to Device Settings[‚Äã](#navigate-to-device-settings "Direct link to Navigate to Device Settings")

* Tap **Access Point** on the menu bar.

* Select **Device** to view a list of registered devices.

* Choose the Patch or Tag you wish to configure.

##### Enable BLE Mode[‚Äã](#enable-ble-mode "Direct link to Enable BLE Mode")

* Bring your phone close to the device.

* Toggle on **BLE Mode** in the app.

##### Set Card ID Output Method[‚Äã](#set-card-id-output-method "Direct link to Set Card ID Output Method")

* Scroll to **Card ID Output Method** and tap **Edit**.

* Press **Select** next to **User Card ID**.

##### Choose the Output Method[‚Äã](#choose-the-output-method "Direct link to Choose the Output Method")

* **None**: Select this option if no card ID should be transmitted. This setting is useful for Time & Attendance (T\&A) purposes to extend battery life.

* **Fixed Device**: Transmits a constant, pre-programmed card ID. Useful for door locks or intercoms that require RFID cards to be programmed individually. The device log will only display this fixed card ID.

* **User Card ID**: Transmits a unique card ID for each user, aligning with existing RFID card numbers in access control systems. This allows seamless integration without issuing new physical cards.

* **Direct Input**: Manually specify the card ID to transmit. Useful for custom settings where a single ID must be used across multiple devices.

##### Save Your Settings[‚Äã](#save-your-settings "Direct link to Save Your Settings")

* Confirm your selections by pressing **Save** while your phone is near the device.

* A success message will confirm the update.

By following these steps, you can ensure that your Airfob Patch and Tag devices are properly configured to meet your specific access control needs.


---

### Configuring the SIO2 Secure Module

#### Overview[‚Äã](#overview "Direct link to Overview")

The **SIO2 Secure Module** enhances security in your access control system by acting as an intermediary between the Suprema or Airfob reader and the relay. It communicates with the reader via an **RS485 cable**, with encrypted communication to prevent security breaches.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

Caution

**Please refer to the wiring diagrams included in the box with your SIO2 Secure Module for accurate setup instructions.** Since installation may vary depending on the environment, professional assistance from your local Suprema installer may be required.

#### How to Activate SIO2 in the BioStar Air Portal[‚Äã](#how-to-activate-sio2-in-the-biostar-air-portal "Direct link to How to Activate SIO2 in the BioStar Air Portal")

If you do not change the settings in the BioStar Air portal after installing SIO2, it will not function correctly.

##### Register the Reader[‚Äã](#register-the-reader "Direct link to Register the Reader")

* Ensure the reader device, SIO2, and door relay are successfully connected.

* Register the reader device on your site using the **BioStar Air app**.

##### Check Device Connection[‚Äã](#check-device-connection "Direct link to Check Device Connection")

* Access the **BioStar Air portal**.

* Navigate to **Device Management** ‚Üí **Registered Devices**.

* Ensure the device shows a **green status indicator**, confirming its connection.

##### Assign SIO2 to a Door[‚Äã](#assign-sio2-to-a-door "Direct link to Assign SIO2 to a Door")

* Go to **Door Management** ‚Üí **Registered Door**.

* Find the door where the device is connected. (The door is automatically created when the device is registered.)

##### Enable SIO2[‚Äã](#enable-sio2 "Direct link to Enable SIO2")

* In the **Assign Devices** area, a pop-up screen will appear.

* Toggle on **SIO2** to activate it.

##### Configure Relay and Sensors[‚Äã](#configure-relay-and-sensors "Direct link to Configure Relay and Sensors")

* For **Door Relay**, select **Relay 0**. (The SIO2 module has only one Door Relay port.)

* For **Door Sensor**, select the input port number on the SIO2 where the Door Sensor is connected.

* If an **Exit Button** is connected, select the corresponding input port on the SIO2.

* If using another type of exit device, select **Exit Devices** instead.

##### Save the Settings[‚Äã](#save-the-settings "Direct link to Save the Settings")

* Click the **Save** button to apply the configuration.

* The SIO2 Secure Module will now function normally.

Following these steps ensures that your SIO2 Secure Module is properly integrated and enhances the security of your access control system.


---

### Custom Wiegand Card Formats

Introduced in **v2.10** (August 2025), Wiegand Card Format support is now available for **BioStation 3** and **BioEntry W3** devices. Support for all BioStar Air-compatible readers is planned by the end of 2025.

#### Navigating to the Feature[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-feature "Direct link to Navigating to the Feature")

Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Card Format** in the BioStar Air Portal.

#### Card Format Overview[‚Äã](#card-format-overview "Direct link to Card Format Overview")

Create, manage, and view special card formats, including **Wiegand formats**, **SIA**, and **HID formats**. This feature is especially useful for sites migrating from existing access control solutions where cards are already provisioned.

| Feature                              | Description                                                                                                                                                           |
| ------------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Card Format List**                 | View all registered Wiegand card formats, including default formats included in BioStar Air (26-bit SIA Standard, HID 37-bit, HID Corporate 1000).                    |
| **View Wiegand Card Format Details** | See the name, description, total bits, bit preview, and detailed bit assignments.                                                                                     |
| **Add Wiegand Card Format**          | Configure a new custom card format, including name, description, total bits, and detailed bit assignments. The system provides a bit preview for visual verification. |

#### Adding a Wiegand Card Format[‚Äã](#adding-a-wiegand-card-format "Direct link to Adding a Wiegand Card Format")

1. **Detail**: Enter the **Name**, optional **Description**, and **Total Bits** for the format.

2. **Bit Preview**: View a visual representation of all bits in the format, showing assignments for Facility Code, ID, Parity Bits, and unassigned bits.

3. **Bit Assignment** Configure:

   * **Facility Code**: Enable/disable and assign bit ranges.

   * **ID**: Add one or more ID segments with start and end bits.

   * **Parity Bit**: Add Odd/Even parity bits with defined start and end ranges.

4. Click **Save** to register the new format.

**Add Wiegand Card Format**

![](/docs/en/img/air/air-custom-wiegand-card-format-01.png)

![](/docs/en/img/air/air-custom-wiegand-card-format-02.png)


---

### Customizing Email Templates

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The Email Templates feature in BioStar Air allows you to customize the emails sent to your site users, ensuring they reflect your company‚Äôs brand and messaging. This includes invitations, activation emails, and other notifications.

#### Navigating to the Feature[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-feature "Direct link to Navigating to the Feature")

To access the Email Templates settings:

* Go to **Settings**.

* Select **Email Templates**.

#### Step-by-Step Instructions[‚Äã](#step-by-step-instructions "Direct link to Step-by-Step Instructions")

1. Click **Add Template** at the top of the Email Templates screen.

2. Select the type of email template you want to create. Available options include:

   * **Activated Email**: Typically used as an invitation to download a mobile card.

   * **Reactivated Email**: Used when a card is reactivated.

   * **Reissued Email**: Used when a new card is issued.

   * **Delete Email**: Notifies users about card deletion.

   * **Suspended Email**: Informs users about a suspended card.

3. For templates allowing downloads, such as **Activated** and **Reissued**, select the card type:

   * **Mobile**

   * **Web QR**

   * **Web Link**

4. Choose the email language. Currently supported languages include:

   * English

   * Korean

   * Japanese

   * Dutch

   * Spanish

   * Portuguese

   More languages may be added in the future.

5. Customize the email:

   * Upload a **Logo Image** to align the email with your company‚Äôs branding.

   * Edit the **Title Text** to make it clear that the email is from your company.

   * Modify the **Body Text** to include a personalized message.

   * Add your **Address** for regulatory compliance or to provide users with your location details.

6. Click **Save** to finalize the template.

Your new email template will now appear in the list and can be used for the selected email type and language.

#### Common Issues & Considerations[‚Äã](#common-issues-and-considerations "Direct link to Common Issues & Considerations")

* Ensure that your logo image is in an appropriate format and size for proper display in emails.

* If your language is not currently supported, check for future updates as more languages may be added.

* The address field is important for compliance and clarity; ensure it is accurate.


---

### Daylight Saving Time (DST) Configuration

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

Daylight Saving Time (DST) allows you to configure how time adjustments occur for a site. This is especially important when managing sites with readers in multiple time zones, ensuring consistent and accurate time tracking.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to the Feature[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-feature "Direct link to Navigating to the Feature")

To access the DST settings:

* Go to **Settings**.

* Click on **DST**.

* You will be directed to the **Daylight Saving Time** page, where you can view and edit existing DST configurations.

#### Step-by-Step Instructions[‚Äã](#step-by-step-instructions "Direct link to Step-by-Step Instructions")

##### Editing an Existing DST Configuration[‚Äã](#editing-an-existing-dst-configuration "Direct link to Editing an Existing DST Configuration")

1. On the **Daylight Saving Time** page, locate the DST configuration you want to edit.

2. Click on the existing DST setting to modify its parameters.

##### Adding a New DST Configuration[‚Äã](#adding-a-new-dst-configuration "Direct link to Adding a New DST Configuration")

1. Click the **Add DST** button in the top right corner of the screen.

2. Select the appropriate time zone from the drop-down menu.

3. Choose whether to enable **Automatic DST** (recommended) or configure it manually.

4. If using **Automatic DST**, simply toggle on the switch.

5. If configuring manually, specify the appropriate start and end day or week for that time zone.

##### Enabling DST for Devices[‚Äã](#enabling-dst-for-devices "Direct link to Enabling DST for Devices")

Each device must also have DST enabled to ensure accurate time adjustments:

1. Go to **Device Management**.

2. Click on **Registered Devices**.

3. Select a device from the list.

4. Locate the **Time Zone** section.

5. Toggle on **Use DST** to enable daylight saving time for the device.

For time zones that observe DST, this setting is typically enabled by default.

#### Common Issues & Considerations[‚Äã](#common-issues-and-considerations "Direct link to Common Issues & Considerations")

In **Event Logs**:

* If device time is set, event log timestamps will be coordinated with the DST time for each individual device.

* If site time is set, timestamps will be adjusted according to the site's DST configuration rather than per device.


---

### Federated Sites

#### Overview[‚Äã](#overview "Direct link to Overview")

BioStar Air provides the capability to create **federated sites**, allowing a primary site to manage multiple sub-sites seamlessly. This feature is ideal for multi-tenant buildings or multi-branch organizations, offering centralized control with distributed access management.

#### What Are Federated Sites?[‚Äã](#what-are-federated-sites "Direct link to What Are Federated Sites?")

Federated sites enable a hierarchical structure where a **primary site** oversees one or more **sub-sites**. Administrators on the primary site, known as **Federated Admins**, can access and manage sub-sites directly through the BioStar Air interface.

#### Why Use Federated Sites?[‚Äã](#why-use-federated-sites "Direct link to Why Use Federated Sites?")

Federated sites are beneficial in the following scenarios:

##### Multi-Tenant Buildings[‚Äã](#multi-tenant-buildings "Direct link to Multi-Tenant Buildings")

For example, in a commercial building with different companies occupying each floor, you can establish:

* A **master account** for the building.

* **Sub-accounts** for each tenant company.

This setup ensures only authorized employees access specific floors while simplifying management for the building administrator.

##### Multi-Branch Organizations[‚Äã](#multi-branch-organizations "Direct link to Multi-Branch Organizations")

For companies with offices in multiple locations, you can set up:

* A **master account** to manage global settings.

* **Sub-accounts** for each branch.

For instance, a business with 10 offices worldwide can use a federated structure to streamline administration.

#### How to Set Up Federated Sites[‚Äã](#how-to-set-up-federated-sites "Direct link to How to Set Up Federated Sites")

##### Access the Partner Portal[‚Äã](#access-the-partner-portal "Direct link to Access the Partner Portal")

* The Airfob Partner Portal is exclusively available to partners and installers.

* End customers must contact their installer to configure this feature.

##### Create the Primary Site[‚Äã](#create-the-primary-site "Direct link to Create the Primary Site")

1. Log in to the **Partner Portal**.

2. Click **Create Site** and select **Federation Site** under the **Site Profile**.

   * This step **must** be done when setting up a site for the first time.

   * Regular sites cannot be changed into federated sites later.

3. Add **Federated Admins** on the same screen.

   * **Federated Admins** (added in the Partner Portal) have access to the primary site and all sub-sites.

   * **Regular Admins** (added in Airfob Pro) only manage individual sites.

##### Add Sub-Sites[‚Äã](#add-sub-sites "Direct link to Add Sub-Sites")

1. Once the primary site is set up as a federated site, the **Site List** will display an option to create sub-sites.

2. Click **Create Sub-Site** and configure it as you would any other site.

#### Important Considerations[‚Äã](#important-considerations "Direct link to Important Considerations")

##### User and Reader Management[‚Äã](#user-and-reader-management "Direct link to User and Reader Management")

* Users and readers must be added separately to each sub-site.

* Readers can only be registered to one site at a time‚Äîeither the primary site or a sub-site.

##### Primary Site Usage[‚Äã](#primary-site-usage "Direct link to Primary Site Usage")

* Some customers use the primary site solely as an access point for managing sub-sites, without registering users or readers to the primary site.

* **Example 1**: A company with three branch offices sets up a primary site with no devices and creates sub-sites for each branch.

* **Example 2**: A company with a headquarters and three branches registers users and readers at the headquarters (primary site) and sets up sub-sites for the branches.

##### Billing[‚Äã](#billing "Direct link to Billing")

* Billing is calculated based on the number of registered devices (readers) per site.

* There is no additional cost for creating a primary site without registered devices.

By utilizing the Federated Sites feature in BioStar Air, administrators can effectively manage access for complex environments, ensuring a secure, scalable, and streamlined experience for all stakeholders.


---

### Getting Started

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

BioStar Air Portal provides a unified interface across web and mobile apps, ensuring a consistent user experience. This platform allows administrators to manage access control settings, monitor site usage, and configure users and devices seamlessly.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to the Feature[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-feature "Direct link to Navigating to the Feature")

To access the BioStar Air Portal, open your web browser and go to [admin.biostarair.com](https://admin.biostarair.com). Upon reaching the login page, select either **Global Server** or **EU Server** based on your location.

An admin account is required for login, which must be granted by another administrator.

#### Dashboard Overview[‚Äã](#dashboard-overview "Direct link to Dashboard Overview")

Upon logging in, you will see the **BioStar Air dashboard**, which provides key site information:

* **Tag Status** - Displays the number of users who have accessed the site today.

* **Active Users** - Shows the total number of registered and activated users.

* **Devices** - Indicates the number of registered devices on your site.

* **Account Credits** - Displays the remaining balance of your account credits.

Clicking on any of these cards will take you to their respective sections.

Below these sections, you will find:

* **Site Usage** - Allows sorting by device group, frequency (daily, weekly, monthly), or a custom date range.

* **Recent Actions** - Displays activity logs for actions taken by administrators, such as logins, device updates, and user creation.

#### Step-by-Step Guide to Setting Up Your First Site[‚Äã](#step-by-step-guide "Direct link to Step-by-Step Guide to Setting Up Your First Site")

Setting up a new site follows a logical sequence. The process includes:

##### Adding Administrators[‚Äã](#adding-administrators "Direct link to Adding Administrators")

To invite administrators:

1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Admin**.

2. Click **Invite**.

3. Enter the admin's email address and assign a role.

Info

Administrators can manage the site, while regular users only use the **Suprema Pass** app for access.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

##### Registering Devices[‚Äã](#registering-devices "Direct link to Registering Devices")

To check or add registered devices:

1. Go to **Device Management** ‚Üí **Registered Devices**.

2. If devices are missing, another admin must register them on-site using the BioStar Air mobile app.

3. In this section, you can delete devices, update firmware, and manage device groups.

##### Creating and Managing Doors[‚Äã](#creating-and-managing-doors "Direct link to Creating and Managing Doors")

To add doors and assign devices:

1. Navigate to **Door Management** ‚Üí **Registered Doors**.

2. If no doors exist, click **Add a Door** and provide a name and description.

3. Assign registered devices to entry and exit points.

Here, you can also edit, delete, schedule access, and manage door groups.

##### Categorizing Doors into Groups[‚Äã](#categorizing-doors-into-groups "Direct link to Categorizing Doors into Groups")

To organize doors into groups:

1. Go to **Door Management** ‚Üí **Door Groups**.

2. Click **Add a Door Group**.

3. Assign doors to groups like *Interior, Exterior, or Trap Doors*.

##### Configuring Access Rights[‚Äã](#configuring-access-rights "Direct link to Configuring Access Rights")

To manage access levels, follow these steps:

###### Setting Up Holiday Groups[‚Äã](#setting-up-holiday-groups "Direct link to Setting Up Holiday Groups")

1. Go to **Access Management** ‚Üí **Holiday Groups**.

2. Click **Add Holiday Group** and name it (e.g., "US Holidays").

3. Specify holidays when access will be restricted.

###### Creating Schedules[‚Äã](#creating-schedules "Direct link to Creating Schedules")

1. Go to **Access Management** ‚Üí **Schedules**.

2. Click **Add a Schedule** and name it.

3. Select active days and link holiday groups.

###### Defining Access Levels[‚Äã](#defining-access-levels "Direct link to Defining Access Levels")

1. Go to **Access Management** ‚Üí **Access Levels**.

2. Click **Add Access Level**, name it, and assign door groups, individual doors, and schedules.

##### Creating User Groups and Adding Users[‚Äã](#creating-user-groups-and-adding-users "Direct link to Creating User Groups and Adding Users")

To create user groups:

1. Go to **User Management** ‚Üí **User Groups**.

2. Click **Add User Group** and name it.

To add users:

1. Go to **User Management** ‚Üí **Users**.

2. Click **Add User** and provide the user‚Äôs ID, name, email, and credential type.

3. Assign an access level.

4. Click **Activate Card** to finalize access.

You can manage users in bulk, re-issuing, suspending, or deleting them, as well as exporting data and bulk-uploading profile images.

#### Final Checklist[‚Äã](#final-checklist "Direct link to Final Checklist")

To summarize, follow these steps in order:

1. Add administrators.

2. Register devices.

3. Create doors and assign devices.

4. Organize doors into groups.

5. Set up access rights (holidays, schedules, access levels).

6. Create user groups and add users.

Following these steps ensures a smooth setup of your BioStar Air site. For more details, refer to individual video tutorials on each section.


---

### How to Upgrade Firmware

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

Upgrading the firmware in BioStar Air ensures that your devices run the latest software version with improvements, bug fixes, and new features. The process is simple and can be done via the BioStar Air web portal or the BioStar Air mobile app.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to the Feature[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-feature "Direct link to Navigating to the Feature")

To upgrade the firmware using the web portal:

* Go to [admin.biostarair.com](https://admin.biostarair.com) and log in.

* Navigate to **Device Management** ‚Üí **Registered Devices** in the left-hand sidebar.

#### Step-by-Step Instructions[‚Äã](#step-by-step-instructions "Direct link to Step-by-Step Instructions")

##### Upgrading Firmware in Bulk via Web Portal[‚Äã](#upgrading-firmware-in-bulk-via-web-portal "Direct link to Upgrading Firmware in Bulk via Web Portal")

1. Log in to [admin.biostarair.com](https://admin.biostarair.com).

2. Go to **Device Management** ‚Üí **Registered Devices**.

3. Find the **Firmware** column (second from the left) to check the current version of each device.

4. Sort devices by firmware version using the arrow buttons next to the column heading.

5. Select devices running an outdated firmware version (anything below **2.9** as of August 2025) by checking the box on the left side.

6. Click the gear icon in the toolbar at the top of the screen.

7. Hover over the icon to confirm it says **Update Firmware**, then click it.

8. Select the latest firmware version **2.9** or **2.10**, depending on the reader, (as of August 2025) and confirm the update.

![](/docs/en/img/air/air-device-management-upgrade-fw.png)

![](/docs/en/img/air/air-device-management-upgrade-fw-list.png)

##### Upgrading Firmware for an Individual Device via Web Portal[‚Äã](#upgrading-firmware-for-an-individual-device-via-web-portal "Direct link to Upgrading Firmware for an Individual Device via Web Portal")

1. In the **Registered Devices** list, click on the device name.

2. In the **Edit Device** screen, scroll down to the **Device Info** section.

3. Click on the **Firmware Update** button.

4. Select the latest firmware version **2.9** or **2.10**, depending on the reader, (as of August 2025) and confirm the update.

![](/docs/en/img/air/air-device-management-upgrade-fw-edit-device.png)

##### Upgrading Firmware via BioStar Air Mobile App[‚Äã](#upgrading-firmware-via-biostar-air-mobile-app "Direct link to Upgrading Firmware via BioStar Air Mobile App")

The process for upgrading firmware using the BioStar Air app on iOS or Android is similar to the web portal:

1. Open the BioStar Air app and log in.

2. Go to the device list and check the firmware version of your devices.

3. Select devices running an outdated version and choose the firmware update option.

4. Select the latest version **2.9** or **2.10**, depending on the reader, (as of August 2025) and confirm the update.

#### Common Issues & Considerations[‚Äã](#common-issues-considerations "Direct link to Common Issues & Considerations")

* **Devices must be online** to receive the firmware update. Check the device status in the **Product** column. A green dot next to the device image indicates it is online.

* During the firmware update, devices will **temporarily go offline** but should reconnect within **three to five minutes**.

* To avoid disruptions, it is recommended to perform firmware updates **outside peak business hours**.

#### Learn More about Device Management[‚Äã](#learn-more-about-device-management "Direct link to Learn More about Device Management")

Learn more about device management in BioStar Air by watching the following video:


---

### Getting Started with API Integrations

#### Overview[‚Äã](#overview "Direct link to Overview")

This guide walks you through how to set up a BioStar Air demo site, connect and register a BioStar Air-compatible readers to it, and begin testing your integration using our cloud APIs.

If you‚Äôve previously worked with BioStar 2, many concepts will feel familiar‚Äîbut BioStar Air is fully cloud-native.

#### Getting Started[‚Äã](#getting-started "Direct link to Getting Started")

##### Pre-Requisites[‚Äã](#pre-requisites "Direct link to Pre-Requisites")

Ensure the following:

* You have a **BioStar Air compatible device**with factory-loaded firmware:

  * XP2-AIR, XS2-AIR, BEW3-AIR, BS3-AIR, BLN2-AIR

  * Devices may be purchased through authorized Suprema dealers

* The device is connected to the internet via Ethernet.

* Your network allows outbound access on:

  * Port 443 (HTTPS)
  * Port 5671 (MQTT over TLS)

#### Step 1: Set Up Your Demo Environment & API Key[‚Äã](#step-1-demo-setup "Direct link to Step 1: Set Up Your Demo Environment & API Key")

##### Sign Up and Log In[‚Äã](#sign-up-and-log-in "Direct link to Sign Up and Log In")

* Go to: <https://developers.biostarair.com/login>

* Click **Sign Up**, fill out the form, and wait for approval.

* Once approved, log in using your credentials.

##### Create a Demo Application[‚Äã](#create-a-demo-application "Direct link to Create a Demo Application")

* Navigate to **API** ‚Üí **Management**.

* Click **+ Register**.

* Choose **Demo** as the application type.

* Enter a name for your application and click **Register**.

* Click **Download** to retrieve an Excel file containing your demo site login credentials (email and password).

##### Issue an API Key[‚Äã](#issue-an-api-key "Direct link to Issue an API Key")

* Under **Application Management** click into your registered application.

* Scroll to **API Management**.

* Click **Add**.

* Enter a name and confirm. Save the generated key.

##### Log Into the Demo Portal[‚Äã](#log-into-the-demo-portal "Direct link to Log Into the Demo Portal")

* Navigate to the [Demo Portal](https://demo.airfobspace.com/login).

* Log in with the email and password from the Excel file.

* Enter the API Key you just created.

#### Step 2: Register the Reader[‚Äã](#register-the-reader "Direct link to Step 2: Register the Reader")

Use the BioStar Air Demo App (Android only):

1. Download the app: [DeviceRegistration.zip](https://moca-public-file-share.s3.ap-northeast-2.amazonaws.com/DeviceRegistration.zip)

2. Log in with the credentials from the Excel file.

3. Bring your Android phone near the reader (BLE range), then:

   * Tap **All Menu** ‚Üí **Devices** ‚Üí **+** (upper right corner).

   * Locate your device and tap **Register**.

4. The reader will chime, reboot, and appear under Registered Devices.

Readers can only be registered using the mobile app. Web registration is not supported. API-based registration requires a cryptographic certificate not provided to partners.

#### Step 3: Manage the Reader[‚Äã](#step-3-manage-the-reader "Direct link to Step 3: Manage the Reader")

Manage the device using either:

* The **Airfob Pro Demo App**

* The **Demo Web Portal**: <https://demo.airfobspace.com/login>

#### API Base URLs[‚Äã](#api-base-urls "Direct link to API Base URLs")

| Environment         | Base URL                                                      |
| ------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Demo                | <https://demo-afs-api.airfob.com/v1/>                         |
| Production - Europe | <https://e-afs-api.airfob.com/v1/>                            |
| Production - Korea  | <https://a-afs-api.airfob.com/v1/> (for all non-EU customers) |

#### Recommended Integration Scope[‚Äã](#recommended-integration-scope "Direct link to Recommended Integration Scope")

When possible limit your integration to:

* User lifecycle management (create/update/delete)

* Credential management (mobile, RF card, biometric)

Allow administrators to use the existing BioStar Air web and mobile admin apps for:

* Access levels

* Schedules

* Door and reader settings

* Site settings

#### Optional: API Login Flow (Postman or Programmatic)[‚Äã](#optional-api-login-flow "Direct link to Optional: API Login Flow (Postman or Programmatic)")

##### Login[‚Äã](#login "Direct link to Login")

**Endpoint**: login

**Payload**:

```
{
  "username": "your_email",
  "password": "your_password"
}
```

Returns a Bearer Token (JWT).

##### Get Self Accounts[‚Äã](#get-self-accounts "Direct link to Get Self Accounts")

**Endpoint**: getSelfAccounts

**Authorization**: Bearer Token

Returns a list of accessible sites/accounts.

##### Login to an Account[‚Äã](#login-to-account "Direct link to Login to an Account")

**Endpoint**: loginAccount

**Authorization**: Bearer Token

Returns a site-specific token.

#### How to Get Your Bearer Token (Browser Method)[‚Äã](#how-to-get-your-bearer-token "Direct link to How to Get Your Bearer Token (Browser Method)")

##### Chrome/Edge (Windows or Mac)[‚Äã](#chrome-edge "Direct link to Chrome/Edge (Windows or Mac)")

1. Press `F12` or `Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + I`.

2. Go to the **Network** tab.

3. Reload the page.

4. Search for API calls. (e.g., groups, login)

5. Click on the request.

6. Go to the **Headers** tab.

7. Look for `Authorization: Bearer ...` in Request Headers.

8. Right-click and copy the token.

##### Safari (Mac)[‚Äã](#safari "Direct link to Safari (Mac)")

1. Enable **Develop** menu: Safari ‚Üí Preferences ‚Üí Advanced ‚Üí Check **Show Develop menu**

2. Open **Develop** ‚Üí **Show Web Inspector**.

3. Go to **Network** tab.

4. Reload the page.

5. Filter and inspect an API call.

6. Copy the `Authorization: Bearer` token from the request headers.

#### User Management API Calls[‚Äã](#user-management-api-calls "Direct link to User Management API Calls")

Once logged in, use these endpoints to manage users:

* `getUsers`

* `createUser`

* `updateUser`

* `suspendUsers`

Always include the Bearer Token in the Authorization header.

To activate a user, you must assign at least one credential type. (e.g., RF Card, Mobile, Linkpass)

#### Demo vs Production[‚Äã](#demo-vs-production "Direct link to Demo vs Production")

* **Demo Sites** are created via the Developer Portal for testing.

* **Production Sites** are created via the Partner Portal and require site ID, user email, and password. Production sites can only be created by authorized dealers or Suprema branch offices.

#### Important Notes[‚Äã](#important-notes "Direct link to Important Notes")

* User ID and Account ID are different ‚Äî do not confuse them.

* Store passwords securely if managing multiple sites.

* Always use the most recent Bearer Token.

* Bearer Tokens copied from the browser can be reused in Postman.

#### Need Help?[‚Äã](#need-help "Direct link to Need Help?")

Open a ticket on the Suprema Technical Support Portal: <https://support.supremainc.com>

#### Sample Application[‚Äã](#sample-application "Direct link to Sample Application")

Need an example? The following is sample code for a Python app that lets you bulk suspend users by uploading a CSV file via the API.

Python

```
import requests
import csv
import getpass
from pathlib import Path

def select_server():
    servers = {
        "1": ("Demo", "https://demo-afs-api.airfob.com/v1"),
        "2": ("Global", "https://a-afs-api.airfob.com/v1"),
        "3": ("EU", "https://e-afs-api.airfob.com/v1")
    }

    print("Please select a server:")
    for key, (name, _) in servers.items():
        print(f"{key}: {name}")

    choice = input("Enter server number: ").strip()
    return servers.get(choice, (None, None))[1]

def login(base_url, username, password):
    url = f"{base_url}/login"
    payload = {"username": username, "password": password}
    response = requests.post(url, json=payload)
    response.raise_for_status()
    data = response.json()
    token = data.get("access_token")
    if not token:
        raise ValueError("Login succeeded but no access_token returned.")
    print("‚úÖ Login successful.")
    return token

def login_to_account(base_url, token, account_id):
    url = f"{base_url}/login/{account_id}"
    headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}
    response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
    response.raise_for_status()
    new_token = response.json().get("access_token")
    if new_token:
        print(f"‚úÖ Switched to account ID: {account_id}")
        return new_token
    return token

def get_accounts(base_url, token):
    url = f"{base_url}/accounts/self"
    headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}
    response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    response.raise_for_status()
    accounts = response.json().get("accounts", [])
    return [{"id": acc["id"], "name": acc["site"]["name"]} for acc in accounts]

def suspend_users_from_csv(base_url, csv_path, token):
    if not Path(csv_path).exists():
        print(f"‚ùå File not found: {csv_path}")
        return

    headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}

    with open(csv_path, newline='', encoding='utf-8-sig') as f:
        reader = csv.DictReader(f)

        # Normalize headers
        reader.fieldnames = [field.strip().lower() for field in reader.fieldnames]
        if 'email' not in reader.fieldnames:
            print("‚ùå Missing required 'email' column in CSV.")
            return

        for row in reader:
            email = row.get("email")
            if not email:
                print("‚ö†Ô∏è Skipping row with missing email.")
                continue

            # Search user
            search_url = f"{base_url}/users/search"
            payload = {"filters": [{"field": "email", "equals": email}]}
            search_resp = requests.post(search_url, headers=headers, json=payload)
            if search_resp.status_code != 200:
                print(f"‚ùå Failed to search user {email}: {search_resp.text}")
                continue

            users = search_resp.json().get("users", [])
            if not users:
                print(f"‚ùå No user found with email: {email}")
                continue

            user_id = users[0]["id"]

            # Suspend user
            suspend_url = f"{base_url}/users/suspend"
            suspend_payload = {
                "ids": [user_id],
                "certify_by": "none",
                "use_site_template": True
            }
            suspend_resp = requests.post(suspend_url, headers=headers, json=suspend_payload)
            if suspend_resp.status_code == 200:
                print(f"‚úÖ Suspended user: {email}")
            else:
                print(f"‚ùå Failed to suspend user {email}: {suspend_resp.text}")

def main():
    base_url = select_server()
    if not base_url:
        print("‚ùå Invalid selection. Exiting.")
        return

    print("\n? BioStar Air Login")
    username = input("Email: ")
    password = getpass.getpass("Password: ")

    token = login(base_url, username, password)
    accounts = get_accounts(base_url, token)

    print("\n? Available Sites:")
    for i, acc in enumerate(accounts):
        print(f"{i}: {acc['name']} (ID: {acc['id']})")

    selected = int(input("\nSelect site number to log into: "))
    account_id = accounts[selected]["id"]
    token = login_to_account(base_url, token, account_id)

    csv_path = input("Enter path to CSV file with user emails: ").strip()
    suspend_users_from_csv(base_url, csv_path, token)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```


---

### Intro to the BioStar Air Partner Portal

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The BioStar Air Partner Portal is an exclusive platform designed for value-added resellers (VARs) who have signed distribution agreements. It allows resellers to set up new sites for customers and distribute credits efficiently.

#### Navigating to the Partner Portal[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-partner-portal "Direct link to Navigating to the Partner Portal")

The Partner Portal is only available as a web portal. You can access it by visiting: <https://partner.biostarair.com/>

#### Step-by-Step Instructions[‚Äã](#step-by-step-instructions "Direct link to Step-by-Step Instructions")

##### Signing Up for the Partner Portal[‚Äã](#signing-up-for-the-partner-portal "Direct link to Signing Up for the Partner Portal")

1. After signing a distribution agreement, you will receive an email invitation to join the Partner Portal.

2. Click the **Sign Up** link in the email.

3. Review and agree to the **Terms and Conditions**.

4. You will see a sign-up screen with your email pre-filled.

5. Ensure you use a long-term email address, as it cannot be changed later.

6. Complete the sign-up process to gain access to the portal.

##### Using the Partner Portal[‚Äã](#using-the-partner-portal "Direct link to Using the Partner Portal")

Once signed in, you can:

* Create new sites for customers.

* Assign and distribute credits to those sites.

#### Common Issues & Considerations[‚Äã](#common-issues-considerations "Direct link to Common Issues & Considerations")

* The Partner Portal is exclusively for authorized resellers and is not accessible to site administrators or end users.

* If you do not receive the email invitation, check your spam folder or contact your Partner Portal administrator.

* Ensure the email used for registration is the correct one, as changes cannot be made after sign-up.


---

### IP Camera Support and Configuration

#### Overview[‚Äã](#overview "Direct link to Overview")

BioStar Air can automatically detect IP cameras that are connected to the same network as an Airfob Edge Reader. The cameras use the reader as a gateway, eliminating the need for an NVR (Network Video Recorder). Instead, the cameras utilize the built-in SD card storage.

For each Airfob Edge Reader or XPass 2 installed, BioStar Air can show simultaneous live view streams for:

* Up to 2 cameras at Full HD resolution (1080p)

* Up to 4 cameras at HD resolution (720p)

These numbers double when using the XStation 2

#### Compatibility[‚Äã](#compatibility "Direct link to Compatibility")

* **Onvif Profiles**: IP cameras must be compatible with Onvif profiles S and/or G.

  * **Onvif Profile S**: Streaming Live Video

  * **Onvif Profile G**: Record Video to an SD Card

* **SD Card**: IP cameras should have an on-board SD card to record video for later playback. (We recommend SanDisk microSDXC Class10 Max Endurance 256GB or 512GB)

* **Encoding**: Cameras must support H.264 (AVC) and it must be enabled as the active CODEC. Airfob Space does not currently support H.265.

* **Recommended Brands**: We have excellent compatibility with Hanwha, Hikvision, and Dahua cameras. Compatibility with other brands may vary depending on their adherence to Onvif profiles.

* **Testing New Cameras**: If you have other camera brands that you would like to test, our team can assist you through the process.

#### Functionality[‚Äã](#functionality "Direct link to Functionality")

In the BioStar Air app, you can:

* View live camera feeds.

* View recorded camera feeds.

* Access camera footage associated with access events.

#### Instructions[‚Äã](#instructions "Direct link to Instructions")

##### Connect the IP Camera[‚Äã](#connect-the-ip-camera "Direct link to Connect the IP Camera")

* **Network Connection**: Ensure that your IP camera is connected to the same network as an Airfob Edge Reader or Airfob Edge Reader Ultimate.

* **Enable Onvif**: Ensure that Onvif is enabled on your cameras.

* **Reader Registration**: Verify that the reader is registered to a site.

##### Log into BioStar Air[‚Äã](#log-into-biostar-air "Direct link to Log into BioStar Air")

Only **Master Administrators** can make changes to site settings, such as enabling Video Management. Make sure that you log in with Master privileges.

##### Enable Video Management[‚Äã](#enable-video-management "Direct link to Enable Video Management")

Navigate to **Settings** ‚Üí **Site** ‚Üí **Additional features** ‚Üí **Video Management** to turn on Video Management. (This can only be enabled by a Master level administrator.)

##### Add Cameras[‚Äã](#add-cameras "Direct link to Add Cameras")

* Go to **Device Management** ‚Üí **Cameras** ‚Üí **+ Add Camera**.

* **Select Device (Reader)**: Select the reader that will act as a gateway. The reader should be running firmware version 2.5.1 or later and be on the same network as the camera.

* **Automatic Search**: BioStar Air will automatically search for cameras on your network.

* **Camera Registration**: You may need to input an ID and password to register a camera.

##### Associate Cameras with Doors[‚Äã](#associate-cameras-with-doors "Direct link to Associate Cameras with Doors")

* Go to **Door Management** ‚Üí **Registered Doors**.

* **Assign Devices**: Select a door, then in the Assign Devices section, select a camera. This links the camera to a door, allowing you to view relevant footage in event logs.

##### View Live Camera Footage[‚Äã](#view-live-camera-footage "Direct link to View Live Camera Footage")

* Go to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Real-Time Video** to watch live video streams.

* **Simultaneous Streams**: You can view up to 2 live Full HD (1080p) streams for each Airfob Edge Reader installed.

* **Additional Streams**: To view more live streams, add more readers or reduce the camera resolution (**Device Management** ‚Üí **Cameras** ‚Üí Click on a Camera ‚Üí **Profile**).

##### View Recorded Camera Footage[‚Äã](#view-recorded-camera-footage "Direct link to View Recorded Camera Footage")

Go to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Recorded Video** to watch recorded video streams.

##### View Event Footage[‚Äã](#view-event-footage "Direct link to View Event Footage")

Go to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Event Logs**. Find an event log with an associated video clip and click the play button to view it.

##### Explore Additional Settings[‚Äã](#explore-additional-settings "Direct link to Explore Additional Settings")

There are many other settings available for you to explore within the app. This guide is an interim reference until the official instruction manual is published.

#### Tested & Confirmed Devices[‚Äã](#tested--confirmed-devices "Direct link to Tested & Confirmed Devices")

| No | Manufacturer   | Model No.               | Device Type | Onvif Profiles | Resolution |
| -- | -------------- | ----------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------- |
| 1  | Hanwha Techwin | QNV-C8011R              | Camera      | S, G, T, M     | 2592x1944  |
| 2  | Hanwha Techwin | QND-6022R               | Camera      | S, G, T        | 1920x1080  |
| 3  | Hanwha Techwin | MMI-600R                | Camera      | S, T           | 1920x1080  |
| 4  | HIKVISION      | DS-2CD2025FWD-I         | Camera      | S, G, T        | 1920x1080  |
| 5  | HIKVISION      | DS-2CD2166G2-I          | Camera      | S, G, T        | 3200√ó1800  |
| 6  | HIKVISION      | DS-2CD1121-I            | Camera      | S              | 1920x1080  |
| 7  | Dahua          | DHI-NVR2104HS-P-S3      | NVR         | S, G, T        | 12MP       |
| 8  | Dahua          | IPC-HDBW3249E-AS-NI     | Camera      | S, G, T        | 1920√ó1080  |
| 9  | Dahua          | SD22204UEN-GN           | Camera      | S, G, T        | 1920√ó1080  |
| 10 | Dahua          | DH-IPC-HFW1230DT-STW-VN | Camera      | S, T           | 1920√ó1080  |
| 11 | Marruy         | IPC-A32E-L              | Camera      | S, T           | 2304√ó1296  |
| 12 | TP-Link        | Tapo C210               | Camera      | S              | 2304√ó1296  |

#### General Steps to Enable ONVIF on IP Cameras[‚Äã](#general-steps-to-enable-onvif-on-ip-cameras "Direct link to General Steps to Enable ONVIF on IP Cameras")

1. **Log into the Camera's Web Interface**: Open a web browser, enter the camera‚Äôs IP address, and log in with admin credentials.

2. **Navigate to Network or Configuration Settings**: Find the **Network** or **Configuration** section.

3. **Enable ONVIF Protocol**: Enable ONVIF or Open Network Video Interface.

4. **Set up an ONVIF Profile or User**: Create an ONVIF-specific user profile if required.

5. **Save and Test Connectivity**: Save the settings and test ONVIF connection in Airfob Space.

#### Additional Tips[‚Äã](#additional-tips "Direct link to Additional Tips")

* **Firmware Updates**: Keep your camera and readers updated to the latest firmware.

* **Port Forwarding**: Configure port forwarding for ONVIF if needed.

* **Third-Party Tools**: Use ONVIF Device Manager to verify camera settings and functionality.


---

### LinkPass Credentials

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

LinkPass is an app-free mobile credential available in BioStar Air. It allows administrators to grant door access to users without requiring any app installation or use of BLE/NFC.
