LinkPass works entirely through the BioStar Air cloud and is activated via a secure web link, making it ideal for guest access, deliveries, or low-security entry points such as parking gates and lobbies.

#### Navigating to the Feature[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-feature "Direct link to Navigating to the Feature")

To issue a LinkPass credential:

* Log in to the **BioStar Air Admin Portal**

* Navigate to **Users**

* Create a new user or edit an existing user

* Scroll down to the **Card Detail** section

* Enable **Web Card**

* Check the box next to **LinkPass**

#### Step-by-Step Instructions[‚Äã](#step-by-step-instructions "Direct link to Step-by-Step Instructions")

1. Sign in to the **BioStar Air Admin Portal**.

2. Go to the **Users** tab and select an existing user or click **+ Add User** to create a new one.

3. In the user detail view, scroll to the **Card Detail** section.

4. Enable the **Web Card** option.

5. Check the box next to **LinkPass**.

6. Assign a valid **email address or phone number** to the user to ensure they receive the credential link.

7. Assign appropriate **access levels** and set the **validity period** for the user.

8. Click **Save** to issue the credential.

9. The user will receive an invitation via email or SMS with a unique LinkPass URL.

#### How Users Use LinkPass[‚Äã](#how-users-use-linkpass "Direct link to How Users Use LinkPass")

1. The user opens the LinkPass URL from the message they received.

2. A webpage displays all doors assigned to them, each with an **Open** button.

3. Clicking **Open** sends a cloud-based unlock command to the reader‚Äîno BLE or NFC is needed.

#### Common Issues & Considerations[‚Äã](#common-issues-and-considerations "Direct link to Common Issues & Considerations")

* **Credential Scope**: LinkPass credentials allow access to the same doors as any other credential assigned to the user. For this reason, **do not issue LinkPass credentials to users with access to secure areas**.

* **No App Required**: LinkPass operates via a web browser‚Äîno mobile app, Bluetooth, or NFC is required.

* **Cloud-Based Access**: LinkPass commands are transmitted through the BioStar Air cloud and can be activated from anywhere with internet access. There is no geofencing.

* **Reader Connectivity**: Door readers must be online and connected to BioStar Air for LinkPass to function correctly.

* **Use Case Recommendation**: LinkPass is best suited for temporary visitors, deliveries, and low-security areas like lobbies or parking gates.


---

### Why Do I Need to Enable Location Services?

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The Suprema Pass app requires location services to function correctly with your smartphone‚Äôs mobile access card. This ensures secure Bluetooth communication between your phone and the access control device.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

<!-- -->

Q.Why Am I Being Asked to Enable Location Services?

The Suprema Pass app communicates with access control devices using Bluetooth. On Android devices, enabling location services is required by the operating system for Bluetooth functionality. On iOS, location permissions are necessary for using the app in background mode.

Q.Does the Airfob App Store My Location Data?

**No**. The Suprema Pass app does not track or store GPS-based location data, nor does it share this data with third parties.While the app uses Bluetooth location services for authentication, access logs are only recorded in the site administrator portal. The Suprema Pass app, Suprema, and MOCA System do not store or use any personal location data.

Q.Will Enabling Location Services Drain My Phone's Battery?

**No**. Unlike other apps that use GPS, the Suprema Pass app does not rely on GPS location services, so it does not increase battery consumption.

Q.Am I Required to Enable Location Services to Use the Suprema Pass?

* **Android users**: Yes, location services must be enabled due to Android‚Äôs Bluetooth policy.
* **iOS users**: Required only for background mode. If using the "Only while app on screen" mode, location permissions are not needed.

Q.Location Permission Requirements by Connection Method:

* **Only while app on screen**: Location permission can be set to "Allow only while using the app." (Not required on iOS.)
* **Background mode (Always)**: Location permission must be set to "Always allow."
* **NFC Mode**: Android users must agree to location permissions.

Q.Why Does My Phone Randomly Ask Me to Agree to Location Services?

1. If you select "Don't Allow" or "Allow Once," your phone may continue prompting you to enable location services. This is controlled by iOS or Android, not by the Suprema Pass app.
2. For iOS users, even if "Always Allow" is selected, Apple may still display periodic confirmation messages as part of its security policies. Please continue to click "Always Allow" or mobile credentials may not work consistently. Features like Background Mode and Long Press may be disabled randomly.


---

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/air/bsair-access-mng-ac-level.png)

3. Access Level Ìå®ÎÑêÏù¥ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇòÎ©¥ Name Î∞è Description(ÏÑ†ÌÉù ÏÇ¨Ìï≠)ÏùÑ ÏûÖÎ†•ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

   ![](/docs/en/img/en/air/bsair-access-mng-ac-level-add.png)

4. Add Door Groups ÎòêÎäî Add Individual Doors ÏÑπÏÖòÏóêÏÑú Ï∂úÏûÖÎ¨∏ Í∑∏Î£π ÎòêÎäî Í∞úÎ≥Ñ Ï∂úÏûÖÎ¨∏ÏùÑ ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

5. Schedule ÏÑπÏÖòÏóêÏÑú Ï∂úÏûÖ Î†àÎ≤®Ïóê Ï†ÅÏö©Ìï† Ïä§ÏºÄÏ§ÑÏùÑ ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî. Ï†úÌïú ÏóÜÎäî Ï∂úÏûÖÏùÑ ÌóàÏö©ÌïòÎ†§Î©¥ AlwaysÎ•º ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

6. Ï∂úÏûÖ Î†àÎ≤®ÏùÑ Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÌïòÎ†§Î©¥ Save Î≤ÑÌäºÏùÑ ÌÅ¥Î¶≠ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

Info

Ï∂úÏûÖ Î†àÎ≤® Í¥ÄÎ¶¨Ïóê ÎåÄÌïú ÏûêÏÑ∏Ìïú ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÄ [Îã§Ïùå Î¨∏ÏÑú](/docs/en/platform/biostar_air/manage-access-level)Î•º Ï∞∏Í≥†ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

Info

* **Intrusion Alarm Zone**: A zone set to emit a warning sound or relay signal if an unauthorized person attempts an intrusion after Arm. This zone normally begins monitoring after the day's work, and emits a preset alarm or signal when an intrusion attempt is detected.

* Í≤ΩÎπÑ Íµ¨Ïó≠ Í¥ÄÎ¶¨ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÄ ÏÑ§Ï†ïÌïú Ïñ∏Ïñ¥Ïóê Îî∞Îùº ÏßÄÏõêÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÏùÑ Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.

Îëê Ïï± Î™®Îëê ÎèôÏùºÌïú Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ï†úÍ≥µÌïòÎ©∞ ÏôÑÎ≤ΩÌïòÍ≤å Ìò∏ÌôòÎê©ÎãàÎã§. Í∏∞Ï°¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÎäî Ï†ÑÌôòÌï† ÌïÑÏöîÍ∞Ä ÏóÜÏúºÎ©∞, Î™®Î∞îÏùº Ïù∏Ï¶ù Ï†ïÎ≥¥Í∞Ä Îëê Ïï± Î™®ÎëêÏóêÏÑú ÏõêÌôúÌïòÍ≤å ÏûëÎèôÌï©ÎãàÎã§.

##### Basic setup

Í≤ΩÎπÑ Íµ¨Ïó≠Ïùò Í∏∞Î≥∏ ÏÑ§Ï†ïÏùÑ Íµ¨ÏÑ±Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.

![](/docs/en/img/air/bsair-zone-alarm-add-basic-config.png)

* Activate Intrusion Zone: Í≤ΩÎπÑ Íµ¨Ïó≠ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ ÌôúÏÑ±ÌôîÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò ÎπÑÌôúÏÑ±ÌôîÌï©ÎãàÎã§.

* Zone Name: Í≤ΩÎπÑ Íµ¨Ïó≠Ïùò Ïù¥Î¶ÑÏùÑ ÏûÖÎ†•Ìï©ÎãàÎã§.

* Door: Í≤ΩÎπÑ Íµ¨Ïó≠ÏúºÎ°ú ÏÑ§Ï†ïÌï† Ï∂úÏûÖÎ¨∏ÏùÑ ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî. Ìï¥Îãπ Ï∂úÏûÖÎ¨∏Ïùò ÏÑºÏÑúÎäî Ïπ®ÏûÖ Í∞êÏßÄÏóê ÏÇ¨Ïö©Îê©ÎãàÎã§.

Info

Ï∂úÏûÖ Î†àÎ≤® Í¥ÄÎ¶¨Ïóê ÎåÄÌïú ÏûêÏÑ∏Ìïú ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÄ [Îã§Ïùå Î¨∏ÏÑú](/docs/en/platform/biostar_air/manage-access-level)Î•º Ï∞∏Í≥†ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

##### Arm and Disarm Method[‚Äã](#-1 "Direct link to -1")

Í≤ΩÎπÑ ÏãúÏûë Î∞è Ìï¥Ï†ú Î∞©ÏãùÏùÑ ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî. Ïπ¥Îìú ÎòêÎäî Ïû•Ïπò, Ïô∏Î∂Ä ÏûÖÎ†• Î∞©ÏãùÏùÑ ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.

* Card: Í≤ΩÎπÑÎ•º ÏãúÏûëÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò Ìï¥Ï†úÌï† Îïå ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† Ïπ¥ÎìúÎ•º Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò ÏÑ§Ï†ïÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Add Î≤ÑÌäºÏùÑ ÌÅ¥Î¶≠ÌïòÍ≥† Ïπ¥ÎìúÎ•º Îì±Î°ùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

* Devices: Í≤ΩÎπÑÎ•º ÏãúÏûëÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò Ìï¥Ï†úÌï† Îïå ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† Ïû•ÏπòÎ•º Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò ÏÑ§Ï†ïÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Add Î≤ÑÌäºÏùÑ ÌÅ¥Î¶≠ÌïòÍ≥†, Arm TypeÎ•º ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî. Input TypeÏóêÏÑú ÏõêÌïòÎäî Ïù∏Ï¶ù Î∞©ÏãùÏùÑ ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

  ![](/docs/en/img/air/bsair-zone-alarm-add-method-device.png)

  LCD ÌôîÎ©¥Ïù¥ ÏóÜÎäî Ïû•ÏπòÎäî ÏûÖÎ†• Ï¢ÖÎ•òÎ•º Ïπ¥ÎìúÎßå ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.

* Input: ÏûÖÎ†• Ïã†Ìò∏Î•º ÌÜµÌï¥ÏÑú Í≤ΩÎπÑÎ•º ÏãúÏûëÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò Ìï¥Ï†úÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Add Î≤ÑÌäºÏùÑ ÌÅ¥Î¶≠ÌïòÍ≥†, Í≤ΩÎπÑ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ï†úÏñ¥Ìï† Ïû•ÏπòÎ•º ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî. ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌïú Ïû•ÏπòÏùò ÏûÖÎ†• Ìè¨Ìä∏ Î∞è Ïä§ÏúÑÏπò Ï¢ÖÎ•ò(N/O, N/C)ÏôÄ Ïã†Ìò∏Ïùò ÏßÄÏÜç ÏãúÍ∞ÑÏùÑ ÏÑ§Ï†ïÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

  ![](/docs/en/img/air/bsair-zone-alarm-add-method-input.png)

##### Intrusion Detection Method[‚Äã](#-2 "Direct link to -2")

Ïπ®ÏûÖ Í∞êÏßÄ Ïã†Ìò∏Î•º ÏÑ§Ï†ïÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Add Î≤ÑÌäºÏùÑ ÌÅ¥Î¶≠ÌïòÍ≥† Ïô∏Î∂Ä ÏûÖÎ†• ÏÑ§Ï†ïÏùÑ Íµ¨ÏÑ±ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

![](/docs/en/img/air/bsair-zone-alarm-add-method-detect.png)

ÏòàÎ•º Îì§Ïñ¥, **BioStation 3** Ïû•ÏπòÏùò **0**Î≤à ÏûÖÎ†• Ìè¨Ìä∏Ïóê Ïó∞Í≤∞Îêú **N/O** ÏÑºÏÑúÍ∞Ä **100**ms ÎèôÏïà Ïã†Ìò∏Î•º Î≥¥ÎÇ∏Îã§Î©¥ Ïπ®ÏûÖÏúºÎ°ú Í∞êÏßÄÎê©ÎãàÎã§.

##### Alarm Action[‚Äã](#-3 "Direct link to -3")

Ïû•Ïπò Ïã†Ìò∏ÎÇò Í≤ΩÍ≥†ÏùåÏóê Îî∞Îùº ÌäπÏ†ï Ïù¥Î≤§Ìä∏Í∞Ä Î∞úÏÉùÌñàÏùÑ Îïå ÏàòÌñâÌï† ÎèôÏûëÏùÑ Íµ¨ÏÑ±ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

![](/docs/en/img/air/bsair-zone-alarm-add-set-alarm.png)

2025ÎÖÑ 5Ïõî Ïù¥Ï†ÑÏóê BioStar Air Ï∂úÏûÖ ÌÜµÏ†ú ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§Î•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÍ∏∞ ÏãúÏûëÌïú Í≥†Í∞ùÏùÄ ÌòÑÏû¨ Suprema Pass Ïï±ÏúºÎ°ú ÏÉàÎ°ú ÏÑ§Í≥ÑÎêú Airfob Space Ïï±ÏùÑ Í≥ÑÏÜç ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Îëê Ïï± Î™®Îëê ÎèôÏùºÌïú Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ï†úÍ≥µÌïòÎ©∞ ÏôÑÎ≤ΩÌïòÍ≤å Ìò∏ÌôòÎê©ÎãàÎã§. Í∏∞Ï°¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÎäî Ï†ÑÌôòÌï† ÌïÑÏöîÍ∞Ä ÏóÜÏúºÎ©∞, Î™®Î∞îÏùº Ïù∏Ï¶ù Ï†ïÎ≥¥Í∞Ä Îëê Ïï± Î™®ÎëêÏóêÏÑú ÏõêÌôúÌïòÍ≤å ÏûëÎèôÌï©ÎãàÎã§.

3. Edit Floor Level Ìå®ÎÑêÏù¥ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇòÎ©¥ ÌïÑÏöîÌïú Ï†ïÎ≥¥Î•º ÏàòÏ†ïÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò ÏÑ§Ï†ïÏùÑ Î≥ÄÍ≤ΩÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî.

---

### Managing and Adding Users in the BioStar Air App

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The BioStar Air app allows administrators to manage users, edit their details, and assign credentials directly from a mobile device.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Accessing User Management[‚Äã](#accessing-user-management "Direct link to Accessing User Management")

To manage users in the BioStar Air app:

1. Open the **BioStar Air** app.

2. Select the **User Menu** from the bottom navigation bar.

3. View the list of existing users.

#### Editing User Information[‚Äã](#editing-user-information "Direct link to Editing User Information")

To modify an existing user‚Äôs details:

1. Tap on a user from the list.

2. View user details and available actions:

   * **Activate**: Enable a user‚Äôs access.

   * **Reissue**: Send a new credential.

   * **Suspend**: Temporarily disable the user.

   * **Delete**: Remove the user from the system.

3. To edit user details, tap the **Pencil Icon** at the top.

4. Modify the user‚Äôs information as needed.

5. Tap **Save** to confirm changes or **Activate Card** if assigning a credential.

#### Filtering Users[‚Äã](#filtering-users "Direct link to Filtering Users")

Users can be filtered based on:

* **User Type**

* **Card Type**

* **Status**

* **User Group**

#### Performing Batch Actions[‚Äã](#performing-batch-actions "Direct link to Performing Batch Actions")

To select multiple users:

1. Hold your finger on a user‚Äôs image.

2. Select additional users.

3. Perform bulk actions such as activation, suspension, or deletion.

#### Adding a New User[‚Äã](#adding-a-new-user "Direct link to Adding a New User")

To add a new user:

1. Press the **Plus (+) button** at the top of the user screen.

2. Enter the required user details.

3. Provide a unique **email** or **phone number** for the invitation.

4. Select the card type:

   * **Mobile Card**

   * **RF Card**

   * **Web Card**

   * **Face**

   * **PIN**

5. Tap **Save** to delay issuing the card or **Activate Card** to issue it immediately.

#### Managing User Groups[‚Äã](#managing-user-groups "Direct link to Managing User Groups")

To manage user groups:

1. Tap on **Group** to view all available user groups.

2. Select a group to see a filtered list of users within that group.


---

### Managing Administrators

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The Admins feature in BioStar Air allows you to manage administrator accounts, assign roles, and control access levels within your organization. This ensures that the right personnel have the appropriate permissions while maintaining security and administrative control.

#### Navigating to the Admins Section[‚Äã](#navigating-to-admins-section "Direct link to Navigating to the Admins Section")

1. Click on **Settings** in the left-hand menu.

2. Select **Admins** from the available options.

#### Managing Administrators[‚Äã](#managing-administrators "Direct link to Managing Administrators")

##### Viewing Administrators[‚Äã](#viewing-administrators "Direct link to Viewing Administrators")

In the Admins menu, you will see a list of all active administrators, including:

* Name

* Email Address

* Admin Level

* Account Status (Active/Deactivated)

##### Deactivating an Administrator[‚Äã](#deactivating-an-administrator "Direct link to Deactivating an Administrator")

Instead of deleting an administrator, you can deactivate their account, which allows for future reactivation.

1. Locate the administrator in the list.

2. Click the deactivate option.

3. Confirm the deactivation.

##### Changing an Administrator‚Äôs Role[‚Äã](#changing-an-administrators-role "Direct link to Changing an Administrator‚Äôs Role")

If you have a higher admin level than the user, you can change their role:

1. Select the administrator from the list.

2. Choose the new admin level.

3. Confirm the update.

Only Master Administrators can assign or modify another Master Administrator.

##### Inviting a New Administrator[‚Äã](#inviting-a-new-administrator "Direct link to Inviting a New Administrator")

To add a new administrator:

1. Click the **Invite Administrator** button.

2. Enter their email address.

3. Select the admin role.

4. Send the invitation.

Each administrator must have a unique email address. If needed, alias addresses (e.g., <erik+training@example.com>) can be used.

#### Administrator Levels[‚Äã](#administrator-levels "Direct link to Administrator Levels")

Each administrator level in BioStar Air has specific permissions, with higher levels inheriting the permissions of lower levels.

##### 1. Observer (Lowest Level)[‚Äã](#observer "Direct link to 1. Observer (Lowest Level)")

* Can **view** logs and the dashboard.

* Can **export** logs and generate reports.

* **No ability** to modify settings, users, or devices.

* Restricted menu access; many sections will not appear in the interface.

##### 2. Operator[‚Äã](#operator "Direct link to 2. Operator")

* Can manage **Users**, **Access Levels**, **User Groups**, **Schedules**, and **Holiday Groups**.

* **No access** to device control or administrative settings.

* Suitable for managing everyday user and access configurations.

##### 3. Administrator[‚Äã](#administrator "Direct link to 3. Administrator")

* Can **invite new administrators** (but **cannot** assign Master Administrator roles).

* Has **full device control**, allowing modifications to settings and management of connected devices.

* Cannot delete or modify **Master Administrators**.

* Typically used for IT personnel responsible for system management.

##### 4. Master (Highest Level)[‚Äã](#master "Direct link to 4. Master (Highest Level)")

* Has **full access** to all settings and features.

* **Cannot be deleted or modified** by Administrators.

* Can **create sub-sites** to manage different locations or organizations.

* Can configure **site settings**, including critical system-wide configurations.

* Responsible for accepting **terms and conditions** before other admins can log in.

* Typically assigned to company owners or high-trust executives.

#### Admin Access Overview[‚Äã](#admin-access-overview "Direct link to Admin Access Overview")

Each admin level has different permissions across BioStar Air. Observers have the most limited access, with restricted menus that do not appear in their interface.


---

### Managing Card Templates

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

Card templates in BioStar Air allow administrators to design and customize mobile cards for users. These templates help reinforce branding by including company colors, logos, and personalized details.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to Card Templates[‚Äã](#navigating-to-card-templates "Direct link to Navigating to Card Templates")

To manage card templates:

1. Go to **User Management** in the BioStar Air Portal.

2. Click on **Card Templates** to view the available options.

#### Using Default Card Templates[‚Äã](#using-default-card-templates "Direct link to Using Default Card Templates")

Every BioStar Air site includes a set of default templates. These can be:

* **Customized** by clicking on an existing template and modifying its parameters.

* **Replaced** by creating a new custom template.

#### Creating a New Card Template[‚Äã](#creating-a-new-card-template "Direct link to Creating a New Card Template")

To create a new card template:

1. Click on **Add New Template**.

2. Upload a background image by clicking **Upload** and selecting a file.

3. Adjust the image size by clicking **Fit this image** or resizing it manually.

4. Choose between **Dark Mode** or **Light Mode** for card preview.

#### Customizing Card Properties[‚Äã](#customizing-card-properties "Direct link to Customizing Card Properties")

After setting the background, customize the card by enabling different properties:

* **Site Name**

* **User Image**

* **User Name**

* **Title**

To modify a property:

1. Click on the property and drag it to the preferred position.

2. Resize the field as needed.

3. Adjust font size, color, and style for better visibility.

Tip

To center a property, drag its pin corners to the edges of the card.

#### Saving and Managing Card Templates[‚Äã](#saving-and-managing-card-templates "Direct link to Saving and Managing Card Templates")

Once satisfied with the template design:

1. Click **Save** to store the template.

2. To modify an existing template, click on it and adjust its settings.

3. To delete a template, select it and click **Delete**.

4. To set a template as the default for all users, click **Set as Default**.

#### Applying Card Templates to Users[‚Äã](#applying-card-templates-to-users "Direct link to Applying Card Templates to Users")

To apply a new card template to a user:

1. Go to **User Management** and select **Users**.

2. Choose a user and click **Edit**.

3. Select a new card template from the dropdown menu.

4. Click **Save** to apply the changes.

For bulk updates, a card template can be applied to all users, which is useful during a company rebranding.


---

### Managing Door Access

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

Access management in BioStar Air allows administrators to define and enforce access rules based on location, time, and user roles. This system is built around **access levels**, which combine doors, schedules, and holiday groups to control user permissions.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Understanding Access Levels[‚Äã](#understanding-access-levels "Direct link to Understanding Access Levels")

Access levels define who has access, where, and when. They are composed of:

* **Doors/Door Groups**: Where access is granted.

* **Schedules**: When access is allowed.

* **Holiday Groups**: Days when access is restricted or adjusted.

Access levels should be set up before adding users to streamline the user management process.

#### Setting Up Holiday Groups[‚Äã](#setting-up-holiday-groups "Direct link to Setting Up Holiday Groups")

Holiday groups define dates when access may be restricted.

1. Go to **Access Management** ‚Üí **Holiday Groups**.

2. Click **Add Holiday Group**.

3. Enter a name and configure holidays:

   * Fixed Date: Select a calendar date (e.g., January 1st for New Year's Day).

   * Recurring: Define flexible dates (e.g., third Monday in February).

   * Custom Range: Set a start and end time for multi-day holidays.

4. Click **Save** to finalize.

Info

Holiday groups override schedules. Assign unrestricted access to users who must always have entry.

#### Creating Schedules[‚Äã](#creating-schedules "Direct link to Creating Schedules")

Schedules define when users can access doors.

1. Go to **Access Management** ‚Üí **Schedules**.

2. Click **Add Schedule**.

3. Enter a **Name** and optional description.

4. Select operational hours (e.g., 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM) or choose **All Day**.

5. Assign a **Holiday Group** if access should be restricted on holidays.

6. Click **Save** to apply.

Info

Holiday groups override schedules. Ensure critical personnel have full access if needed.

#### Creating Access Levels[‚Äã](#creating-access-levels "Direct link to Creating Access Levels")

Access levels define user permissions based on doors, schedules, and holidays.

1. Go to **Access Management** ‚Üí **Access Levels**.

2. Click **Add Access Level**.

3. Enter a **Name** and optional description.

4. Select **Doors or Door Groups** for access control.

5. Assign a **Schedule** (or set to "Always" for unrestricted access).

6. Click **Save** to finalize.

#### Modifying and Deleting Access Levels[‚Äã](#modifying-and-deleting-access-levels "Direct link to Modifying and Deleting Access Levels")

To modify an existing access level:

* Select the access level and click **Edit**.

* Update door assignments, schedules, or holiday groups.

* Click **Save** to apply changes.

To delete an access level:

* Select the access level and click **Delete**.

#### Assigning Access Levels to Users[‚Äã](#assigning-access-levels-to-users "Direct link to Assigning Access Levels to Users")

To assign an access level to existing users:

1. Go to **User Management** ‚Üí **Users**.

2. Select one or more users.

3. Click **Set Access**.

4. Choose the appropriate access level.

5. Click **Done** to confirm.

#### Assigning Access Levels to New Users[‚Äã](#assigning-access-levels-to-new-users "Direct link to Assigning Access Levels to New Users")

When adding a new user, you can assign an access level directly:

When adding a new user:

1. Go to **User Management** ‚Üí **Users** ‚Üí **Add User**.

2. Fill in user details.

3. Click **Access Level** and select the appropriate access level.

4. Click **Save** or **Activate Card** to finalize.


---

### Managing Door & Device Groups

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

Door groups and device groups in BioStar Air provide a structured way to organize site devices and access points. Grouping devices and doors simplifies access level configuration and system management.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to Device Groups[‚Äã](#navigating-to-device-groups "Direct link to Navigating to Device Groups")

To manage device groups:

1. Go to **Device Management** in the BioStar Air Portal.

2. Click on **Device Groups** to view the existing groups.

#### Creating a Device Group[‚Äã](#creating-a-device-group "Direct link to Creating a Device Group")

To create a new device group:

1. Click on **Add Device Group**.

2. Enter a group name (e.g., "Patches").

3. Select the devices to be included in this group.

4. Click **OK** to save.

#### Creating a Subgroup[‚Äã](#creating-a-subgroup "Direct link to Creating a Subgroup")

Device groups can have subgroups for further organization. However, groups are **not hierarchical**, meaning devices in a subgroup are not automatically included in the parent group.

1. Click **Subgroup** under Device Groups.

2. Select a parent group (e.g., "Readers").

3. Enter a subgroup name (e.g., "BioStar Air Readers").

4. Select the devices to be included.

5. Click **OK** to save.

#### Assigning Devices to Multiple Groups[‚Äã](#assigning-devices-to-multiple-groups "Direct link to Assigning Devices to Multiple Groups")

Devices can belong to more than one group. To add devices to additional groups:

1. Go to **Registered Devices**.

2. Select the devices you want to assign.

3. Click **Manage Groups**.

4. Choose additional groups and confirm.

Assigned groups will be displayed in the device list.

#### Navigating to Door Groups[‚Äã](#navigating-to-door-groups "Direct link to Navigating to Door Groups")

To manage door groups:

1. Go to **Door Management** in the BioStar Air Portal.

2. Click on **Door Groups** to view the existing groups.

#### Creating a Door Group[‚Äã](#creating-a-door-group "Direct link to Creating a Door Group")

To create a new door group:

1. Click **Add Door Group**.

2. Enter a group name (e.g., "Interior Doors").

3. Select the doors to be included.

4. Click **OK** to save.

#### Creating a Door Group Subgroup[‚Äã](#creating-a-door-group-subgroup "Direct link to Creating a Door Group Subgroup")

Door groups can have subgroups, but like device groups, they are **not hierarchical**. Adding a door to a subgroup does not automatically include it in the parent group.

1. Click **Add Subgroup** under Door Groups.

2. Select a parent group (e.g., "Interior Doors").

3. Enter a subgroup name (e.g., "Trap Doors").

4. Select the doors to be included.

5. Click **OK** to save.

#### Key Considerations[‚Äã](#key-considerations "Direct link to Key Considerations")

##### Device & Door Group Hierarchy[‚Äã](#device-and-door-group-hierarchy "Direct link to Device & Door Group Hierarchy")

* Adding a door or device to a subgroup does not automatically add it to the parent group.

* If assigning groups to access levels, ensure that you add the **specific subgroup** needed rather than just the parent group.

##### Group Organization[‚Äã](#group-organization "Direct link to Group Organization")

* It is possible to create empty parent groups without any devices or doors.

* Filtering options allow viewing devices and doors by group.

#### Can one device belong to multiple device groups?[‚Äã](#can-one-device-belong-to-multiple-device-groups "Direct link to Can one device belong to multiple device groups?")

**Yes**. In BioStar Air, a single device can be assigned to **multiple device groups** without limitation.

This differs from BioStar 2, where device grouping was more rigid. In BioStar Air, flexible grouping enables better filtering, monitoring, and access control configurations:

* Use logical groupings like "Exterior Devices" or "Biometric Readers" to organize devices by location or type.

* Device groups can be used to **filter Event Logs**, **create Reports**, or **filter the Devices screen** for easier troubleshooting or reporting.

* For **muster point** configuration, devices (not doors) are assigned. Using device groups helps ensure users are marked safe **only** when they use designated exit readers.


---

### Managing Door Schedules

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

Door schedules in BioStar Air allow administrators to automate door locking and unlocking based on time settings. These schedules ensure secure and controlled access throughout the day. Administrators can configure lock schedules, unlock schedules, and advanced options like "Unlock after First Authentication."

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to Door Schedules[‚Äã](#navigating-to-door-schedules "Direct link to Navigating to Door Schedules")

To access door schedules:

1. Go to **Door Management** ‚Üí **Registered Doors**.

2. Select the doors you want to configure by clicking the checkbox next to each.

3. Click the **Schedule Icon** (calendar with a checkmark) in the toolbar.

#### Configuring Unlock Schedules[‚Äã](#configuring-unlock-schedules "Direct link to Configuring Unlock Schedules")

Unlock schedules determine when doors remain open without authentication.

1. In the **Unlock Schedule** tab, select a predefined schedule or create a new one.

2. To create a new schedule:

   * Click **Create Schedule**.

   * Enter a **Name** and optional description.

   * Select the days and times when the door should remain unlocked.

   * Click **Save**.

3. Click **Apply** to confirm the unlock schedule.

##### Unlock After First Authentication[‚Äã](#unlock-after-first-authentication "Direct link to Unlock After First Authentication")

This setting keeps the door locked until the first authorized user authenticates. Once unlocked, the door remains open for the rest of the scheduled period.

1. In the **Unlock Schedule** tab, enable **Unlock After First Authentication**.

2. Select a schedule defining when the door should remain open after authentication.

3. Click **Save** to apply the changes.

**Use Case**

This feature is ideal for offices and retail stores where the door should remain locked until the first employee arrives.

#### Configuring Lock Schedules[‚Äã](#configuring-lock-schedules "Direct link to Configuring Lock Schedules")

Lock schedules determine when doors remain locked, preventing access even with valid credentials.

1. In the **Lock Schedule** tab, select an existing schedule or create a new one.

2. To create a new schedule:

   * Click **Create Schedule**.

   * Enter a **Name** and optional description.

   * Select the days and times when the door should remain locked.

   * Click **Save**.

3. Click **Apply** to confirm the lock schedule.

Lock schedules override standard access rights, meaning users cannot unlock the door during the locked period.

#### Creating Schedules Directly from Door Management[‚Äã](#creating-schedules-directly-from-door-management "Direct link to Creating Schedules Directly from Door Management")

If no appropriate schedule exists, administrators can create one directly from the door schedule interface:

1. Click **Create Schedule** in the schedule selection menu.

2. Enter a schedule **Name** and description.

3. Select operating days and times.

4. Click **Save** to add the new schedule.

The new schedule will now be available for selection.

#### Key Considerations[‚Äã](#key-considerations "Direct link to Key Considerations")

* Schedules apply only to doors with an active **internet connection**.

* Holiday groups override unlock schedules unless configured otherwise.

* For emergency access, always have at least one admin with unrestricted door access.


---

### Managing Elevator Access

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

BioStar Air supports complete elevator access control using Suprema's OM120 module. This module allows administrators to control floor access by integrating with Suprema or Airfob access control readers. They support up to 144 floors through daisy-chained OM120 devices.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Requirements[‚Äã](#requirements "Direct link to Requirements")

To enable elevator access control, you must have:

* A Suprema **OM120** module (each supports up to 12 floors).

* A compatible Suprema or Airfob access control reader connected to the OM120.

* Proper wiring to the elevator control panel (contact your elevator manufacturer for wiring specifics).

#### Setting Up Elevator Control[‚Äã](#setting-up-elevator-control "Direct link to Setting Up Elevator Control")

To configure elevator control:

1. Go to **Device Management**.

2. Select an **Airfob Edge Reader Ultimate** that has an OM120 module connected.

3. If the OM120 module is not detected, click **Search OM120**.

4. Select the detected OM120 module(s) and click **OK**.

5. Navigate to **Elevator Management** and click **Add Elevator**.

6. Enter an **Elevator Name** and optional description.

7. Select the controlling **Airfob Edge Reader**.

8. Choose the registered OM120 module(s) for the elevator.

9. Set the **Relay Timeout** (determines how long the floor button remains active after authentication).

10. Specify the **Number of Floors** the module controls (up to 12 per OM120).

#### Naming and Configuring Floors[‚Äã](#naming-and-configuring-floors "Direct link to Naming and Configuring Floors")

Once an elevator is added, you can configure individual floors:

1. Assign names to floors (e.g., "Ground Floor," "Lobby," "Conference Level").

2. Select the relay output that corresponds to each floor's button in the elevator control panel.

3. Set a schedule for when each floor is accessible (e.g., restrict maintenance floors outside of work hours).

4. Click **Save** to finalize the elevator setup.

#### Setting Floor Access Levels[‚Äã](#setting-floor-access-levels "Direct link to Setting Floor Access Levels")

Floor access levels define which users or groups can access specific floors.

1. Go to **Access Management** ‚Üí **Floor Levels**.

2. Click **Add Floor Level**.

3. Enter a **Name** (e.g., "Security," "Cleaning Crew").

4. Assign specific floors to this access level.

5. Apply an **Access Schedule** (e.g., allow cleaning staff access only after hours).

6. Optionally, add **Holiday Groups** to restrict access on specific days.

7. Click **Save** to apply the settings.

#### Key Considerations[‚Äã](#key-considerations "Direct link to Key Considerations")

* **Wiring Requirements**: The OM120 module must be correctly wired to the elevator control panel. Contact your elevator manufacturer for wiring specifications.

* **Daisy-Chaining Modules**: Up to 12 OM120 modules can be linked to a single Airfob Edge Reader, supporting a maximum of 144 floors.

* **Schedules & Overrides**: Floor access schedules take priority, but holiday settings can override normal access rules.


---

### Managing Registered Devices

#### Overview[‚Äã](#overview "Direct link to Overview")

The BioStar Air portal and mobile app let administrators manage, update, and configure compatible Suprema readers.

Some functions ‚Äî such as **remote access**, **biometric authentication**, **QR code access**, and **firmware updates** ‚Äî require an active internet connection.

Caution

**Important**: Starting with BioStar Air 2.10 (and the BioStation 3), many new device configuration features were added. Not all devices support every feature, so menu options may vary depending on your hardware.

#### Registering & Deleting Devices[‚Äã](#registering--deleting-devices "Direct link to Registering & Deleting Devices")

Registering and deleting **must** be done from the **BioStar Air smartphone app** (iOS or Android) ‚Äî not from the web portal. Doing this on the web can cause operational errors.

<!-- -->

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Device Connection Status[‚Äã](#device-connection-status "Direct link to Device Connection Status")

In the **Device List**, the status icon tells you the device‚Äôs connectivity:

* **Green Dot**: Online via Ethernet

* **Red Dot**: Offline

* **Orange Dot**: Firmware update in progress

* ‚ö™ **No Dot**: Device without a network connection (e.g., Airfob Patch)

* ‚ö†Ô∏è **Caution Icon**: Biometric device needs to sync with the server

**Green Dot** devices can be controlled remotely, accept QR authentication, and be updated.

#### Viewing Device Info[‚Äã](#viewing-device-information "Direct link to Viewing Device Info")

Columns in the **Device List** include:

* **Product Type**: Auto-detected from Suprema's database

* **Device Nickname**: Custom label for easy recognition

* **Device ID**: Unique identifier for that device

* **Device Group**: Which group(s) it belongs to

* **Battery Status**: Only for battery-powered devices

* **Firmware Version**: Current firmware build

* **Time Zone**: Set individually per device

#### Bulk Device Actions[‚Äã](#bulk-device-actions "Direct link to Bulk Device Actions")

From the **Device List** toolbar, you can:

* **Refresh**: Update the device list & status

* **Delete**: Remove devices (always do in the app)

* **Manage Device Groups**: Assign devices to groups

* **Byte Order**: Switch between MSB / LSB

* **Sync with Server**: Sync biometric templates from device to server

* **Load Device Settings**: Import settings from devices originally set up in standalone mode

#### Editing an Individual Device[‚Äã](#editing-individual-device "Direct link to Editing an Individual Device")

1. Select the device.

2. Edit fields like **Nickname**, **Time Zone**, or **DST**.

3. Click **Save**.

#### Configuring Device Features[‚Äã](#configuring-device-features "Direct link to Configuring Device Features")

##### Device Details[‚Äã](#device-details "Direct link to Device Details")

Shows basic info: **model**, **serial number**, and **firmware version**.

**Actions**:

* Firmware update

* Reboot device

* Factory reset

**Settings**:

* **Nickname**: How it appears in lists/logs

* **Time Zone & DST**: Keeps logs consistent when site and device clocks differ

* **Hands‚ÄëFree Mode**: Extends BLE range

* **QR Reader**: Tells the device an RS‚Äë485 QR reader is connected (**disables SIO2**)

* **Beep Setting**: Controls the success chime (not on all devices)

##### Card Settings[‚Äã](#card-settings "Direct link to Card Settings")

Caution

On XPass 2 and X-Station 2, card settings appear under **Details** and support is limited. A firmware update later in 2025 will improve this.

###### NFC / RF Card[‚Äã](#nfc--rf-card "Direct link to NFC / RF Card")

* **Toggle** card authentication on/off

* **Supported types**: MIFARE, DESFire, Felica, EM4100 (BioStation 3 & BioEntry W3; more devices by end of 2025), iCLASS, SEOS, HID Prox (device‚Äëdependent)

* **Byte Order**: MSB or LSB

* **Data Reading Method**: CSN (default) or Wiegand format

  BioStar Air includes 5 built‚Äëin formats; add more under **Settings** ‚Üí **Card Format**

###### Proprietary Cards[‚Äã](#proprietary-cards "Direct link to Proprietary Cards")

Enable for iCLASS SE/SEOS and HID Prox (device‚Äëdependent)

##### Network[‚Äã](#network "Direct link to Network")

Default: **DHCP**.

Manual configuration allows:

* Static IP

* Gateway

* DNS

* Subnet mask

WLAN settings may appear, but they are not enabled at this time.

##### Authentication[‚Äã](#authentication "Direct link to Authentication")

* **Authentication Mode**: Single or multi‚Äëfactor (Face, RFID, ID, PIN)

* **Display User Name / ID**: Full, Initial, Hidden (screen devices only)

* **Authorization Timeout**: Time before returning to default screen (biometric devices only)

Appears only on devices with PIN, Face, or Fingerprint support.

##### Face Authentication[‚Äã](#face-authentication "Direct link to Face Authentication")

* Fake detection: Normal ‚Üí Most Secure

* Duplicate enrollment check (on‚Äëdevice only)

* Motion sensitivity (wake threshold)

* Head pose angle (degrees off‚Äëcenter allowed)

* Wide search (allow partially visible faces)

* Detection distance (cm)

* Enrollment time (how long enrollment mode stays active)

Biometric devices only.

###### Mask Detection[‚Äã](#mask-detection "Direct link to Mask Detection")

* **Level**: Strict ‚Üí Most Strict

* **If Fails**: Deny or allow with logging

* **Sequence**: After Access / Before Access / Without Access

"Before" vs "After" mainly matters when using non‚Äëface credentials.

##### Time & Attendance (T\&A)[‚Äã](#time--attendance-ta "Direct link to Time & Attendance (T\&A)")

When enabled, **T\&A events** are recorded in **Event Logs** and used in the **Hours on Site** report.

* **Disabled**: No T\&A

* **User Selects**: On‚Äëscreen T\&A keys (screen devices only)

* **By Schedule**: Codes vary by time of day

* **Last Choice**: Defaults to last used code

* **Fixed**: Always uses one code

* **Mobile**: Code selected in Suprema Pass app when presenting mobile credential

##### Display & Sound[‚Äã](#display--sound "Direct link to Display & Sound")

Full menu only on biometric station devices. On other devices, basic options (like Beep Settings) may be found elsewhere.

###### Display[‚Äã](#display "Direct link to Display")

* **Screensaver**: Moving clock

* **Backlight**: Always on or dim after inactivity

* **Language**: Select language

* **Home Screen Logo/Notice**: Up to 10 images or a text notice

  **Important**: After clicking **+ Update** and saving, the images/notice will no longer appear in the edit screen ‚Äî but will still display on the device.

###### Sound[‚Äã](#sound "Direct link to Sound")

* **Voice Instruction**: Speaks "Access Granted" instead of beeps (select devices only)

* **Device Volume**: Adjusts the overall volume

* **Intercom Speaker/Mic Volume**: BioStation 3 only

##### Wiegand Output[‚Äã](#wiegand-output "Direct link to Wiegand Output")

For integration with external systems (e.g., alarm panels).

* Output Mode: Normal / Bypass

* Fail codes

* Output info

* Pulse settings

* Mobile consecutive tag (requires Suprema Pass v2.9.0+)

* Consecutive tag limit

##### Intercom (BioStation 3)[‚Äã](#intercom-biostation-3 "Direct link to Intercom (BioStation 3)")

* SIP transport

* SIP address / port / registration duration

* Username / password / auth ID

* Outbound proxy

* Extensions

* Video resolution

* DTMF door opening

##### Secure Tamper[‚Äã](#secure-tamper "Direct link to Secure Tamper")

Deletes **all users**, **logs**, and **encryption keys** if triggered.

##### RTSP Streaming (BioStation 3)[‚Äã](#rtsp-streaming-biostation-3 "Direct link to RTSP Streaming (BioStation 3)")

* Address

* Port

* Credentials

* Resolution

##### Bluetooth Sensitivity[‚Äã](#bluetooth-sensitivity "Direct link to Bluetooth Sensitivity")

RSSI adjustment determines how close you must be for automatic door unlock.

* **Decrease**: Avoid unintended activations

* **Increase**: Improve detection where interference is high

#### Managing Devices in the BioStar Air App[‚Äã](#managing-devices-in-the-airfob-pro-app "Direct link to Managing Devices in the BioStar Air App")

1. Open the app

2. **All Menu** ‚Üí **Devices**

3. Filter by group as needed

4. Long‚Äëpress to select multiple devices for batch actions

#### Register a New Device[‚Äã](#registering-a-new-device "Direct link to Register a New Device")

1. Log in as an (administrator)

2. Make sure the device is online

3. Tap **+**

4. Select and **Register**

5. (Optional) Create a door

6. **OK** to confirm

#### Removing a Device[‚Äã](#removing-a-device "Direct link to Removing a Device")

1. Select device

2. Long‚Äëpress to mark for deletion

3. **‚ãÆ** ‚Üí **Delete**

4. Choose whether to delete the linked door

5. **Confirm**


---

### Managing Registered Doors

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

Door management in BioStar Air allows administrators to organize access points by assigning entry and exit devices, configuring relays, and setting up schedules. Doors provide structure for managing access and tracking user movements for security, fire muster, and time & attendance (T\&A) purposes.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to Registered Doors[‚Äã](#navigating-to-registered-doors "Direct link to Navigating to Registered Doors")

To access the registered doors screen:

1. Go to **Door Management** in the BioStar Air Portal.

2. Click on **Registered Doors** to view the list of doors.

#### Understanding the Door List[‚Äã](#understanding-the-door-list "Direct link to Understanding the Door List")

The registered doors screen displays key details:

* **Door Name**

* **Entry Device**: The reader assigned for entering.

* **Exit Device**: The reader assigned for exiting.

* **Camera**: Integrated CCTV support (if applicable).

* **Door Group**: The category assigned to the door.

* **Description**: Notes about the door‚Äôs location.

#### Managing Doors[‚Äã](#managing-doors "Direct link to Managing Doors")

When selecting a door, administrators can perform the following actions:

* **Edit**: Modify door settings.

* **Refresh**: Update the status of the door.

* **Delete**: Remove a door from the system.

* **Schedule Settings**: Assign lock/unlock schedules.

* **Manage Groups**: Organize doors into groups.

#### Editing Door Settings[‚Äã](#editing-door-settings "Direct link to Editing Door Settings")

To modify door settings:

1. Select a door from the list.

2. Update the **Door Name** and **Description**.

3. Assign devices:

   * **Entry Device**: The reader used for entry.

   * **Exit Device**: The reader used for exit.

   * **Camera**: Attach a CCTV camera for event logging.

4. Specify relay settings:

   * Select the **Relay Device** that controls the door lock.

   * Enable **Relay Ignoring Door Sensor** for troubleshooting.

5. Configure additional settings:

   * Assign an **Exit Button** if one is installed.

   * Define the **Door Sensor** input.

   * Set the **Open Time** (default: 3 seconds).

6. Click **Save** to apply changes.

#### Setting Door Schedules[‚Äã](#setting-door-schedules "Direct link to Setting Door Schedules")

Doors can be assigned schedules for automated locking and unlocking:

* **Unlock Schedule**: The door remains open during set hours.

* **Lock Schedule**: The door remains locked during set hours.

* **Unlock After First Authentication**: The door unlocks only after the first user authenticates, useful for office and retail settings.

#### Adding a New Door[‚Äã](#adding-a-new-door "Direct link to Adding a New Door")

To create a new door:

1. Click **Add Door**.

2. Enter a **Door Name**.

3. Select an **Entry Device** and **Exit Device**.

4. Assign a **Camera** if available.

5. Click **Save** to finalize the door setup.

#### Key Issues and Considerations[‚Äã](#key-issues-and-considerations "Direct link to Key Issues and Considerations")

##### Using Entry and Exit Devices[‚Äã](#using-entry-and-exit-devices "Direct link to Using Entry and Exit Devices")

* It is recommended to use the relay on the **exit device** since this relay will be inside the secure perimeter.

* Entry and exit devices must have **separate network connections**. They cannot be linked via Wiegand or RS-485 in a master-slave arrangement.

##### Device Assignment Rules[‚Äã](#device-assignment-rules "Direct link to Device Assignment Rules")

* Each device can only be assigned to **one door**.

* If a device is already registered but does not appear in the list of available devices, check whether it is assigned to another door. If so, remove it from that door before reassigning.

#### Managing Doors in the BioStar Air App[‚Äã](#managing-doors-in-the-airfob-pro-app "Direct link to Managing Doors in the BioStar Air App")

Administrators can manage doors directly from the BioStar Air mobile app:

1. Open the **BioStar Air** app.

2. Go to **All Menu** ‚Üí **Access Points** ‚Üí **Doors**.

3. View all registered doors and filter by group.

4. Tap a door to edit settings such as:

   * Entry and exit devices

   * Relay settings

   * Exit button and door sensor configurations

5. To add a new door, tap the **Plus (+) button** and enter the required details.


---

### Managing Roll Call & Fire Muster

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The Roll Call & Fire Muster feature in BioStar Air allows organizations to track which employees have safely exited a building during an emergency. By setting up muster points and using the BioStar Air app, administrators can quickly account for all users and generate roll call history reports.

#### Setting Up Muster Points[‚Äã](#setting-up-muster-points "Direct link to Setting Up Muster Points")

A muster point is a designated area where users can tap their credentials to mark themselves as safe during an emergency.

1. Go to **Advanced** ‚Üí **Roll Call** in the BioStar Air portal.

2. Click **Add Muster Point**.

3. Enter a **Name** (e.g., "East Parking Lot").

4. Enter an optional **Description** (e.g., "Third pillar in the parking structure").

5. Add devices:

   * Click **Add Device** to assign a specific reader.

   * Alternatively, select a **Device Group** to include multiple muster point readers.

6. Add user groups:

   * Select **User Groups** that should report to this muster point.

   * Click **Add** after each selection.

7. Click **Save** to finalize the muster point setup.

##### Best Practices for Muster Points[‚Äã](#best-practices "Direct link to Best Practices for Muster Points")

* Use **device groups** instead of individual devices to allow multiple muster points.

* Ensure that **only relevant users** are assigned to specific muster points, especially in large campuses with multiple buildings.

* Wired access control readers support both **mobile and card authentication**, while Airfob Tag and Airfob Patch require mobile credentials.

#### Starting a Roll Call in the BioStar Air App[‚Äã](#starting-a-roll-call-in-the-biostar-air-app "Direct link to Starting a Roll Call in the BioStar Air App")

To initiate a roll call using the BioStar Air mobile app:

1. Open the BioStar Air app.

2. Go to **All Menu** ‚Üí **Roll Call** (under Advanced Features).

3. Press **Roll Call Start**.

4. The system will display a list of all users currently on-site.

##### Marking Users Safe[‚Äã](#marking-users-safe "Direct link to Marking Users Safe")

Users can mark themselves safe by:

* Tapping their credential at an assigned muster point.

* Administrators manually marking users safe by pressing and holding the **Checkmark** button next to their name.

##### Tracking Roll Call Progress[‚Äã](#tracking-roll-call-progress "Direct link to Tracking Roll Call Progress")

* Users can be filtered by their **Muster Group**.

* The search function allows finding specific individuals.

* The roll call is complete when:

  * All users are marked safe.

  * An administrator manually marks all users as safe.

  * 24 hours pass without completion.

#### Viewing Roll Call History[‚Äã](#viewing-roll-call-history "Direct link to Viewing Roll Call History")

To check past roll calls:

1. Go to **Roll Call** in the BioStar Air portal.

2. Click the **History** tab.

3. Select a completed roll call to view:

   * A list of all logged access events during the roll call.

   * Details on whether users were marked safe or unaccounted for.

   * Time of roll call initiation and completion.

#### Key Considerations[‚Äã](#key-considerations "Direct link to Key Considerations")

* **Ensure muster points are properly assigned** to user groups to prevent confusion.

* **Test the Roll Call feature** regularly to ensure smooth operation in case of an actual emergency.

* **Access logs** can be used to verify attendance for compliance with safety regulations.


---

### Managing Sites with your Phone

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The BioStar Air app provides full functionality equivalent to the BioStar Air web portal. Users can manage access control, monitor event logs, control devices, and perform administrative tasks directly from their mobile devices.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to the Feature[‚Äã](#navigating-to-the-feature "Direct link to Navigating to the Feature")

To start using the BioStar Air app:

* Download and install the BioStar Air app on your mobile device.

  * [iOS](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/airfob-pro/id1659959609)

  * [Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mocainc.afs2pro)

* Log in using the same ID and password as the web version.

#### Step-by-Step Instructions[‚Äã](#step-by-step-instructions "Direct link to Step-by-Step Instructions")

##### Dashboard Overview[‚Äã](#dashboard-overview "Direct link to Dashboard Overview")

After logging in, you will land on the **Dashboard**, which displays:

* Connected cameras (if any).

* Daily user tag-in count.

* Total registered active users.

* Number of connected devices.

* Credit status.

##### User Management[‚Äã](#user-management "Direct link to User Management")

1. Navigate to the **User** tab.

2. Select a user to view their details.

3. You can modify user status (Reissue, Suspend, Delete, or Activate).

4. To add a new user, tap the **+** button and complete the necessary details.

##### Monitoring[‚Äã](#monitoring "Direct link to Monitoring")

The **Monitoring** tab provides:

* Event logs.

* Door status.

* Live video (if cameras are connected).

##### Accessing More Features[‚Äã](#accessing-more-features "Direct link to Accessing More Features")

Tap the **hamburger menu** for a full list of features, including:

###### Devices[‚Äã](#devices "Direct link to Devices")

1. View all registered devices.

2. Select a device to edit, update firmware, or reboot.

3. Use **BLE mode** for device updates when not connected to a network (proximity required).

4. To add a new device, tap the **+** button.

###### Doors[‚Äã](#doors "Direct link to Doors")

1. View door status and control settings.

2. Tap once to edit a door or tap and hold to select multiple doors for bulk actions.

3. Delete doors if needed.

###### Event Logs[‚Äã](#event-logs "Direct link to Event Logs")

1. Filter logs based on specific criteria.

2. Check door status and remotely control doors.

3. Set doors to **Unlock Mode** or **Lock Mode**, overriding the relay settings or schedule.

4. Start a **Roll Call**. For more information, refer to [the following](/docs/en/platform/biostar_air/managing-roll-call-fire-muster).

#### Common Issues & Considerations[‚Äã](#common-issues-considerations "Direct link to Common Issues & Considerations")

* Ensure you log in with the same credentials as the web version.

* For BLE mode updates, be in close proximity to the device.

* Some features, such as live video monitoring, require connected cameras.


---

### Managing User Groups

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

User groups in BioStar Air allow administrators to categorize users based on departments, roles, or other classifications. This helps in organizing and managing access control more efficiently.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to User Groups[‚Äã](#navigating-to-user-groups "Direct link to Navigating to User Groups")

To manage user groups:

1. Go to **User Management** in the BioStar Air Portal.

2. Click on **User Groups** to view existing groups.

3. Here, you can **add**, **edit**, or **delete** user groups.

#### Creating a User Group[‚Äã](#creating-a-user-group "Direct link to Creating a User Group")

To create a new user group:

1. Click on **Add User Group**.

2. Enter a name for the group (e.g., "Law Team").

3. Click **OK** to create the group.

#### Assigning Users to a Group[‚Äã](#assigning-users-to-a-group "Direct link to Assigning Users to a Group")

Once a user group is created, users can be added by:

1. Going to **Users** under **User Management**.

2. Selecting the users to be assigned.

3. Clicking on **Manage Group**.

4. Choosing the user group and confirming by clicking **OK**.

Returning to the **User Groups** interface will reflect the updated total number of users in each group.

#### Creating Subgroups[‚Äã](#creating-subgroups "Direct link to Creating Subgroups")

Subgroups allow further categorization within a user group. However, subgroups are **not hierarchical**, meaning users in a subgroup are not automatically included in the parent group.

##### To create a subgroup:[‚Äã](#to-create-a-subgroup: "Direct link to To create a subgroup:")

1. Select the parent group.

2. Click **Add Subgroup** and enter a name (e.g., "Civil Law Team").

3. Click **OK** to create the subgroup.

##### Assigning Users to a Subgroup:[‚Äã](#assigning-users-to-a-subgroup: "Direct link to Assigning Users to a Subgroup:")

1. Go to **Users** under **User Management**.

2. Select the users to be added.

3. Click **Manage Group**.

4. Select the subgroup under its parent group and click **OK**.

#### Understanding User Group Totals[‚Äã](#understanding-user-group-totals "Direct link to Understanding User Group Totals")

Since user groups are not hierarchical:

* Users in a subgroup do **not** automatically appear in the parent group.

* The total user count for a parent group does not include subgroup members unless manually added.

* Selecting a subgroup will only display users assigned specifically to that subgroup.

#### Can a user belong to multiple user groups?[‚Äã](#can-a-user-belong-to-multiple-user-groups "Direct link to Can a user belong to multiple user groups?")

**Yes**. Users in BioStar Air can be members of **multiple user groups**.

In BioStar 2, user groups were typically tied to a single department. BioStar Air decouples this, allowing more dynamic usage:

* Filter the user list by group (e.g., "HR Department") to quickly manage access levels.

* Create context-specific groups (e.g., "Men's Locker Room") that cut across departments.

* Use user groups in **event log filters** and **report generation**.

* Assign user groups to **muster point** devices or device groups for targeted safety protocols.

This flexibility makes it easier to manage overlapping user roles and access scenarios.


---

### Managing Users

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

User management in BioStar Air allows administrators to oversee and configure users who access sites using the Suprema Pass app or other access credentials. Users are assigned unique credentials that grant them access to designated locations.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to User Management[‚Äã](#navigating-to-user-management "Direct link to Navigating to User Management")

To manage users:

1. Go to **User Management** in the BioStar Air Portal.

2. Click on **Users** to view the list of registered users.

#### User Information Overview[‚Äã](#user-information-overview "Direct link to User Information Overview")

In the user list, you can view essential details for each user, including:

* **User Type**: Regular or Temporary (introduced in BioStar Air 2.6).

* **Name**: The full name of the user.

* **Unique ID**: The identification number assigned to each user.

* **Card Type**: The type of credential issued to the user.

* **Validity**: The expiration status of the issued credential.

* **Status**: Whether the user is *activated* or *deactivated*.

* **User Group**: The group to which the user belongs.

* **Access Levels**: The access permissions assigned to the user.

#### Managing Users[‚Äã](#managing-users "Direct link to Managing Users")

##### Performing Bulk Actions[‚Äã](#performing-bulk-actions "Direct link to Performing Bulk Actions")

To perform actions on multiple users at once:

1. Select users by clicking on their checkboxes.

2. Choose from the available bulk actions:

   * **Activate**: Enable selected users.

   * **Reissue**: Send a new email with updated credentials.

   * **Suspend**: Temporarily disable users.

   * **Delete**: Remove users permanently.

##### Managing User Groups[‚Äã](#managing-user-groups "Direct link to Managing User Groups")

To assign users to a group:

1. Select the users you want to modify.

2. Click on the **User Group** icon.

3. Select the desired group and confirm the changes.

##### Setting Access Levels[‚Äã](#setting-access-levels "Direct link to Setting Access Levels")

To configure access levels for multiple users:

1. Select the users you want to modify.

2. Click on the **Access Level** icon.

3. Choose the appropriate access level and confirm.

##### Customizing User Templates[‚Äã](#customizing-user-templates "Direct link to Customizing User Templates")

To create or modify user fields:

1. Click on **User Template**.

2. Add or edit fields that will appear on each user‚Äôs profile card.

##### Exporting and Uploading Data[‚Äã](#exporting-and-uploading-data "Direct link to Exporting and Uploading Data")

* To export selected users, click on the **Export** icon.

* To bulk upload profile pictures, click on **Image Upload**.

##### Filtering Users[‚Äã](#filtering-users "Direct link to Filtering Users")

To filter users based on specific criteria:

1. Use filters such as **Card Type** (e.g., RFID card), **User Status**, or **User Group**.

2. Click **OK** to apply the filter.

3. To remove filters, click **Clear Filters** and confirm.

#### Viewing and Editing Individual User Profiles[‚Äã](#viewing-and-editing-individual-user-profiles "Direct link to Viewing and Editing Individual User Profiles")

To access a user‚Äôs detailed profile:

1. Click on the user‚Äôs name in the user list.

2. View and modify user information, including their assigned card and credentials.

3. Perform actions such as:

   * **Activate**: Enable the user.

   * **Reissue**: Send updated credentials.

   * **Suspend**: Temporarily block access.

   * **Delete**: Remove the user permanently.

You can also edit any user information by clicking the **Edit** button.

#### Adding Credentials[‚Äã](#adding-credentials "Direct link to Adding Credentials")

Under **Credential Details**, administrators can decide which types of credentials to assign to users. Each credential type includes a toggle switch to enable or disable it.

First, select if the user is **Regular** or **Temporary**:

* **Regular users** can have any supported credential type.

* **Temporary users** can only receive **Web Card** credentials, which include Dynamic QR codes and LinkPass.

##### Credential Types[‚Äã](#credential-types "Direct link to Credential Types")

* **Mobile Card**: Suprema Pass mobile credential. Admins can edit the Card ID number.

* **RF Card**: Add up to 8 RFID cards per user. Configure card type (CSN / Wiegand), Card ID number, and Card Name to simplify managing multiple cards. You can also scan a physical RFID card using a connected reader by clicking **Scan with Reader** and selecting the reader.

* **Web Card**: LinkPass or Dynamic QR.

  Dynamic QR only appears if QR is enabled under Site Settings.

* **Face**: Add up to two face profile images. Options include uploading an existing image, enrolling via a reader, or sending a link via email for self-enrollment using a phone's selfie camera.

* **PIN**: Set a 4‚Äì16 digit PIN for use as part of two-factor authentication (2FA).

#### Access Details[‚Äã](#access-details "Direct link to Access Details")

##### Credential Validity Period[‚Äã](#credential-validity-period "Direct link to Credential Validity Period")

Set a start date (**required**) and an optional end date for the user‚Äôs credentials. After setting a start date, use shortcut buttons for common end dates: **+1D**, **+3D**, **+1W**, **+1Y**, **Manual**, or **Infinite**.

##### Access Levels[‚Äã](#access-levels "Direct link to Access Levels")

Access levels can be assigned permanently (expire with the credential) or temporarily (expire earlier than the credential).

###### Next step

[In the next guide, we will cover how to add a new user in BioStar Air.](/docs/en/platform/biostar_air/adding-individual-users)


---

### Monitoring Door Status

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The Door Status feature in BioStar Air provides real-time monitoring of doors connected to the system. Administrators can check whether doors are locked or unlocked, view door sensor status, and remotely control access by locking or unlocking doors.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Monitoring Door Status in the Web Portal[‚Äã](#monitoring-door-status-web-portal "Direct link to Monitoring Door Status in the Web Portal")

To access door status in the BioStar Air web portal:

1. Go to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Door Status**.

2. The system will display a list of doors currently connected.

##### Understanding Door Status Indicators[‚Äã](#understanding-door-status-indicators "Direct link to Understanding Door Status Indicators")

Each door entry includes:

* **Relay Status**: Indicates whether the door is locked or unlocked.

* **Door Sensor**: Shows whether the door is physically open or closed.

##### Remotely Unlocking a Door[‚Äã](#remotely-unlocking-a-door "Direct link to Remotely Unlocking a Door")

If a door is online and connected to BioStar Air, you can unlock it remotely:

1. Click the **Open Door** button.

2. The relay status will update to **Unlocked**.

3. After a set duration, the door will return to its locked state.

##### Permanently Unlocking a Door[‚Äã](#permanently-unlocking-a-door "Direct link to Permanently Unlocking a Door")

To keep a door unlocked indefinitely:

1. Click the **Menu** icon next to the door.

2. Select **Unlock Mode**.

3. The relay will remain in an unlocked state.

To restore normal operation, select **Release** in the menu.

##### Forcing a Door to Lock[‚Äã](#forcing-a-door-to-lock "Direct link to Forcing a Door to Lock")

To lock a door regardless of the current schedule:

1. Click the **Menu** icon next to the door.

2. Select **Lock Mode**.

3. The relay will switch to a locked state, preventing entry.

To release the door back to normal operation, click **Release**.

#### Monitoring Door Status in the BioStar Air App[‚Äã](#monitoring-door-status-app "Direct link to Monitoring Door Status in the BioStar Air App")

To check door status using the BioStar Air mobile app:

1. Open the BioStar Air app.

2. Tap the **Monitoring** tab at the bottom of the screen.

3. Select **Door Status**.

4. The system will display all doors currently connected.

##### Viewing Door Information[‚Äã](#viewing-door-information "Direct link to Viewing Door Information")

The app provides the following details for each door:

* **Door Name**

* **Group Assignment**

* **Relay Status** (Locked/Unlocked)

* **Door Sensor** (Open/Closed)

##### Controlling Door Access from the App[‚Äã](#controlling-door-access-app "Direct link to Controlling Door Access from the App")

If the door is connected to the network, you can:

* **Tap Open** to remotely unlock the door.

* **Set Lock/Unlock Modes** to override schedules.

* **Release** a locked or unlocked mode to return to normal operation.

##### Refreshing Door Status[‚Äã](#refreshing-door-status "Direct link to Refreshing Door Status")

To update the current status of doors:

1. Tap the **Refresh** button at the top of the screen.

2. The system will retrieve the latest status of all doors.


---

### Event Logs and Audit Logs

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

One of the main advantages of a Cloud Access Control Platform is the ability to monitor site activity from anywhere. This guide covers how to use **Event Logs** and **Audit Logs** in BioStar Air. Note: Door status monitoring is covered separately.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Navigating to Event Logs[‚Äã](#navigating-to-event-logs "Direct link to Navigating to Event Logs")

To check event logs:

1. Navigate to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Event Logs**.

2. The interface displays a table with details such as event time, event name, door location, device nickname, user type, and username.

3. Customize columns by clicking **Customize**, toggling columns on or off, and clicking **Apply**.

#### Filtering Event Logs[‚Äã](#filtering-event-logs "Direct link to Filtering Event Logs")

To filter logs:

1. Click **Filter**.

2. Select event types (e.g., Access Denied, Authentication Failed, Door Open, etc.).

3. Filter by user groups, user types (regular or temporary), device groups, device ID, or device nickname.

4. Click **Apply** to update the logs.

#### Sorting and Managing Logs[‚Äã](#sorting-and-managing-logs "Direct link to Sorting and Managing Logs")

* Sort logs by date by selecting a date and time range, then clicking **Apply**.

* Reset filters by clicking **Filters** ‚Üí **Clear all** ‚Üí **Apply**.

* Reset date filters by clicking **Reset**.

* Save specific views by applying filters and clicking **Save**.

* Export logs by clicking **Export**.

* Refresh logs by clicking **Refresh** or enabling **Auto Refresh** (adjustable between 5 seconds and 1 minute).

#### Using Audit Logs[‚Äã](#using-audit-logs "Direct link to Using Audit Logs")

Audit logs track actions performed by admins on the platform.

##### Accessing Audit Logs[‚Äã](#accessing-audit-logs "Direct link to Accessing Audit Logs")

1. Navigate to **Monitoring** ‚Üí **Audit Logs**.

2. The interface displays information such as:

   * Admin name

   * Action time

   * Source account

   * Admin role

   * Action type

   * Details of the action

##### Filtering and Managing Audit Logs[‚Äã](#filtering-and-managing-audit-logs "Direct link to Filtering and Managing Audit Logs")

1. Click **Filter**.

2. Select filters such as account names, admin types, action types, and categories.

3. Click **Apply Filter** to update the logs.

4. Sort logs by date range.

5. Save filter selections for future use.

6. Clear filters by clicking **Clear Filter**.

7. Refresh logs by clicking **Refresh** to load the latest entries.

#### Using Event Logs in the BioStar Air Mobile App[‚Äã](#using-event-logs-in-the-biostar-air-mobile-app "Direct link to Using Event Logs in the BioStar Air Mobile App")

1. Tap **Monitoring** at the bottom of the screen.

2. Select **Event Logs**.

3. Scroll through the event logs.

4. Modify the view by tapping **Filter** and selecting:

   * Event period

   * Event types

   * User groups

   * User types

5. Clear or save filter selections for later use.

6. Update event logs by tapping **Update** at the top of the page.

7. Search logs to find specific events.


---

### Opening Doors with Mobile Credentials

#### Feature Overview[‚Äã](#feature-overview "Direct link to Feature Overview")

The Suprema Pass app provides a convenient way to open doors using mobile credentials instead of plastic RFID cards. Users can authenticate using Bluetooth or NFC by tagging their smartphone near an access control device or by using a long-press method.

Customers who began using BioStar Air access control before May 2025 may still be using the Airfob Space app, which has since been rebranded as the Suprema Pass app. Both apps offer identical functionality and are fully compatible. There is no need for existing users to switch ‚Äî mobile credentials work seamlessly across both.

#### Methods to Open Doors[‚Äã](#methods-to-open-doors "Direct link to Methods to Open Doors")

##### Tagging Your Smartphone to the Airfob Device[‚Äã](#tagging-your-smartphone-to-the-airfob-device "Direct link to Tagging Your Smartphone to the Airfob Device")

This method enables direct authentication via Bluetooth or NFC by bringing the smartphone close to the access control reader.

* **Bluetooth Mode**: The phone communicates wirelessly with the Airfob device.

* **NFC Mode**: Available only on Android devices, allowing authentication by touching the phone to the reader.

##### Long-Press Your Mobile Card[‚Äã](#long-press-your-mobile-card "Direct link to Long-Press Your Mobile Card")

Users can open doors from a short distance by holding their finger on the mobile card within the app for a few seconds while near the Airfob device.

#### Tagging to the Device[‚Äã](#tagging-to-the-device "Direct link to Tagging to the Device")

The Suprema Pass (or Airfob Space) app must be running to use mobile credentials. Users can choose between two operation modes:

* **Foreground Mode**: Doors open only if the app is on-screen and the mobile card is visible.

* **Background Mode**: Doors open even when the phone is locked, as long as the app is running in the background.

Regardless of the mode, users can always authenticate by tagging their phone to the device.

##### Authentication Contact Points[‚Äã](#authentication-contact-points "Direct link to Authentication Contact Points")

The smartphone's NFC or Bluetooth antenna location may vary by model. Refer to your device specifications for the best contact point.

#### Using the Long-Press Method[‚Äã](#using-the-long-press-method "Direct link to Using the Long-Press Method")

To open a door with the long-press method:

1. Ensure the app screen is turned on.

2. Hold your finger on the mobile card while near the access control reader.

3. The door will unlock, allowing you to walk through.

##### Considerations for Long-Press Mode[‚Äã](#considerations-for-long-press-mode "Direct link to Considerations for Long-Press Mode")

* **Bluetooth must be set to Background Mode**. This can be adjusted in the Connection Method menu.

* **Site administrators may disable this feature** for security reasons.

* The **effective range varies** depending on smartphone Bluetooth strength.

* Nearby access control readers may cause unintended authentication.


---
